text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/KM2xLUZZg2Q/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KM2xLUZZg2Q?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">THE FLUFFED SKIRTS ARE REMOVED TO CHECK OUT THE LEG MOVEMENTS &nbsp;- ASHTAKALASHAM &nbsp;</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fundamental unit of\nrhythm is the Kalasams.&nbsp; Multiple\nKalasams are sometimes used and these conclude in multiples of three or as\nmentioned above making them longer than the smaller units. Valiya Kalasams are\nthe bigger Kalasams.&nbsp; . The longest and\nlargest Kalasam is the Asthakalasam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/NSSLH6pHgBs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/NSSLH6pHgBs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This includes the\ncombination of 8 units that are different in each nature and constituting a\nChampa Tala or a 10-beat metrical cycle. The point to be noted is the fact the\npassages of nritta are a part of the whole dramatic spectacle. The Kalasams\nwork in moods (Bhava) that are usually emotional.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/OdjO28MwCGU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/OdjO28MwCGU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The accompanying music\ncomes to logical finishing, when their cycles complete, with a 'Kalasam' played\non percussion instruments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/kqH0WkWwU1w/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/kqH0WkWwU1w?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalasam in narration\ncomes as an alienation device that makes the audience aware of themselves.\nKalasam distances the audience from the story. It is a deliberate break of\nnarrative.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Valiya ( big ) Kalasams\nare delivered in scenes of heroism or battle whereas the Araddis Kalasams are\ndelivered in scenes of romance or heroism and the Ashta kalasams are delivered\nonly at particular occasions of joy..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mood of this dance always matches\nthat of the character.&nbsp; There are several\nvariations in 'Kalasam' called, Iratty, Vattam etc.. The lengthiest among these\nis Ashtakalasam.. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The steps are composed in the \u2018Champa\u2019 rhythm and require\ngreat mastery for an artiste to perform. Each performance ends in Astakalaasam\nof huge movements, rhythm, orchestra, dance, music and moods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>KATHAKALI DELIVERS ULTIMATE CATHARSIS .<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>DURING THE THREE HOUR PERIOD WHEN DANCERS ARE\nUNDERGOING MAKE UP\u2014THERE IS ABSOLUTE SILENCE<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>DURING THE PERFORMANCE THERE IN NO CLAPPING\u2014 JUST\nA TRANSFIXED APPRECIATIVE AUDIENCE WHO KNOWS THE INTRICACIES AND SUBTLETIES<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>LIGHTING IS JUST ONE SINGLE LAMP CALLED KALI\nVILAKKU ( NILA VILAKKU ) WITH FAT WICKS AND A LARGE RESERVOIR OF COCONUT OIL \u2026&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THE FLAMES WEAVE AROUND CASTING EERIE SHADOWS\n, REFLECTING ON THE SWEAT OF THE FACE OF THE DANCERS .<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THE AUDIENCEs EYES ARE AT THE LEVEL OF THE\nFLAMES\u2014 THE LAMP COMES UP TO THE WAIST OF THE DANCERS\u2014 INDEED THE LIGHT\nSOURCING IS HYPNOTIC \u2013THE DANCE IS BEST DONE ON DARK NEW MOON DAYS<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THE PLAY STARTS AT 10 PM AND CONTINUES TILL\nDAWN</b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">WHEN THE SHOW IS OVER , THE SUN PEEPS AND A\nNEW </span><span style=\"font-size: 18.6667px;\">AUSPICIOUS</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;DAY STARTS \u2013 &nbsp;WITH THE EVIL FORCES CONQUERED ON STAGE, &nbsp;BY THE GOOD FORCES</span></b></span></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">WHEN THE DRUM BEATS CEASE THE AUDIENCE WAKES\nUP FROM A MAGICAL REVERIE , EXHAUSTED BUT &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 18.6667px;\">TRIUMPHANT</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;AS IS THEY HAVE DANCED WITH THE GODS\n. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THERE IS A SPRING IN THEIR STEP , WHILE THEY\nWEND THEIR WAY HOME , DEEP IN THOUGHT, &nbsp;CHEWING THE CUD&nbsp;</span></b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is NO written or\noral invitation. &nbsp;Anybody can come to the\ntemple for the Kathakali performance .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kalikottu\nis the first event of the play.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Kalikottu\nis carried out by playing drums (maddalams), gong (chengala) and cymbals\n(elathalam) in the evening before dusk at the East Nada of the temple.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is\nto inform the people in the neighborhood about the Kathakali performance\nscheduled in the night. Kali Vilakku ( oil lamp ) is lit and kept in front of\nperformance space in the temple on the north side of the Sanctum Sanctorum as\nper Vaastu.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People come and squat on the ground . There are no chairs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">Below: Kali kottu --the invitation--the sound carries far</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VGixwgMr3Eo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/VGixwgMr3Eo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">IN KENDRIYA\nVIDYALAYA , WE HAD KALARI PERFORMED BY OUTSIDE EXPERTS DURING SCHOOL HOURS ,\nWHEN WE HAD A NORTH INDIAN PRINCIPAL ( GUPTA JI ).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">I USED TO WONDER , WHY THE FUCK , KATHAKALI\nDANCERS WERE WRIGGLING THEIR EYEBROWS .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">GUPTAJI ( a very smart and tough bloke ) USED TO SAY\u2014<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> \u201cALL THY ESSTUDIANTS OF THY\nESSCHOOL\u201d</span>( all the students of the school )&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Kathakali Man is the most beautiful of\nmen--because his body is his soul.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Underneath that gaudy outfit lies a\nsupremely fit , determined , talented and level headed man..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A Kathakali actor needs immense powers of\nconcentration, skill, patience and physical stamina..and of course the ability to\nsacrifice .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali dance-drama is like a clear blue deep\nocean- don\u2019t muddy it by using Rothschild\u2019s creations Jayadeva, &nbsp;DASA nonsense and Shakespeare\u2019s mindless shallow plays!\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali MUST draw from the bottomless well\nof our ancient puranas chronicling the lives, loves and conflicts of the gods\nand heroes of Indian mythology.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali provides a window into our glorious past\n\u2013 here is an opportunity to understand our ancient heritage that has been preserved\nfor millenniums..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali expresses emotions that go beyond words\u2014and how !&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;The ancient &nbsp;temple rituals, first performed in secret,\nevolved into a vibrant drama that embraces the essence of what it is to be\nhuman.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">Let us not create situation where Kathakali can draw an audience only if\nthe dancer shows his balls and asshole\u2013 like Madonna or Lady Gaga or Miley Ray\nCyrus.</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-il134DaVouQ/WOKRez0QZuI/AAAAAAABSBo/X9hcJyaH_wM_EtqybJO66X4SeNTV31GowCLcB/s1600/d6e91f6c406s75cf2c086cb76dfd027ad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-il134DaVouQ/WOKRez0QZuI/AAAAAAABSBo/X9hcJyaH_wM_EtqybJO66X4SeNTV31GowCLcB/s1600/d6e91f6c406s75cf2c086cb76dfd027ad.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Miley Ray Cyrus was\nranked number thirteen on Forbes' Celebrity 100 in 2010, and in 2013 was\ndeclared \"Artist of the Year\" by MTV. &nbsp; &nbsp;She has been included on the\nTime 100 list of most influential people in 2008 and 2014. &nbsp;&nbsp;She is a top US icon-- Skidmore College, New York\nstarted offering a special topics sociology course entitled \"The Sociology\nof Miley Cyrus: Race, Class, Gender and Media\" which was \"using Miley\nas a lens through which to explore sociological thinking about identity,\nentertainment, media and fame\". &nbsp;Miley Ray Cyrus has an equals sign tattooed on\nher ring finger in support of same-sex marriage. &nbsp; In a TV interview she said \u201cI\njust love getting stoned.\" &nbsp; PETA named Cyrus the Sexiest Celebrity of 2015.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">QUOTE ---- Leela\nSamson's appointment as chairperson of the Censor Board has raised the question\nas to whether the well-known Bharatanatyam dancer will have time to devote to\nher new assignment. &nbsp;Last year, Samson\nwas appointed chairperson of the Sangeet Natak Akademi, another prestigious\nposition . The academy is the apex body for the performing arts. Samson is also\nex-officio head of the south zone cultural centre. Apart from these\ncommitments, she has a full-time job as director of Kalakshetra in Chennai.\nSamson, who was once Priyanka Gandhi's dance teacher, has no particular\nconnection with the world of cinema. After her appointment, Samson candidly\nadmitted that she seldom watches films.[24]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSamson's tenures at Kalakshetra, Sangeet Natak Akademi and the censor\nboard were mired with many controversies amid allegations of corruption,[25]\nillegal appointments and arbitrary awarding of contracts,[26] financial\nirregularities,[27] and anti-Hindu bias.[28] Samson was criticized by the\nVishwa Hindu Parishad when she passed the 2014 Aamir Khan-starrer movie PK\nwithout any cuts, even after two board members resigned after it was granted\ncertification, due to content allegedly designed to ridicule Hindu religious\nphilosophy and hurt Hindu sentiments. Veteran Bollywood actor and a former\nchairperson of the censor board Anupam Kher criticized Samson for playing\npolitics by making partisan allegations while tendering her\nresignation.[29][30]UNQUOTE&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>BHAAD\nMEIN GAYE , SANSKARI CENSOR !</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">TILL TODAY NOWBODY HAS WRITTEN OR SAID THAT\nKATHAKALI PREDATES NATYA SHASTRA EVEN AT THE ORAL STAGE . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">NATYASHASTRA\nWAS PENNED DOWN IN 5000 BC .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">NATYASHASTRA IS NOT WRITTEN BY SOME IMAGINARY\nBHARTA MUNI.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">BHARATANATYAM HAS NOTHING\nTO DO WITH BHARATA MUNI. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE COMBO BHA-\nRA- THA MEANS SOMETHING ELSE&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IN NATYASHASTRA ABHINAYA ( PLAY ACTING ) HAS\nFOUR DIVISIONS AS PER VERSE &nbsp; &nbsp;\u201c<b><span style=\"color: red;\">ANGIKO &nbsp;VACHIKASCHAIVA &nbsp;AHARYO &nbsp;SATWIKA </span></b>\u201c.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Kathakali ignores Vachika \u2013the Kathakali\nactors are quiet on stage&nbsp; . The dancer\ndoes not sing \u2013the singer does NOT dance</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Natyashastra describes how the actor should\ndeal with dialogue rendering and voice&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">modulations with his own effort. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">Kathakali has liberated itself for sustaining\nthe sheer magnitude of acting and dancing .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Totally freed nay LIBERATED from the\ncomplications and nuances of of dialogues, the dancer can focus is attention on\nmore important matters like eye and facial expressions. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dancing for eight hours continuously in such\na rigorous manner cannot be done by all. &nbsp; The muscles and ligaments have been\nstretched by painful chavitti uzhichal ( foot massage ) from a young age during\n8 years of relentless training.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nKathakali actors though he does NOT show is often breathless due to extreme physical\n.&nbsp; Kathakali\u2019s expressional acting would\nnever be appreciated if major portion of the actors energies went into\ndialogues or songs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In Natyashastra , Satwikabhinaya is\nconsidered a vital part of abhinaya . The rest of Indian classical dance\nfollows this , except Kathakali.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Bhava and Rasa are mutually dependent..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nperformer or producer, be it an actor, dancer, singer, instrumentalist, or\nstage craftsmen, should be conscious of the sthayi bhava and the rasa that they\nare striving to establish.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This will help them realize their 'siddhi' through\n'Rasotpatti'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As metioned in part 1 of this blog series -- Natyashastra\nclassifies the Rasa under eight categories (ashtarasa) and gives the\ncorresponding Bhava which gives rise to the rasa. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These are known as Sthayi Bhava or pervading\nstable emotion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They are rati(love), hasa(mirth), shoka(grief), krodha(anger),\nutsaha(heroism), bhaya(fear), jugupsa(disgust), and vismaya(wonder). The\ncorresponding eight Rasa are sringara(amorous), hasya(humorous),\nkaruna(pathetic), raudra(furious), vira(valorous), bhayanaka(horrific),\nbibhatsa(repugnant), and adbhuta(wondrous).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There are three types of Bhava, namely,\nSthayi (eight types), Vyabhichari (thirty three), and Satvika (eight), totaling\nto forty-nine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Satvika bhava are the physical manifestation of intense\nemotion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They are sthamba(petrification), sveda(perspiration),\nromancha(horripilation), svarabheda(voice change), vepathu(trembling),\nvaivarnya(facial colour change), asru(weeping), and pralaya(fainting).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is an\namazing analysis of human emotions put in a nutshell !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Satwikas are physical\nmanifestations/exhibitions of mental/emotional conditions. Natyashastra enumerates\neight satwikas starting from sthambha to pralaya. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But hey--\nKathakali ignores four of them. Natyashastra says that sweda (perspiration) to\nbe shown on the body by the actor to convince that he is in a deep sweat.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Kathakali actor show very little skin\u2014his\nentire body is cocooned in &nbsp;elaborate\ndressing, costumes and ornamentation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The very next satwika is romancha ( hair\nstands as spikes ). Where can you see romancha on a Kathakali actor ?</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">On his fuckin' eye balls ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Kathakali actor indeed shows the angika\nof romancha with vibration of shoulder\u2014as people who understand Kathakali\u2019s nueances\npick this up in a jiffy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Another satwika is swarabhanga (cracked words\nfrom broken throat) as a reaction of bhava with voice modulation. As the\nKathakali actor never uses spoken words \u2013we can end this subject right here.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Natyashastra calls for change in the skin\ntone as a sign of experiencing bhava -vaivarnyam section of satwika category .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since skin of face is not displayed by the\nKathakali actor, this vaivarnya subject too ends right here .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The facial make-up with layers of paint, is\ndeliberately applied.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is a method to all this madness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali deliberately deviates from satwikas\nwithout effecting its aesthetical qualities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Vachikas and satwikas required in Natyasastra\nare ignored in Kathakali. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali goes beyond the acting barrier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">But the rejection never effected the extreme\nexpressional acting of&nbsp; Kathakali.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Kathakali\nonly embellishes and adds to &nbsp;aesthetical\nqualities.&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Natyashastra explains the qualities of actors\nas Nayika-Nayaka lakshanam. &nbsp;&nbsp;He cast a\nblack complexioned tall man ( Kari or coal colour in Kathakali ) with heavy\nvoice for villain characters and a white skinned and fair look for hero. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is indeed no personal identity or mark\nfor any Kathakali actor because the characters are types/categories.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But in the\ncase of Nayikas of Kathakali, Natyasastra is helpless as the heroine (nayika)\nroles of Kathakali are done by men. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-KPxSghlYgnI/WOM5-RXPVqI/AAAAAAABSC0/GMOopV1HAyg8I5ynV3_gRdbn8eIX80OXQCLcB/s1600/a5fb5af3c10246bg09f035287c32201f7.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-KPxSghlYgnI/WOM5-RXPVqI/AAAAAAABSC0/GMOopV1HAyg8I5ynV3_gRdbn8eIX80OXQCLcB/s640/a5fb5af3c10246bg09f035287c32201f7.jpg\" width=\"512\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In\nNatyasastra, a gruesome scene like Narasimha tearing the entrails of King\nHiranyakashipu &nbsp;must be avoided on stage.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-sjzDZ5SJy-E/WOM6ywJhbBI/AAAAAAABSC8/HdCz2Kju_7s2BqAwY2Dd7dA0unoiH1engCLcB/s1600/220px-Lightmatter_vdddishnu1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In Kathakali started by Shukracharya , the\nbheebhatsa rasa ( disgust ) was highlighted to show the people of Kerala what\nhappened to their beloved King Mahabali\u2019s ancestor.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wteSNpLy2tA/WOM6agm0J8I/AAAAAAABSC4/mfkzRZlnbjkgDk06SLn_Pi2sOaZ8_UzPwCLcB/s1600/Scienceinccchinduism-Evolutioninvishnuavatarspart23.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">So, Kathakali deliberately deviates from the\ntight instruction specified by Natyasastra. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3RKVh2NhxV8/WOM7T0Fp9JI/AAAAAAABSDA/WzayisJer5wTvZ2RzDVmBz8zZyggGjUPwCLcB/s1600/lakshmi-nssarasimha-in-hampi-karnataka-india-ET0A24.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">It takes a Capt Ajit Vadakayil to explain this .&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GOJ2-a3bOWk/WOM5klNMauI/AAAAAAABSCw/SkR7-d4NH2MCQwr2i_ooEYz-8S1YQa4BQCLcB/s1600/hqdefeault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Like I said , Kathakali is NOT for half-wits.</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uCn5CZ8KyEE/WOM5T-6JWJI/AAAAAAABSCs/nsL8EfEnt9cqfq2_hQcPJQZtTzH4XHhTQCLcB/s1600/Narasimhadds-Avatar-of-Lord-Vishnu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uCn5CZ8KyEE/WOM5T-6JWJI/AAAAAAABSCs/nsL8EfEnt9cqfq2_hQcPJQZtTzH4XHhTQCLcB/s640/Narasimhadds-Avatar-of-Lord-Vishnu.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>KERALA KING MAHABALIs LINEAGE \u2013 &nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u201c British Green\nactivist Richard Douthwaite interviewed a person who remembers once saying that\n\"in some societies, very high levels \u2013 virtually First World levels \u2013 of\nindividual and public health and welfare are achieved at as little as sixtieth\nof US nominal GDP per capita and used Kerala as an example\".[24]:310\u2013312\nRichard Douthwaite states that Kerala \"is far more sustainable than\nanywhere in Europe or North America\".[25] Kerala's unusual socioeconomic\nand demographic situation was summarized by author and environmentalist Bill\nMcKibben:[26]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Kerala, a state in\nIndia, is a bizarre anomaly among developing nations, a place that offers real\nhope for the future of the Third World. Though not much larger than Maryland,\nKerala has a population as big as California's and a per capita annual income\nof less than $300. But its infant mortality rate is very low, its literacy rate\namong the highest on Earth, and its birthrate below America's and falling\nfaster. Kerala's residents live nearly as long as Americans or Europeans.\nThough mostly a land of paddy-covered plains, statistically Kerala stands out\nas the Mount Everest of social development; there's truly no place like it.[26]UNQUOTE\n</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mohinyattam is a\ndisplay of the grace and docility of a Kerala woman. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Mohiniyattam is revelant\nto Vishnu\u2019s second avatar of Kurma and Samudra Manthan. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-pKUX5EFnO4g/WONu1iNeQKI/AAAAAAABSD8/pqakmUNCFKYHrD6rWtpGA1maKFIGdmE0gCLcB/s1600/Wm2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Mohiniyattam &nbsp;connotes a dance of a&nbsp; beautiful enchantress, oozing amrit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mtvlw59MkDI/WONvJ8JV4dI/AAAAAAABSEA/-Iqfu-ZD2rEwGOofgWAdE6efbVIJMwHMwCLcB/s1600/mohini-samudraE-manthan.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Natyashasta is based on\nMohiniyattam which has the delicate and feminine Lasya style . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The song for Mohiniyattm\nis Manipravalm a mixture of 90% Sanskrit and a 10% Malayalam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The musical instruments\nusually used in Mohiniyattam are &nbsp;Madhalam (barrel drum), Idakka (hour glass\ndrum), flute, Veena, and Kuzhitalam (cymbals). The ragas (melody) are rendered\nin the sopana (steps) style, which is a slow melodic style with roots in the\nNatya Shastra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>&nbsp;Jew Rothschild banned this dance and saying it is\na dance of temple whores .</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL THIS PROPAGANDA &nbsp;ABOUT NATYASHATRA BEING WRITTEN BY BHARATA\nMUNI , AND THUS BHARATANATYAM IS THE BASIS OF NATYASHASTA IS ALL BULLSHIT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; With the spread of colonial British rule in\nthe 19th century India, all classical dance forms of India were ridiculed and\ndiscouraged, leading to their severely decline.[23][24] This was in part the\nresult of the Victorian morality of sexual repressiveness along with Anglican\nmissionaries who criticized Hinduism.[25][26]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seductive gestures\nand facial expressions during temple dances were caricatured in The Wrongs of\nIndian Womanhood, published at the start of the 20th century, as evidence of\n\"harlots, debased erotic culture, slavery to idols and priests\"\ntradition, and Christian missionaries demanded that this must be stopped,\nlaunching the \"anti-dance movement\" or \"anti-nautch\nmovement\" in 1892.[25][26][27] This movement affected all classical dances\nin India and contributed to their decline,[25][26] including the stigmatization\nof Mohiniyattam in the princely states of Travancore and Cochin in the British\nEmpire.[28][29] According to Justine Lemos, the conventional stereotype has\nbeen to label the temple dancers as prostitutes and that Mohiniyattam was\nbanned by the Maharaja under pressure from the British rule and his citizens,\nbut an examination of historical evidence suggests that neither did any law or\nproclamation ban Mohiniyattam nor is there any evidence that dancing girls of\nMohiniyattam were devadasis, temple prostitutes or even menial servants of the\ntemple : UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>AFTER MAHABALIs EXILE\nTO PATALA, IN KERALA WE STARTED ONAM FESTIVAL IN KERALA -- CELEBRATED BY &nbsp;CHRISTIANS AND MUSLIMS TOO &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">MOHINIYATTAM DANCE AROUND THE FLOWER CARPET , &nbsp;WAS A MUST FOR YOUNG UNMARRIED WOMEN</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>WHEN JEW ROTHSCHILD DENIGRATED KERALA TEMPLES\nHE HAD ROTHSCHILDs FAKE KANCHI MUTT AND THE TAMIL BRAHMINS IN CAHOOTS</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
