, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THE WHITE INVADER STOPPED MOHINIYATTAM AT THE\nBHAGAWATI TEMPLE (SHAKTI ) , THE OLDEST UNIVERSITY ON THIS PLANET \u2013KODUNGALLUR</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>THE TEMPLE WAS ANNUALLY DESECRATED BY LOW CASTE\nTAMILS WITH SHIT, URINE AND MENSES BLOOD\u2014WHILE SINGING VULGAR SEXUALLY LOADED\nSONGS THAT THE DEVI ( SHIVAs WIFE ) CANNOT BE SATISFIED UNLESS SHE IS HUMPED\nWITH A PRICK AS LARGE AS THE KODIMARAN FLAG STAFF.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THIS BLOGSITE HAS ASKED MODI AT LEAST 50\nTIMES OVER THE PAST 5 YEARS TO STOP THIS. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;HE DOES NOT CARE. &nbsp; &nbsp;RATHER HE HAS THE UNIQUE\nKNACK OF PRAISING ALL JEW ROTHSCHILDs FAKE CREATIONS .</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ARE YOU A CRYPTO JEW JAIN LIKE GA</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">NDHI -- NARENDRA\nDAMODARDAS MODI?</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>SHIVA WAS DENIGRATED AS A CORPSE EATER</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">ANIMAL SACRIFICES WERE DONE AT KODUNGALLUR\nTEMPLE.. IN THE YEAR 2016, ROOSTER CHICKEN WERE SACRIFICED.. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">RSS IS\nIN CAHOOTS, THEY KEEP QUIET , BUT HEY, THEY WILL MAKE HINDUS AND MUSLIMS FIGHT &nbsp;. . .</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As mentioned in Natya\nShastra , besides natural positions, Kathakali uses a range of specific\nmovement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The head has thirteen\nmovements, the eye-brows have seven movements, the eyes have thirty-six glances,\nthe neck has nine attitudes, the eye-balls and the eye- lids have nine actions,\nthe nose, the cheek, the lower lip, the chin and the mouth has each six actions\nand the facial expressions are of four kinds <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A ---FOURTEEN ACTIONS OF\nTHE HEAD <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(i) Akampita (shaking).\nThe head is moved side- ways, up and down. This helps in connoting the following\n: to point, to recognize, to questiom, conversation, faultless and innocent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">[ii) Kampati (quick up\nand down movement). This is used in expressing excitement, doubt, settle, threaten,\nquestion and pride. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lii) Dhutia. In this\nthe head is lightly shaken. This helps to describe the following : -</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unagreeable, trouble,\nsurprise, side glances, vacant and to check.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">v) Vidhuta (frequent\nmovement). This is an action where the head is moved frequently, and is used to\nexpress the following-- to catch an infection, to fear intoxication, to feel\nfeverish and drunkenness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(v) Panvahita (sideway\nswing). When the head is moved from one side to another, the action is called parivahita.\nIts usages are :&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Symbolism and Gesture source,\nwonder, pleasure, remembrance, anger, anxiety, trouble and playfulness.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(vi) Adhuta (tilted).\nIt is to lift the head obliquely and to keep it in that position. It represents\n: pride, &nbsp;ambition, corner glances and\nself-sufficience. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(vii) Avadhuta If in\nthe Adhuta position the head is once bent down, it is Avadhuta. It symbolises\nthe following : --information, invitation, to tell and to make sign. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(viii) Ancita. In this\nthe head is bent on one side. It represents the following :--ill-health,\nswooning, intoxication, trouble and anxiety. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(ix) Nihincita (to lift\nthe shoulder). In this the head is raised a little and shoulder touches it. The\neyebrows are curved. This is shown by a danseuse only. Its usages are the\nfollowing : -separation from the desired thing; in the absence of the lover,\nthe silent exhibition of love; the separation, the sentiment of the lover;\nself-restraint; to suppress the dignity and honour. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(x) Paravrtta is to\nbend the head from one side. It isused in expressing the following : --turning\nand seeing at the back,(xi) Utchepta is to keep the head up. This position signifies\nhigh and holy things. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(xii) Adhogati is to\nkeep the head down and bent. It is used in expressing :-- shyness, modesty, obeisance\nand sorrow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(xiii) Lolita\n(motionful). The head is kept moving in all the directions. It expresses the\nfollowing-: swooning, disease, intoxications, demonical excitement. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(xiv) Prakrita\n(natural). The head is in its natural position. It helps in connoting the\nfollowing/, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">holy things, to study\nand to think. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">B ---THIRTY-SIX KINDS\nOF GLANCES <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(t) Rasa Drstis\n(sentimental glances) : Eight in number : -Kanta (lovely), Bhayanaka\n(terrible), Hasya (comic), Karwa (pathetic) Adbhuta (marvellous), Raudra\n(furious), Vir (heroic), and Bibhatsa (disgusting). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(t'f ) Isthdi Drstis\n(principal glances) : Eight in number : -Snigdha (friendship), Hrsta\n(hilarious), Dina (mild and lowly), Krudha (angry), Drpta (proud), Bhayanvita\n(down with fear), Jugupsit (inquisitive or anxious), and Vismita (amazed). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(iii} Sancari Drstis\n(accessory glances) : 20 in number : -Sunya (void), Malina (gloomy), Sranta\n(tired), Lajjavita (bashful), Glani (dejection), Sankita (doubting or suspecting),\nVisanna (disappointed or heavy with grief), Mukula (closed), Kuncita (narrow), Abhitapta\n(extremely distressed), Jimha (crooked), Salilata (mellowed), Vibhranta\n(astounded), Vitarkita (doubting), Ardha Mukula (half closed), Vipluta (confused),\nAkekara (eye-ball repeatedly rolled), Visoka (free from grief), Trsta (trembling),\nand Madira (intoxication). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C --EIGHT KINDS OF\nLOOKS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sama (steady look),\nSaci (looking through the eyelashes), Anuvrtta (look of configuration and\nidentification), Alokita (surprised look), Pralokita (looking sideway),\nVilokita (looking back), Ullokita (looking up), and Avalokita (looking\ndownward)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">D-- NlNE MOVEMENTS OF\nTHE EYEBALLS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhramara (spinning the\neye-balls), Valana (twisting, three-cornered movement of the eyeball indicating\nkindness, mercy, etc.), Pata (drooping), Calara (restless movement), Sampavesa\n(drawing the eyeball in), Vivartana (looking askance), Samudvrtta (raising the eyes\nand looking upwards), Niskrama (going out), and Prakrta (natural look).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">E ---NlNE MOVEMENTS OF\nTHE EYELIDS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unmesa (to open),\nNimesa (to close), Prsta (to open wide), Kuncita (to slightly bend the lid)\nSama (natural position), Vivarttita (to throw upwards), Spurita (to flutter the\nlids), Pihita (to close furiously), and Savitadita (injured eye). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">F-- SEVEN MOVEMENTS OF\nTHE EYEBROWS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Movements of the\neyebrows follow the actions of the eyelids and eyeballs. They arc seven Utsepta\n(to throw the eyelid upward), Patana (to release the eyelids downward),\nBhruakti (to move the eyebrows to and fro and afterwards holding them upward),\nCatura (to spread), Kuncita(to bend downward), Recita (to raise any one of the\neyebrows), and Sahaja (the natural position). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">G ---SlX ACTIONS OF THE\nNOSE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nata (to close the\nnostrils), Manda (hiding), Vikrasta (to open the nostrils wide), Sochwasa (to\nbreathe in deep), Vikundita (to contract the nostrils on disapproval or\njealousy), and Swabhavika (natural position of the nose). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">H--- SlX MOVEMENTS OF\nTHE CHEEK <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ksam (downwards),\nPhulla (fully stretched), Ghurna (stretched and spread), Kampta (shivering),\nKuncita (contracted), and Sama &nbsp;(natural)\n. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I ---SlX MOVEMENTS OF\nTHE LOWER LIP <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vartana (bearing),\nKampana (fluttering), Visarga (spouting),Vinighana (to bend inwards), Samadrsta\n(to pierce the lip by teeth),and Samudga (natural).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">J ---SlX ACTIONS OF THE\nCHIN <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kuttara (to gnash the\nteeth), Khandana (to gnash the teeth together), Cinna (to contract the teeth),\nCuttkita (to open wide), Lehita (to lip), and Sama (natural). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">K--- SlX ACTIONS OF THE\nMOUTH <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vinivrtta (to open\nwide), Vidhuta (to open obliquely), Nirbhanga (downward), Burgna (to open\nsideways), Vivrtta (to open by separating the lips), and Udvahita (to open\nupward). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">L--- FOUR KINDS OF\nFACIAL EXPRESSIONS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swabhavika (natural),\nPrasanna (to be pleased with surprise),Rakta (the reddening of the face, as in\nanger), and Syama (the expression as in excitement). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M--- NlNE MOVEMENTS OF\nTHE NECK <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sama (natural), Nata\n(bent), Unnata (upward), Trasra (bent on sideways), Recita (quickly whirling\nround), Kuncita (slightlybent), Ancita (spread and bent on one side), Vatita\n(moved on any side), and Vivrtta (facing other person). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These various\nmukhya-karmanis (fundamental actions) are supplemented by the movements of the\nchest, leg, stomach, waist, calf, thigh and shoulder.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When all the movements of\ntwo or morethan two movable parts of the body are combined a meaningful gesture\nis produced.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And, since every movement is graceful and artistic every gesture\nis a meaningful art of deep symbolic purpose. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Various symbols and\nhand poses, supplemented by physical attitudes, speak a powerful language to\nthe eyes of the spectator. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">I DONT PLAN TO EAT MY OWN BURGER LIKE McWOLF BY PEGGING ABOVE THE LOWEST COMMON DEMOMINATOR&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
