font-size: x-large;\"><b>BASSSS !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Below: 108 karanas of Natyashastra</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</a></span><o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/dxpoSYfTNzo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/dxpoSYfTNzo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karanas are the 108 key\ntransitions &nbsp;in the classical Indian\ndance described in Natya Shastra. Karana is a Sanskrit verbal noun, meaning\n\"doing\".</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Natya Shastra states that Karanas are the framework for the\n\"margi\" (pan-Indian classical) productions which are supposed to\nspiritually enlighten the spectators, as opposed to the \"desi\"\n(regional folk or pop dance) productions which can only entertain the\nspectators.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/OJuH0B445UA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/OJuH0B445UA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"One who performs well this Karana dance created by Maheswara\nwill go free from all sins to the abode of this deity\" states Natya\nShastra&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/scalar-tango-in-zero-point-field-cosmic.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/scalar-tango-in-zero-point-field-cosmic.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">List of 108 Karanas</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) Talapu\u1e63papu\u1e6dam 2)\nVartitam 3) Valit\u014drukam 4) Apaviddam 5) Samanakam 6) L\u012bnam 7) Swastikar\u0113chitam\n8) Man\u1e0dalaswastikam 9) Niku\u1e6d\u1e6dakam 10) Ardhaniku\u1e6d\u1e6dam 11) Ka\u1e6d\u012bchinnam 12)\nArdhar\u0113chitam 13) Vak\u015baswastikam 14) Unmattam 15) Swastikam 16) P\u1e5b\u1e63\u1e6dhaswastikam\n17) Dikswastikam 18) Al\u0101tam 19) Ka\u1e6d\u012bsamam 20) \u0100k\u015biptar\u0113chitam 21)\nVik\u015bipt\u0101k\u015biptam 22) Ardhaswastikam 23) A\u00f1chitam 24) Bhuja\u1e45gatr\u0101sitam 25)\n\u016ardhvaj\u0101nu 26) Niku\u00f1chitam 27) Mattalli 28) Ardhamattalli 29) R\u0113chitaniku\u1e6d\u1e6dam\n30) P\u0101d\u0101paviddakam 31) Valitam 32) G\u016br\u1e47itam 33) Lalitam 34) Da\u1e47\u1e0dapak\u015bam 35)\nBhuja\u1e45gatrastar\u0113chitam 36) N\u016bpuram 37) Vai\u1e63\u0101khar\u0113chitam 38) Bhramaram 39)\nChaturam 40) Bhuja\u1e45g\u0101\u00f1chitam 41) Da\u1e47\u1e0dar\u0113chitam 42) V\u1e5b\u015bchikaku\u1e6d\u1e6ditam 43) Ka\u1e6d\u012bbhr\u0101ntam\n44) Lat\u0101v\u1e5b\u015bchikam 45) Chinnam 46) V\u1e5b\u015bchikar\u0113chitam 47) V\u1e5b\u015bchikam 48) Vyamsitam\n49) P\u0101r\u015bvaniku\u1e6d\u1e6dakam 50) Lal\u0101\u1e6datilakam 51) Kr\u0101ntam 52) Ku\u00f1chitam 53) Chakrama\u1e47\u1e0dalam\n54) Ur\u014dma\u1e47\u1e0dalam 55) \u0100k\u015biptam 56) Talavil\u0101sitam 57) Arga\u1e37am 58) Vik\u1e63iptam 59)\n\u0100vartam 60) D\u014dl\u0101p\u0101dam 61) Viv\u1e5bttam 62) Viniv\u1e5bttam 63) P\u0101r\u015bvakr\u0101ntam 64) Ni\u1e63umbhitam\n65) Vidyutbhr\u0101ntam 66) Atikr\u0101ntam 67) Vivartitakam 68) Gajakr\u012b\u1e0ditam 69)\nTalasamspho\u1e6ditam 70) Garu\u1e0daplutam 71) Ga\u1e47\u1e0das\u016bch\u012b 72) Par\u012bv\u1e5bttam 73) P\u0101r\u015bvaj\u0101nu\n74) G\u1e5bdr\u0101val\u012bnakam 75) Sannatam 76) S\u016bch\u012b 77) Ardhas\u016bch\u012b 78) S\u016bch\u012bviddham 79)\nApakr\u0101ntam 80) May\u016bralalitam 81) Sarpitam 82) Dan\u1e0dap\u0101dam 83) Harinaplutam 84)\nPr\u0113nk\u014dlitam 85) Nitambam 86) Skalitam 87) Karihastam 88) Prasarpitam 89)\nSimhavikr\u012b\u1e0ditam 90) Simh\u0101kar\u1e63itam 91) Udv\u1e5bttam 92) Upa\u015b\u1e5btam 93) Talasa\u1e45gha\u1e6d\u1e6ditam\n94) Janitam 95) Avahittakam 96) Niv\u0113\u015bam 97) \u0112lak\u0101kr\u012bditam 98) \u016ar\u016bdv\u1e5bttam 99)\nMadaskalitam 100) Vi\u1e63\u1e47ukr\u0101ntam 101) Sambhr\u0101ntam 102) Vi\u015bkhambam 102) Udgha\u1e6d\u1e6ditam\n104) V\u1e5b\u015babhakr\u012b\u1e0ditam 105) L\u014dlitam 106) N\u0101g\u0101pasarpitam 107) \u015aaka\u1e6d\u0101syam 108) Ga\u1e45g\u0101vataranam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/tle49BjsypY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/tle49BjsypY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Natya Shastra has\ndescribed 108 karanas, each comprising of movements of abstract dance. Each of\nthe Karna comprises specific movement of foot, calf, thigh, knee, waist, chest,\nneck, arms, and hands.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Natyashashstra, Karana is not a pose but\nthe complete unit of dance movements. Karna is the most important primary unit\nof movement. Angahara is the name of collective movements comprising several\nKarnas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Shiva performs the Tandava, several Karanas are linked together to\nform a garland of dance poses and movements. These become the Angaharas,\ngarlands of dance poses of Lord Shiva.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Longer sequences of movements are like\ngarlands and are thus known as Angahara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><b>BELOW- &nbsp;ANHAHARA --32&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Isthara Hasta. &nbsp; &nbsp; 17.\nParivaratta Recita. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Paryastaka. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;18.\nVaishakha Recita. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Suci Vidha. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;19.\nParavrtta. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Apavidha. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;20. Gati\nMandala. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Akshipta. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;21.\nParichinna. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Udhattita. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 22.\nAlataka. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Vishkamba. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;23.\nParashwacheda. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8. Vishkambhapasrata.\n24. Viddudhdranta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9. Aparajita. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 25.\nUdavratta. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10. Mattakrida. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;26. Allira.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11. Swastika Recita. &nbsp; &nbsp;27. Recita. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12. Pasehwa Swastika. &nbsp; 28. Achurita. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13. Vrashcika. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 29.\nAkshipta Recita. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">14. Bhramara. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 30.\nSambhranta. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">15. Mattskhalita. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;31.\nApasarpa. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">16. Mada Vilasita. &nbsp; 32.\nArdha Mikutta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RECHIKAS &nbsp;( 4) &nbsp;---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Pada Recikas <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Kati Recikas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Kara Recikas</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Kantha Recikas<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A number of Karanas in\nsuccessive display produce an Angahara, and two or more Angaharas, when successively\nexhibited, produce a Rechika<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/-YvzpqRrnDo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/-YvzpqRrnDo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thiraseela (hand-held\ncurtain) is used on the Kathakali stage for the entry and exit of characters,\nto indicate change of scene, and for thiranokku, curtain look, associated with\nthe entry of wicked and monstrous characters in Kathi (knife), Kari (black) and\nThadi (beard) costumes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They hold the curtain with both hands and bring it down\nslowly and show emotions of love, majesty, and anger.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The females in the audience\nsitting in darkness squirm when Kathi character look at the over the curtain.\nThis gives some comic relief to the men in the audience<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The curtain or\nthiraseela is NOT just another piece of cloth..</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Traditionally\nthis curtain is a piece of cloth of several concentric rectangles of\ncontrasting bright colours. The size has increased and it is not unusual to\nhave the logo or name of the troupe printed across it. This is NOT allowed as\nper Kathakali tradition</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">The LIVE curtain is a\nhallmark of Kathakali.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">This superbly\nmobile curtain</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">constructs time/space\nbarrier. The characters themselves can operate this curtain to break this\nbarrier and enter the world of the spectator.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The curtain&nbsp; differentiates audience from actor and even\nactor from character.&nbsp; It is an\nalienation technique that distances the actor form the audience.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Curtain is a\nsymbolist element which allows the audience to see a man of epic times, who\ndoes not belong to contemporary period. It helps to form a concept of character\nwhich is the one above us than the one among ourselves, as the characters\nrepresent a mythology or legend. The entrance and the exit of the actors is\nvery important in a theatre<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A real demoniac\ncharacter would seize the curtain forcibly and fling it away while ultimately\nrevealing &nbsp;himself. &nbsp;The \"rise of the curtain\" thus\nbecame expressive of &nbsp;character.\nLikewise, some of the demoniac characters would on occasions move towards the\ngreat bronze lamp and whip up its &nbsp;flames\nby violent gestures. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A simple open air stage\nis used and if you are not a half wit you will construe the requirement of a mobile\nscreen &nbsp;. &nbsp;A large oil-fed lamp is placed in front of the\nstage and two people hold the on the stage, the main dancers stand behind it\nbefore the performance. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actors stand behind\nthe curtain. When the curtain holders drop and remove the curtain, the\nperformance starts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is preliminary\ndance on the stage by the main character. &nbsp;For Purappadu the curtain is held by the\nstretched up hands in maximum height. The atmosphere is surcharged with high\npitch music.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound of quick and heavy foot-steps from behind the curtain\npierces through the atmosphere. At this time a colour-canopy appears over the\ncurtain, when an extra ordinary noise is heard. Drums beat becomes at top\nvigour.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fingers of the character (left hand fingers covered with long thimbles)\nrise in the centre of the curtain\u2014 and our genteel ladies squirm . &nbsp;The hands hold the curtain on top end and\nfingers glide across. No singing at this moment, but the drum beat sets your\nheart pounding<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now is the turn of\nanti-hero. He shakes the curtain violently. The audience chances upon the upper\nportion of the headgear of the hero. Anti-hero draws the curtain towards him\nand surge forward. The face of the hero character is now exposed on the stage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thiraseela (hand-held\ncurtain) is used on the Kathakali stage for the entry and exit of characters,\nto indicate change of scene, and for thiranokku, curtain look, associated with\nthe entry of wicked and monstrous characters in Kathi (knife), Kari (black) and\nThadi (beard) costumes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They hold the curtain\nwith both hands and bring it down slowly and show emotions of love, majesty,\nand anger. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actor enters with\ntwo ways like eduthu kalasam which was said above and second is the &nbsp;idathakatheemthom. The exit will either be by\nputting the curtain or by seeing off by the other character. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actor enters with\ntwo ways like eduthu kalasam which was said above and second is the\nkidathakatheemthom. The exit will either be by putting the curtain or by seeing\noff by the other character. A slow revelation of the character is employed\nwhich has the actor standing behind a curtain which is gradually lowered.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nstrong characters are revealed,the curtain is held in front of him and he is\nportrayed as having a battle with the curtain. &nbsp;Partially hidden from the audiences view, the\nactor performs a couple of dance sequences behind the curtain to the\naccompaniment of drums and cymbals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is done to\nheighten the curiosity of the audience and amplify the effect of the character\nwhen he appears fully in sight\u2014and females squirm imparting a lonely furrow on\nthe lush green &nbsp;grass under their asses &nbsp;The whole atmosphere is &nbsp;surcharged with earth-shaking and hair-raising\nactivities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The &nbsp;sound of quick and heavy\nfoot-steps can be heard from behind the &nbsp;curtain.\nIts synchronization with the sound effect of the drums &nbsp;heightens the climax. The entire climate\nforebodes that a terrific &nbsp;personality is\nabout to appear- females squirm and how !.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suddenly a coloured canopy appears, &nbsp;as if from nowhere, over the curtain and a\nrumbling growling noise &nbsp;is heard. Drums\nburst into shattering sounds. Here is a shriek; &nbsp;and there a groan !&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But before the eyes can\ncatch the character, &nbsp;fingers are seen\nrising in the centre of the curtain. The left hand &nbsp;fingers are covered with long thimbles. The\ntwo hands are kept &nbsp;about three feet\napart. They clutch the curtain. Mangy fingers glide &nbsp;across its top.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To the accompaniment of the\ndrums, the anti-hero shakes &nbsp;the curtain\nviolently, and breathless the audience catches an occasional glimpse of the top\nof a glittering head-dress, which seems to be gyrating madly in some infernal\nwhirlwind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He pulls the curtain towards him; then plugs forward and fans\nflames. With gusto, the fire illuminates the character's face and enables the audience\nto spot him out by his weird make-up. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The feverish pitch of\nexcitement over, the curtain is dropped and the whole figure of the character\nemerges after a great deal of suspense. The curtain is pulled off the stage\nfrom its right wing. Hajaar gesticulation begins. Muscles shiver \u2013nay- tremble.\nThe actor takes a few paces back and forth; looks at some object or remembers some\nthing or is struck with some brilliant idea. To a connoisseur this is real fuckin\u2019\nspice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tiranokku is an interlude\nto the appearance of a character on the stage and may be repeated as many times\nas anti-heroes appear. . Tiranokku is the debut on the stage of all characters\nother than the pacha or minukku. Thereafter, the play or the particular scene\nof the chosen play begins.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Being a professional\nKathakali dancer is a great sacrifice. &nbsp;He\nis required to make his eyed red. Modern Kathakali dancers who do King Lear and\nJohn the Baptist avoid pain.&nbsp; They are\npretenders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The facial makeup of Kathakali is so colorful that\na white eye doesn't match up.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All stare\ninto the eyes of the dancer .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h_fLSSLfZvc/WORks2st3vI/AAAAAAABSFU/Cf9K90A_urs8UpjZgW3DarNRT1Rp3MYWACLcB/s1600/kathakalie2356521491_e194cdb68b.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"396\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h_fLSSLfZvc/WORks2st3vI/AAAAAAABSFU/Cf9K90A_urs8UpjZgW3DarNRT1Rp3MYWACLcB/s640/kathakalie2356521491_e194cdb68b.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The red eye adds an\nunearthly ambience to the face. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-W04Xz0njrTo/WORnNKLQA1I/AAAAAAABSFk/yiTqTxUgBQAyHW3U5tr1XiJR49xRlUA3gCLcB/s1600/9568533903.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"418\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-W04Xz0njrTo/WORnNKLQA1I/AAAAAAABSFk/yiTqTxUgBQAyHW3U5tr1XiJR49xRlUA3gCLcB/s640/9568533903.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ovule Receptacle\n(seed) part of the Chunda flower is used. After plucking the flowers which are\nfully or partly flourished, remove it's petals and green part around it's Ovule\nReceptacle (Seed) carefully.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seed shouldn't be scratched or broken. Then\ngently rub and roll the seed in your inner hand with a touch of cow ghee. First\n30 minutes it need to be gently rubbed and later on increase the pressure. The\neffect of the flower during the performance depends on the time taken to rub\nand prepare the flower (Normally 4 hours). Then the seed becomes soft,dark\nbrown or even black. Put that in a small air tight container along with some\nghee (recommended for long term use). Else it can be stored in a roll of cloth\nand knot it tightly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the facial makeup\nis over and just before starting the body costume, the performer need to put\nthe flower seed in the eyes. He places his eyeballs up, and gently put the\nflower seed in lower eyelid. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IRyBbcYBfSg/WORm8LsTLUI/AAAAAAABSFg/OxJUQjI-IjgRDlQxr3CifJ-hyIAHrBA0gCLcB/s1600/chunda_ottarssnthullal.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"324\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IRyBbcYBfSg/WORm8LsTLUI/AAAAAAABSFg/OxJUQjI-IjgRDlQxr3CifJ-hyIAHrBA0gCLcB/s400/chunda_ottarssnthullal.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<o:p></o:p><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To insert chundappu\n(Solanum surattense ) in eye lid-the actor he gently pinches the lower eyelid\nand drag forward. The flower seed goes inside and stays there. The performer\ncloses the eyes and roll his eyeballs. When he opens his eyes, the eyes turns\nred in colour.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the act the seed\nis removed so the eye of&nbsp; the actor\nreturns to normal color.There is discomfort and pain involved.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just shows the commitment \u2013 this is NOT some\nbullshit Tip fuckin\u2019 Toe of ballet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kathakali the colour\nshows what the actor represents<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">MINUKKU</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yellow is the code for\nmonks, mendicants and women.&nbsp; &nbsp;Minukka (radiant, shining) with a warm yellow,\norange or saffron typifies noble, virtuous feminine characters such as Sita.&nbsp; Powdered MICA on face gives the glint (\nminukku ) .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men who act the roles of women also add a false top knot to their\nleft and decorate it in a style common to Kerala. &nbsp;The gentle and spiritually leaning characters\nlike sages comes under this type\u2014they have lustrous yellow faces &nbsp;.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">KARI ( BLACK )</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kari means black in\nMalayalam.&nbsp; Kari is the code for forest\ndwellers, hunters, and middle ground character.&nbsp;\nVile and evil characters are presented all black.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unreliable and\ntreacherous characters are also painted black but with streaks or patches of\nred <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Black make-up and\ncostumes denote tamasic ( bad \u2013demon ) elements. Kari is used for lady-demons\n(witches in Indian epics) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-eYYF31TTPrI/WOR1U4ag4SI/AAAAAAABSF0/uFgV1Ymeg3A5cjueVCE9692vHSlgzrfyQCLcB/s1600/12501623_7759606858dss37099_1165294113_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-eYYF31TTPrI/WOR1U4ag4SI/AAAAAAABSF0/uFgV1Ymeg3A5cjueVCE9692vHSlgzrfyQCLcB/s640/12501623_7759606858dss37099_1165294113_n.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">PACHA ( GREEN )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pacha means green in\nMalayalam.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pacha portrays noble\nprotagonists.. A character with \u2018Pacca\u2019 make-up and brightly coral red coloured\nlips depicts gods, sages and noble characters like Shiva, Krishna, Rama etc.&nbsp; &nbsp;Righteous and dignified characters are in\npacha or green.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zDWTrtoNiko/WOR2DIrzhpI/AAAAAAABSF8/Cf-xH6XaDRUh76Q_JV0bNzl06t85AK_YwCLcB/s1600/kathakalie2356521491_e194cdb68b.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"396\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zDWTrtoNiko/WOR2DIrzhpI/AAAAAAABSF8/Cf-xH6XaDRUh76Q_JV0bNzl06t85AK_YwCLcB/s640/kathakalie2356521491_e194cdb68b.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">KATHI ( KNIFE )</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathi means knife in Malayalam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathi &nbsp;cut throat villainous characters. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Kathi characters are vain, aggressive and\nunrighteous characters, a red mark like an upturned moustache <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asuras , demons and bad\npeople are Kathi. For characters like Ravana and Dussasana, two long protruding\ncanine teeth / fangs (dhustras) are perched on either side of the mouth. These\ndrop over the lower lips<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ey6DGommZ1s/WOR3djgwmOI/AAAAAAABSGI/19YxyJVvh20tEozhz0fPh0RHhYc5dBtsQCLcB/s1600/Kathaffkali-Kali.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ey6DGommZ1s/WOR3djgwmOI/AAAAAAABSGI/19YxyJVvh20tEozhz0fPh0RHhYc5dBtsQCLcB/s640/Kathaffkali-Kali.jpg\" width=\"548\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VELLA THADI or White beard depict divine , virtuous superhuman characters . The make-up is\nentirely different. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The head gear\nresembles a large hat. Hanuman is the best example.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Mk9QxTPMl0k/WOR5sRFrgUI/AAAAAAABSGU/VDHHhOUyv0c-Kb4WJF_CHEraqCd7Rq0-QCLcB/s1600/05%2BKartharimukssham%2B-Sudhi%2Bcopy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"546\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Mk9QxTPMl0k/WOR5sRFrgUI/AAAAAAABSGU/VDHHhOUyv0c-Kb4WJF_CHEraqCd7Rq0-QCLcB/s640/05%2BKartharimukssham%2B-Sudhi%2Bcopy.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">CHUVANNA THADI or Red\nbeard is for angry, evil , vicious characters.,. &nbsp;Their faces are mainly painted black on the\ntop half and red on the lower</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WAQ4X8ZVsfQ/WOR6eQeq-FI/AAAAAAABSGc/ywyrumTj29knAjX82flzbC8Fyu6vm49ngCLcB/s1600/35217d29703_be7c6a94d6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"428\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WAQ4X8ZVsfQ/WOR6eQeq-FI/AAAAAAABSGc/ywyrumTj29knAjX82flzbC8Fyu6vm49ngCLcB/s640/35217d29703_be7c6a94d6.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">KARUTHA Thadi or Black beard signifies the character of a forest dweller or a\nhunter. . These are primitive and ungovernable types embodying the lowest of\nthe human qualities. They are wild in comparison with the more refined heroes\nof the drama. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their faces are totally\npainted black with a little of red and white around eyes and with bright red\nlips. The headdress is not flat and round but long and cylindrical, of black\ncolour, opening or broadening on top<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UHUMhidFCqs/WOR72r5ebNI/AAAAAAABSGw/xpNZyE80dGAEAVMHdDCKg1j8ebMeAa6_ACLcB/s1600/karutha-teehadi.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UHUMhidFCqs/WOR72r5ebNI/AAAAAAABSGw/xpNZyE80dGAEAVMHdDCKg1j8ebMeAa6_ACLcB/s640/karutha-teehadi.jpg\" width=\"500\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elaborate costumes and\nornamentation are designed to heighten the superman effect. By the time an\nactor has assumed his complete costume and makeup, he resembles a sculpture.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Large overcoats, flowing scarves, bulging skirts, antique ornaments, opulent\nhead dresses with streaming hair flowing down to the waist and covering the\nback, complement the elaborate makeup to create enlarged figures that make a\nstriking psychological impression on the viewer <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Theppu (face painting)\nand Chutti (Beard making) are the two main components in the face make up. All\nthe colours used in the make-up are obtained from natural substances and herbs.\n. Uduthukettu (skirt draping) is one of the difficult and important elements of\ncostume.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ulluvaal, puramval, pattuvaal are the different cloth pieces used for\ngetting the bulk look for the skirt. Ulluval is a 1 meter long starched cotton\ncloth. More than 50 pieces are needed to drape inner skirt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali aficionados\ndelight in reviewing the subtleties of movement,expression, and personality of\naccomplished performers. Whether traditionallycrafted or contemporary in\nconstruction,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali costumes are incredibly effective in bringing attention\nto those attributes.. Heavily plaited skirts are used with the aim to enlarge\nthe actor\u201fs proportionate size.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Underneath all this make-up, headgear and\ncostume is a slim, lithe , agile, patient and SUPREMELY FIT&nbsp; figure. &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most kathakali dancers live to a ripe old age <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elaborate facial makeup\n&nbsp;is to transform the actor into the god or\ndemon he is portraying. Once the facial make-up is done the actor is no longer recognized\nas himself. He is from then on to be identified with as the character and addressed\nlikewise.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The make-up artist is\nessential not only at the training stage but also in the performing stage. He\nis called Chouttikaran and he is supposed to have great experience with the\ntraining of art and a mastery of colors. , the makeup is so luxuriant that it\nis more like a mask than just make-up.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These extraordinary costumes and make-up\nserve to raise the performers above the level of mere mortals that, the\naudiences are taken into an ecstatic world that the characters replicate\nonstage.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The headgear worn by\nthe various characters in Kathakali are excellent specimen of intricate wood\ncarving, an ancient speciality of Kerala. Even the shiny finishing with\ntrinkets takes hours of painstaking labour by expert craftsmen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the most\ninteresting aspects of Kathakali is its elaborate make-up code. Kathakali\nmake-up is an elaborate process lasting for over three hours. Paints used in\nKathakali make-up are freshly prepared and applied to ensure correctness of\nrhythmic curves and precision.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The expressive part of\nthe performance, which constitutes the play being choreographed as dance-drama,\nare four: Kalasam (major and most common), Iratti (special, used with\nbattles-related Cempata rhythm), Tonkaram (similar to Iratti but different\nmusic), and Nalamiratti (used for exits or link between the chapters of the\nplay).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali depicts the\nclash between good and evil in a narrative form. One of the toughest dance\nforms, Kathakali requires tremendous control over the body and mind besides\nelaborate facial make-up.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is to ensure an effortless portrayal of epic\nlegends through mudras of hands and facial expressions. Special exercises are\nimparted at a young age to master the movements of the eyebrows, lips, chins,\ncheeks and eyes\u2014 with heavy foot massages to stretch the ligaments supple at a\ntender age .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali has lineages\nor distinctive styles of play interpretation and dance performance called\nSampradayam. These developed in part because of the Gurukul system of its\ntransmission from one generation to the next.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Kerala Kalamandalam is\na major center for Kathakali studies. But this blogpost will be a revelation\neven to this institute.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The art within this institute has been hijacked by\nagents of Jew Rothschild and Christian NGOs.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Kerala Kalamandalam don\u2019t even know the depth and glory of Kathakali,\nthe reason why I am penning this series\u2014to stem the rot.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW Rothschild injected\nFAKE story Ashtapadi Attam, a dance drama based on the FAKE Gita Govinda of the\nFAKE poet Jayadeva, told the story of Krishna embodied as a humble cowherd, his\nFAKE Rothschild created Radha.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; Madhavi\u2019s solo for the ninth song Radhika\ntava virahe Keshava in raga Bageshree in taal triputa was adapted from the\noriginal music composed by Dr. Subas Pani for Sampoorna Geetagovinda. Radha\u2019s\nplight was depicted intensely but with restrained abhinaya. The stanza in which\nKrishna is described as \u2018Indra\u2019s handsome younger brother, you are more cruel\nthan even thunderbolt\u2019 always makes one wonder at Jayadeva\u2019s \u2018upama\u2019 \u2013 simile -\nusing it to show the deep anguish Radhika suffers. It is a soliloquy describing\nher helplessness and misery in separation from Krishna. She went to meet him\nfor the promised rendezvous stealthily but alas he was not there and was\nperhaps dallying with those more lucky gopis ..In the audience was Delhi\u2019s\nChief Minster Sheila Dixit who did the honours and offered flowers to the\nartistes and musicians, a gracious gesture of a gracious minister who is known\nfor her love of the classical arts.&nbsp; \u201c UNQUOTE\n</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.narthaki.com/info/gtsk/gtsk73.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.narthaki.com/info/gtsk/gtsk73.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali has traditionally been an art that\nhas continued from one generation to the next through a guru-disciples\n(gurukkula) based training system. In between foreign money spoke and rot set\nin.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A typical course work\nin Kathakali emphasizes physical conditioning by yoga&nbsp; Yoga and body massage is done to &nbsp;tone the muscles and sculpt the growing body, along\nwith rigourous dance practice.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
