font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without passion you cant be a Kathakali dancer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise-part-2-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise-part-2-capt.html</a><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018Kathakali\u2019\nincorporates the most intricate make-up code, costume, face masks, head dress\nand brightly painted faces among all Indian classical dance forms. Nothing can\nmeasure up anywhere on this planet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Its unique costume, accessories and make-up\ncomplimented with spectacular performance, music and lightings bringing life to\nthe characters of the great epics and legends attracts and flabbergasts both young\nand the old thus creating a surreal world around.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Head gears and face\nmasks help emphasize the face make-up which is prepared from colours extracted\nfrom vegetables and rice paste. It takes several hours to complete the entire\nget up of all the actor-dancers of a play thus bringing out the unique\npersonality of each character.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A \u2018Kathakali\u2019\nperformance includes various instruments that encompass three major drums\nnamely \u2018Itaykka\u2019, \u2018Chenda\u2019 and \u2018Maddalam\u2019. Music plays a significant role in\nthis form of classical art creating variations of tones setting and\ncorresponding to the mood of a particular scene. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The important musical\narrangements typifying and going in line with the mood of the scene. These\ninclude \u2018Cempata\u2019 that is used in different sequences like during combat\nbetween good and evil and while concluding a scene; \u2018Atanta\u2019 during scenes\nconsisting of divine and virtuous characters; \u2018Muri Atanta\u2019 during heroic,\ncomic and light-hearted acts; \u2018Triputa\u2019 in scenes involving teachers and sages;\n\u2018Pancari\u2019 during repugnant scenes; and \u2018Campa\u2019 during scenes portraying clash,\nargument, tension and discord between lovers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The voice artists also\ncontribute significantly in the entire act with not only delivering the\nrelevant lines but also setting the mood and context of the scene by modulating\ntheir voice to express the temperament of the character. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In case of expressing\nanger the artist would deliver the lines in clear and sharp high tone while in\ncase of a plea the artist applies a more delicate and exhausted tone.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a highly charged\npowerful drama that combines DEVOTION repeat DEVOTION ( not meant for King Lear\nbullshit ) devotion, drama, dance, music, costumes and make up to produce one\nof the most impressive forms of sacred theatre in the world.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only an audience who\nalready knows something about the story being enacted will be better able to\nappreciate the \u201cpersonalization\u201d of characters by individual Kathakali actors. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each character in\nKathakali dance is immediately recognizable by characteristic makeup and\ncostume.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Performance aspects are\ndeveloped through years of intensive training.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four separate dramatic elements\nof Kathakali- --</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aharyabhinaya refers to the decorative elements of the play,\nparticularly costume, makeup, and accessories. The others are Vachikabhinaya\n(speeches and songs), Angikabhinaya (dance, body position, mudras/hand\ngestures, eye movements, etc.) and Satvikabhinaya (the expression of psychic\nstates associated with emotions).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the major\nenjoyments for traditional Kathakali connoisseurs is distinguishing and\ndiscussing the \"personalizations\" that each actor brings to his\ndepiction of the story.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The success or failure of amateur Kathakali artists is determined\nby their ability to successfully personalize characters.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Kathakali orchestra\nis composed of a lead vocalist (\u201cponnani\u201d) keeping time with a resounding gong\nmade of bell metal (chegala), which can be struck with a wooden stick; and a\nminor vocalist (\u201csingidi\u201d) with a pair of clanking cymbals (elethalam)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Below: This is 100% &nbsp;sacrilege. &nbsp;The dancer is following a tape recorder-- to some fancy background and light source. The sound MUST follow the dancer NOT vice versa . The audience must sit in darkness . The oil lamp is the most important prop.</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/PRcfOBQPyCI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/PRcfOBQPyCI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stage hands place the\nmusical instruments (drums, gong and cymbals) on the ground behind the Kali\nVilakku. The maddalam players touch them respectfully, lift them up, play a\ncouple of beats on both sides to invoke SHABDA BRAHMAN ( the field ) , and hang the instruments\naround their waists<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BrD1UWoDutE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BrD1UWoDutE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Todayam is a RITUALISTIC\ndance performed by the dancers, accompanied by music to invoke the blessings of\nthe Lord. &nbsp;Todayam is a prelude and I not for the spectators. &nbsp;See how they bang the outer edges of their\nfeet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Todayam, it is\ntime for Purappadu, a piece of dance choreography- a pure nritta piece<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The purappadu is\nanother introductory dance of invocation and has no mime. The dancer presents a\nnumber of pure dance sequences (Kalasams). The entire technique of Kathakali is\nexhibited through these cadences.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the purappadu, the play or the particular\nscene of the play chosen for the evening begins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/nOu7m2WaWfA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/nOu7m2WaWfA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actors dance and\nact behind the Kali Vilakku while the singers sing standing behind - this is\nthe general nature of the play. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lead\nsinger sings, playing the gong, the second singer repeats playing the cymbals. &nbsp;Accompanied by suddha maddalam, toppi maddalam\nand edakka, both singers sing the slokas and padams , one by one, once. Some\npadams and slokas are sung more than once<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There exists\nelaborately defined code of body kinetics, which combine with beautifully\neloquent gestural representation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything is bizarre,\nsub human and superhuman all at once.. Watching these spectacles one is\ntransported to a world of dreams for that is the only place where we might\nconceivably meet with anything similar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">I ASK THE KERALA\nTOURISM MINISTRY TO TELL KERALA KALAMANDALAM , THE TRUTH ABOUT KATHAKALI.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">WE DON\u2019T WANT KING LEAR PERFORMANCES IN\nFUTURE.&nbsp;&nbsp; THIS KILLS THE SOUL OF THE\nPERFORMER\u2014 WHO TRAINED HARD AND MADE PERSONAL SACRIFICE FOR SOMETHING ELSE. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">HE IS NOW A WHORE DANCING TO THE HIGHEST BIDDER&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">HOW HAS JEW ROTHSCHILD\nCONTROLLED THE WHOLE PLANET?..&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;BY CAUSING ANCIENT CULTURE TO BE CONTAMINATED,\n&nbsp;AND MAKING PROUD PEOPLE SELF LOATHING</span></b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He is brainwashed by\nvested interests in foreign payroll , to forget the striking elements in\nKathakali -- its dramatic quality; gods and heroes, demons and spirits , boons\nand curses, the cosmic dance of the opposites&nbsp;\n--&nbsp; He now no longer inspired to a\nworld of myth and legend.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali creates a\nworld of illusion unmatched by any other form of theater. With its captivating\ndramatics, its independently stylish grandeur and its transformational\ntheatrics, Kathakali MUST dominate the world theatre. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This blogsite will ensure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali shall remain\ntrue to its origin.&nbsp;&nbsp; It shall remain\npart of the great illusion created by mystical tantra art is its portrayal of\nmythical ancientness.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali shall merge a\nfantastic-- nay&nbsp; surreal painting and\nnarrative artistry therein creating a supernatural display.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali shall\ntransport an appreciative audience to a mythical era where ancient art was\nworship and vice versa.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a promise from\nCapt Ajit Vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali was performed open air to masses\ndevoid of boundaries. Performances were made on locale stages, surrounded by\nwalls only built by the art\u2019s illusion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The more ancient folk ritual genres THIRA and\nTHEYYAM which were famous in Northern Malabar were absorbed 330 century old Kathakali.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/muthappan-deity-of-north-kerala-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/muthappan-deity-of-north-kerala-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kings and rulers remained patrons of\nKathakali and Kalari\u2014both rooted in the mystic number 108<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Both Kathakali and Kalari required body\nmovements that were motivated by sacred inner rhythm. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/12/kalaripayattu-oldest-and-deadliest.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/12/kalaripayattu-oldest-and-deadliest.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">That theseplays are just 3 centuries aold ,\npatterned on the lyrics of FAKE Gita Govinda by JEW Rothschild\u2019s FAKE creation\n, &nbsp;poet Jayadeva ( discussed in every\ndesh drohi literary fest by white men and their agents ) is now nailed as a\nFOUL LIE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>DHAAAAAADHHH</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SATYA VACHCHAN <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">TINE 1800 HRS</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DATE\u20145TH APRIL 2017<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kathakali gestures\nform a complex system of signs with attributed meanings,not symbols of\nincarnated meanings. By first folding the hand and then slowly spreading out\nthe fingers, it is possible to indicate an opening flower. Each gesture stands\nfor several things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the opera, the\nperformance is given more priority while the character that is performing the\nact takes a back seat, whereas in Kathakali the CHARACTER takes preponderance\n\u2013the act,&nbsp; and the performance too are\nimportant. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Imagery and diction are\nconventionalized in Kathakali.&nbsp; The\nPataka Mudra is therefore formed by the actor holding his hand up with the ring\nfinger bent inward and the rest of the fingers stretched outward.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When this\ngesture is shown, the meaning could be perceived in various ways. &nbsp;The average\nnumber of ways has been known to be 36.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This tells us that the relation between\nthe denotation of a word and the word itself is not inherent. The word is\ntherefore not a symbol but a sign.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali has therefore reversed the\naesthetic&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">transformation direction and enabled the growth of an extensive\nunmatched gesture language.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This process therein\nincludes the actor\u2019s skill in transforming the verbal text into a code for\ngesture and the audience is relied upon to decode this code.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali&nbsp; includes&nbsp;\ndetailed gesture languages and a whole lot of other techniques and\ntactics without which it would not have reached its level of supremacy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE SINGLE LAMP ON A\nMOONLESS NIGHT FLICKERS AND THIS HAS A HYPNOTIC EFFECT ON THE AUDIENCE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Set apart from all the\nother dance forms of India and abroad, Kathakali rules as the KING of all\nclassical-dance drama..&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vandana Slokam is a\nprayer and follows Thodayam to bless the stage and to evoke the Gods. Before\nthe first actors make their way to the stage, they will visit all their senior\nartists and touch their feet. This evokes their blessings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They will also pray to\nthe lamp- Nila Vilakku which is situated in a green room. They finally go on to\nthe stage-which has now been transformed into a holy place. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actors then travel\nfrom this world into a Godly world and are embodied with dignity and humility. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine their\ninner state when forced to play the LAST SUPPER OF JESUS CHRIST<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JESUS NEVER EXISTED \u2013HE\nWAS COOKED UP IN 325 AD BY THE ROMAN EMPEROR</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/apollonius-or-jesus-christ-who-is-real.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/apollonius-or-jesus-christ-who-is-real.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali\u201fs absence\nof&nbsp; speech thus contributes to its\nrequired abhinaya abundance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali being a\nspeechless art it is termed NRITYA instead of NATYA .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Kathakali takes the anatomic structure of the\nhuman body seriously by making use of the muscular and skeleton parts of the\nhuman body in its structure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike other forms of dance Kathakali focuses on\nthe use of the muscles and priority is given to facial muscles, making the\nmovement of these parts one of the most essential elements in the training\nroutine it employs for new dancers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The positioning of the\nbody has the dancer standing feet apart, soles touching the ground and the\nknees turned out, taking the shape of a rectangle. This position was coined\nMandala sthana.&nbsp;&nbsp; This shape gives the\ndancer the ability to cover space in the same shape as he is. The left foot is\nmet by the right covering one part of the square.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dancer comes back to the\nfirst corner after touching the second corner and the third corner of the\nrectangle by only touching four points of the rectangle in whole. The dancer\nwith the use of his arms and hands moves in shapes of squares or rectangles or\nclearly-drawn diagonals of these rectangles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">There is a reason why the\nTHIRASHEELA has got rectangle tantra mandalas.</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the hands execute\nfigures of eight and the eyes follow these movements occasionally, the movement\nis restricted to the imaginary geometric pattern initially constructed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike\nBharatanatyam, the knees are kept turned out with a distance between the feet\nis maintained at two to three feet. The body is used as one unit or\noccasionally two when the torso is divided into upper and lower parts.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RxZcLzpNkGk/WOT0ypQ2EVI/AAAAAAABSHI/QEVv1StHHp4PPkRluBXNbNBGUIT-PJUWQCLcB/s1600/Kathaskali-1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RxZcLzpNkGk/WOT0ypQ2EVI/AAAAAAABSHI/QEVv1StHHp4PPkRluBXNbNBGUIT-PJUWQCLcB/s640/Kathaskali-1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The technique includes\ncharacteristics like jumps, leaps, spirals, and sweeps. The extension of the\nleg is part of the routine and the shifting of weight from one leg to the other\nis done with ease.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;An essential part of the dancer\u201fs training is the use of the\nfacial muscles separately. The movement of the eyeballs, eyebrows, and lower\neyelids are used precisely as described in Natyasastra unlike any other dance\nform in India.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The training is not considered complete without the mastery of\nthese movements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nritta parts of\nKathakali has the dancer executing jumps and leg-extensions while still\ncovering space in the rectangular&nbsp; shapes\nwithin a Tala or time cycle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>DUH ?<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>DUH !!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; The sea retaliated by swallowing\na large area including Pahruli river and Panmalai Adukkam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BALLS !</b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/kanchi-mutt-creation-of-white-invader.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/kanchi-mutt-creation-of-white-invader.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FAKE Jain monk Ilangovadigal,\nis tom tommed to be the author of Silapathikaram by Kanchi Mutt<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is what Wikipedia\nwrites--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTA :&nbsp; Ilango Adigal was a Chera prince from the 2nd\ncentury AD/CE, who is the author of Silappatikaram, one of the five great epics\nof Tamil literature.[1] Ilango was the brother of Kodungallur - or\nMuziris-based Chera king Cheran Chenguttuvan or Cheralathana Chenguttavan.UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BALLS !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY CHERA KINGDOM WAS\nRULED BY MALAYALI KINGS AND IS KNOWN AS KERALA TODAY. TAMILS NEVER RULED KERALA\u2014THE\nRICHEST AND MOST BEAUTIFUL LAND ON THE PLANET<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHERA KINGDOM WAS NEVER\nCONQUERED , DUE TO OUR KALARI TRADITION.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">KODUNGALLUR&nbsp; WAS THE CULTURAL CENTRE OF CALICUT KING.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">FINALLY &nbsp;FRENCH JEW ROTHSCHILD GAVE LONG RANGE ROCKETS TO\nJEW TIPUSULTANs FATHER JEW HYDER ALI -- AND THIS WAS THE FIRST TIME EVER , CHERA,&nbsp; NORTH MALABAR , KERALA LOST A BATTLE. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">THE CALICUT KING\nCOMMITTED SUICIDE IN SHAME .</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A brass gong also known\nas changila is beaten with a wooden stick to maintain a rhythm or tala. This is\ndone by the singer while standing back stage simultaneously another singer uses\na set of cymbals also known as elatalam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The percussion\norchestra of drums consists of chenda, maddalam, and edakka. Chenda is played\nwith two sticks, Edakka with one stick and Maddalam with both hands. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to the drums,\nthe gong and brass cymbals held by the singers maintain the rhythmic cycles of\nthe performance. There are no wind or string instruments in Kathakali\norchestra.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Christians NGOs\nhave forced the Kathakali dances to dance to wind and string instruments for\nShakaspeare\u2019s plays ( in the name of fusion ) \u2014 which is blasphemy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dance though important,\nis not the main feature in Kathakali. Both the choreography and interpretative\ndance sequences are decided by the dramatic content of the play. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the pure dance\nelements require great skill, the quality of the performance is ultimately\njudged by the dancer's interpretation of the role in mime. The dance movements\nare often explosive rather than delicate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vocal music in\nkathakali includes ragas viz. Khandram, poranira, kanakkurinji, indisa, indilam\nwhich predates Natyashastra, etc<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India &nbsp;Nritya is a COSMIC DANCE the divine outcome of\nfive kriyas of God, viz-- Avirbhava (Universe or creation/ manifestation ), Isthiti\n(Preservation or Protection), Sarhhara ( Destruction ), Tirobhava (Veiling,\nEmbodiment, Illusion or Giving Rest) and Anugraha (Release or Salvation).&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our gods\nare COSMIC ALLEGORIES \u2013except Vishnu\u2019s human avatars like Vamana, Parashurama ,Rama,\nKrishna, Ayyappa etc</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kathakali massages\nand oilbaths are &nbsp;an essential aid to\nawaken muscles, joints and nerves and to control &nbsp;their behaviour. Each part of the body is\nreconditioned to call it &nbsp;into play at a\nslight actions of the actor.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For a free play of emotions each upanga and\npratyanga minor and accessory limb is treated separately; each finger, for\ninstance, has an independent movement, and no two fingers move in sympathy with\neach other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For a small 12 year old\npupil, the most painful part of the training is body massaging by foot. If he\nhas to learn Kathakali he is to submit to it humbly, because of all the various\ntypes of massage the most important is the one which is designed to call the\nbody into the basic Kathakali pose<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/pWC0sKCS5oA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/pWC0sKCS5oA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">THERE ARE NO <span style=\"color: red;\">INSTANT &nbsp;FUCKIN' &nbsp;GRIT\n</span>KATHAKALI DANCERS, UNLESS YOU ARE A JEWESS NAMED LEELA SAMSON -- &nbsp;A FRIEND OF THE ITALIAN WAITRESS</b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>THIS BLOGSITE ASKS THE INDIAN GOVT TO ARREST\nAND FINE FAKE KATHAKALI DANCERS SPONSORED BY FOREIGN FUNDED NGOs\u2014DELIBERATELY SABOTAGING\nKATHAKALI..<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WE DONT NOT WANT &nbsp;HOSPITAL SWEEPERS CLAIMING TO BE BRAIN\nSURGEONS.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2063460100217124084\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_44M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/kathakali-dance-form-of-kerala-part-2.html?showComment=1491278661081#c2063460100217124084\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">April 4, 2017 at 9:34 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_44MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NgcosZPQNZQ&amp;t=1220s<br />\n<br />\nSRI SRI RAVISHANKAR WILL BE ARRESTED IN SOUTH AMERICA THE NEXT TIME HE GOES THERE --AS PER MY SOUTH AMERICAN OFFICERS<br />\n<br />\nPEOPLE HAVE DIED !<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4002999443229292065\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_4M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/steroid-pumped-muscles-do-not-provide.html?showComment=1513658708572#c4002999443229292065\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 19, 2017 at 10:15 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_4MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nThe Banyan tree symbolises eternal life and CHANGE , due to its unending expansion. It is also called the Kalpaka Vriksha or the wish full filling tree, in the Atharva Veda. Every ancient temple had a pool and a banyan tree on the east side<br />\n<br />\nThis is a tree that does NOT grow out of the soil. It grows out of its own branches. The seed alights on the branch, germinates from there and produces handing roots that invade the soils to grow into a new tree. After a couple of centuries the host tree does NOT exist any more, like how the human race changes form.<br />\n<br />\nCHANGE IS THE ONLY CONSTANT.<br />\n<br />\nEvery single village in India has a Banyan tree who stood as a mute spiritual witness to deeds conducted under it. Every village held court, without written records under it, the tree being the sole witness. Under this tree people do NOT tell lies, lest the spirits in the tree get offended.<br />\n<br />\nProvoking the spirits within the tree brings misfortune and ill health. Instant justice was provided under the canopy of this majestic sacred tree of wisdom. People behaved themselves and did not tell lies under a Banyan tree, where the village deity is installed.<br />\n<br />\nIt is about culture--people without culture will never understand this. In India when we are respectful to our parents , it is a part of our culture, and is programmed into our DNA. If you see America TV soaps, all for the sake of canned laughter, just see how a daughter insults her father of a son insults his mother, on wife insults the husband in front of her children. Thank god we do not have such bullshit uncultured serials in India even today.<br />\nIn ancient days the stutterers and the stammer party used to lick honey out of a Peepal leaf to get magic cures. Women keep vrat , walk clockwise around the tree 7 times , and tie sacred thread around the tree, to be removed when the vow is full filled.<br />\n<br />\nIt is written in the Rig Veda written in Sanskrit in 5000 BC, that the Vat Vriksha ( belittled by Vatican as the banyan tree , under which Banias held their shopkeeping business ) has a spiritual role in human life and must be revered.<br />\n<br />\nsri-bhagavan uvaca--<br />\nurdhva-mulam adhah-sakham<br />\nashvattham prahur avyayam<br />\nchandamsi yasya parnani<br />\nyas tam veda sa veda-vit<br />\n<br />\nTranslation: The Blessed Lord said, \u201cThere is a banyan tree which has its roots upward and its branches down and whose leaves are the Vedic hymns. One who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nThe tree of cosmic existence has no beginning and no end, n\u0101nto na c\u0101dih, in space or in time; for it is eternal and imperishable, avyaya. The hymns of the Veda are compared to its leaves and the man who knows this tree of the cosmos is the Veda-knower.<br />\n<br />\nIn the Bhagawat Gita Lord Krishna praises the tree as immortal.Sanatana Dharma ( Hinduism ) is known as a giant banyan tree, under whose shade a thousand faiths bloom.<br />\n<br />\nLord Krishna tells Arjuna in the Kuruskhetra field , just before the war 6000 years ago-<br />\n<br />\n\" This world is a Banyan tree whose roots are above and branches below, and whose attractive leaves are promises of enjoyment. He who knows this tree well knows the methods of gaining such enjoyment. Watered by the three qualities of nature, its branches expand in all directions, upwards and downwards, finally producing buds of enjoyable sense objects. From these branches, roots also fall downwards and find nourishment in the selfish deeds of the mortal world\"<br />\n<br />\nYou must search out what is beyond it; some place from which no one ever strays. There, finally, seek for that Original Person \u2013 the ancient one from whom the true tree grows \u2013 and give yourself to him.<br />\n<br />\nThe upside-down tree is the banyan tree, representing the material world, which is a perverted reflection of the spiritual world. The demigods are on the top branches, the human beings are on the middle branches, and the animals are on the lower branches. A man disentangles himself from the tree by cutting it with the WEAPON OF DETACHMENT.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_4MN\" kind=\"m\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/null\" kind=\"i\" o=\"r\" style=\"color: #888888; padding-right: 5px; padding-top: 5px; text-decoration-line: none;\" target=\"_self\">Delete</a></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_4BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_1TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_1TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_4b+seedGzED\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_1B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8502180205573181103\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_1M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/steroid-pumped-muscles-do-not-provide.html?showComment=1513658815543#c8502180205573181103\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 19, 2017 at 10:16 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_1MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nThe entanglement of this material world is compared here to a banyan tree. For one who is engaged in fruitive activities, there is no end to the banyan tree. He wanders from one branch to another, to another, to another. The tree of this material world has no end, and for one who is attached to this tree, there is no possibility of liberation.<br />\n<br />\nThe Vedic hymns, meant for elevating oneself, are called the leaves of this tree. This tree's roots grow upward because they begin from where Brahma is located, the topmost planet of this universe. If one can understand this indestructible tree of MAYA (illusion) , then one can get out of it.<br />\n<br />\nThe banyan tree can be found beside a reservoir of temple pond water. We can see that the trees on the bank reflect upon the water with their branches down and roots up. The tree of this material world is only a reflection of the real tree of the spiritual world. This reflection of the spiritual world is situated on desire, just as a tree's reflection is on water.<br />\n<br />\nDesire is the cause of things being situated in this reflected material light. One who wants to get out of this material existence must know this tree thoroughly through study of the Vedas . Then he can cut off his relationship with it.<br />\n<br />\nA reflection is temporary, for it is sometimes seen and sometimes not seen. But the origin from whence the reflection is reflected is eternal. The material reflection of the real tree has to be cut off.<br />\n<br />\nWhen it is said that a person knows the Vedas, it is assumed that he knows how to cut off attachment to this material world. If one knows that process, he actually knows the Vedas.<br />\n<br />\nOne who is attracted by the ritualistic formulas of the Vedas is attracted by the beautiful green leaves of the tree. He does not exactly know the true purpose of the Vedas.<br />\n<br />\nThe purpose of the Vedas, as disclosed by the Personality of Godhead Himself, is to CUT DOWN THE REFLECTED TREE and attain the real tree of the spiritual world.<br />\n<br />\nTO UNDERSTAND THIS PROFOUND TRUTH, EVERY TEMPLE HAS A WATER BODY WITH A BANYAN TREE REFLECTED IN THE WATER.<br />\n<br />\nLord Krishna tells Arjuna 6000 years ago at the battlefield of Kurukshetra --<br />\n\"The branches of this tree extend downward and upward, nourished by the three modes of material nature. The twigs are the objects of the senses. This tree also has roots going down, and these are bound to the fruitive actions of human society.\"<br />\nBhagavad-gita 15:2<br />\n<br />\nThe real root is from Brahmaloka, and the other roots are in the human planetary systems. After one enjoys the results of virtuous activities in the upper planetary systems ( one of the lower 6 dimensions ) , he comes down to this earth to lighten his KARMIC BAGGAGE , in the hope of attaining the topmost 7th dimension for MOKSHA.<br />\n<br />\n\"The real form of this tree cannot be perceived in this world. No one can understand where it ends, where it begins, or where its foundation is. But with determination one must cut down this tree with the weapon of detachment. So doing, one must seek that place from which, having once gone, one never returns, and there surrender to that Supreme Personality of Godhead from whom everything has began and in whom everything is abiding since time immemorial.<br />\n<br />\naham sarvasya prabhavah, \"I am the origin of everything.\"<br />\n<br />\nTo get out of the entanglement of this strong banyan tree of material life, one must surrender to Krishna. As soon as one surrenders unto Krishna, he becomes detached automatically from this material extension.<br />\nIn Bhagawat Gita Sri Krishna tells Prince Arjuna before the great war. \" Of all the trees I am the Banyan tree\". This is where the creation and destruction of the Cosmos comes. This is the concept of Singularity ( which Einstein did NOT understand ) or the Bindu of the Sri Yantra sacred geometry.<br />\n<br />\nWhen you have a big bang which created the cosmos, you need to have a black hole singularity too.<br />\n<br />\nPeepal trees emit positive energy-- the peepal ( female ) and banyan tree (male ) has a HUGE aura. This is NOT superstition.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_1MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/delete-comment.g?blogID=3564735312144269387&amp;postID=8502180205573181103\" o=\"d\" style=\"color: #888888; padding-right: 5px; padding-top: 5px; text-decoration-line: none;\" target=\"_self\">Delete</a></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_1BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_1B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_2B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1519618927496853393\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_2M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/steroid-pumped-muscles-do-not-provide.html?showComment=1513658935990#c1519618927496853393\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 19, 2017 at 10:18 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_2MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2--<br />\n<br />\nRightly after Independence the Indian Govt has chosen Banyan tree as our national tree, for here is a a tree that regenerates unlike other trees, and is immortal unless sabotaged..<br />\n<br />\nThe Bindu of the Sri yantra represents singularity. The cosmos expands and contracts at regular cycles as explained by Sri Krishna in the Bhagawat Gita--just like inhalation and exhalation.<br />\n<br />\nSingularity existed before the big-bang.<br />\naha\u1e3f sarvasya prabhavo<br />\nmatta\u1e25 sarva\u1e3f pravartate<br />\n<br />\nI am the origin of everything<br />\nEverything comes from me<br />\nVarahamihira the great Astrologer and astronomer from wrote 4600 years ago, in the opening of his Samhita, \u201c It has been said in Vedas that the first primeval thing was darkness, which is not identical with the black colour, but a kind of non-existence like the state of a sleeping person. The big bang is merely a prelude to the big crunch, and the universe is caught in an infinite cycle of expansion and contraction, symbolizing the primordial black-hole like state is Aditi, the mother of all mothers and the mother of the cosmos .<br />\n<br />\nWe exist in the dot or Turiya or stillness of OM, in absolute consciousness-- which is the equilibrium of Bindu. We are unaware of the zero point field , as a fish is unaware of the water..<br />\n<br />\nAs per the Vedas the sole witness to the cosmic deluge is Maharishi Markandeya.<br />\n<br />\nIt was stated by the Lord in the Vedas: \u201cOh, Human! This village of yours is balanced on the banyan leaf and your lifespan is just a like a drop of water running down that leaf, which may fall any minute.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nSuddenly, amongst all the confusion, Markandeya noticed a banyan leaf floating on the ocean, tossed by the waves. On this unlikely raft lay a beautiful and adorable child, suckling his right toe, unperturbed by the calamity that had befallen the world. It was Vishnu, the newborn cosmic child. The infant's heavenly smile negated the brutality of the pralaya (cosmic deluge). His compassionate glance reassured Markandeya that life would go on, convincing him that the world never ends, but only changes.<br />\n<br />\nWhen Markandeya went close to this baby, he was sucked in with the air, when the baby took a breath.<br />\n<br />\nInside, he saw hundreds of thousand of universes and all that had been consumed by the deluge - the skies, the seas, the earth, gods, demons, humans, animals and plants.<br />\n<br />\nSo much so, that he even had a glimpse of his own Ashram on the banks of the Subhadra River. He saw himself sitting in meditation. Markandeya thus realized that the child was none other than the cosmic god (Narayana) who had withdrawn the world into himself. In that vast sea he again saw the banyan tree growing on the tiny island and the infant boy lying within the leaf.<br />\n<br />\nThe child ( Vishnu ) glanced at him from the corner of His eyes with a smile imbued with the nectar of love, and Markandeya took Him into his heart through his eyes. Greatly agitated, the sage ran to embrace the transcendental Personality of Godhead. At that moment the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is the original master of all mysticism and who is hidden within everyone's heart, became invisible to the sage, just as the achievements of an incompetent person can suddenly vanish.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the Lord disappeared, O brahmana, the banyan tree, the great water and the dissolution of the universe all vanished as well, and in an instant Markandeya found himself back in his own hermitage, just as before.<br />\n<br />\nHere Lord Vishnu after reversing the big bang, turned himself into a child ( read as DNA from cosmos ) as small as that could fit on a tiny leaf of a banyan tree, floating in the Aakasha , until he himself decides to recreate everything back out from himself.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 4--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_2MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/delete-comment.g?blogID=3564735312144269387&amp;postID=1519618927496853393\" o=\"d\" style=\"color: #888888; Sri Krishna died ( as he willed- iccha mrityu ) under a banyan tree, shot on the foot by an archer, whom he had killed in his previous birth.<br />\n<br />\nIf you get high on Soma ( the ancient super LSD ) you will see banyan tree leaves blue in colour, and you can talk to the tree for hours together.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_4b+seedGzED\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_4b+seedGzED\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<ol id=\"bc_0_176TB\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_172B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1348481307020028419\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_172M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. />\nDraupadi asked Lord Shiva ( BOON ) to bless her with a husband who had five of the best qualities a man can ever have: dharma, strength, archery skills, good looks, patience<br />\n<br />\nLord Shiva ( COSMIC ALLEGORY ) laughed and said that she will not be able to find one man with all these 5 qualities-- instead she shall marry five men who shall possess each of her mentioned qualities.<br
