id=\"c2334339893735492470\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_173MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_173BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_173B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_175B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c236000836569887077\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_175M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/steroid-pumped-muscles-do-not-provide.html?showComment=1513899174704#c236000836569887077\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 22, 2017 at 5:02 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_175MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nDRAUPADI IS YAJNASENI -- BORN OUT OF HOMAM FIRE-- AN ALLEGORY..( HEAT OF KUNDALINI )<br />\n<br />\nAnd, 'auspicious, eye-ravishing, large-black-eyed Panchali rose from the yajna altar, Dark-skinned Panchali Lotus-eyed lady,wavy-haired Panchali, Hair like dark blue clouds, Shining coppery carved nails, Soft eye-lashes, Swelling breasts Shapely thighs. A girl like goddess born to humans. 'There was none on earth to match her loveliness. Gods, anti-gods, and yakshas yearned for such celestial beauty.' (169:45-47, Adi Parva, Mahabharata)<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi\u2019s biological parents were Agni and Swaha . She was adopted by Drupad, King of Panchala, which is why her name was changed from Agni Jyotsna to Princess of Panchala to Drupad Kanya to Draupadi. The sages called her Yajna Seni as she was born from the sacrificial fire.<br />\n<br />\nShe was a fully grown woman, dressed in the best of sSilk, unusually rare jewelry. A dark complexioned maiden, so dark, that when her hair brushed over her face, the black raven like hair, looked golden brown, so dark was her complexion.<br />\n<br />\nVoluptuous with a slender waist. She had a naturally aromatic odor that could be sensed a \u2018yojana\u2019 away (a measurement for distance).<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi as Kundalini has five human chakras she has to cross before she finds refuge in the topmost Sahasrara chakra ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE BASTARD WHITE INVADER MADE DRAUPADI A DAUGHTER (NALAYANI ) OF NALA AND DAMAYANTI IN HER PREVIOUS BIRTH .. WE IN INDIA NEVER HEARD OF NALA AND DAMAYANTI TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA.<br />\n<br />\nRAHU AND KETU WERE WOVEN INTO THE \"BHAKTI MOVEMENT \" BULLSHIT STORY .. Ajit Vadakayil<br />December 29, 2017 at 5:18 AM<br /><br />BEFORE THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA--<br /><br />FULL MOON DAY ( POORNIMA ) AND THREE DAYS FOLLOWING IT..<br /><br />AND ..<br /><br />NEW MOON DAY ( AMAVASYA ) -- AND THREE DAYS FOLLOWING IT..<br /><br />WERE HOLIDAYS --FOR FASTING ..<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/amavasya-poornima-ekadashi-fasting.html<br /><br />SIX FIXED HOLIDAYS IN A MONTH\u2026<br /><br />IF YOU DO THIS TODAY IN MODERN TIMES--AND EAT ORGANIC FOOD , YOU WILL NOT GET CANCER..<br /><br />WHEN THE EVIL WHITE INVADER-- BASTARD-- CAME TO INDIA-- HE MADE US WORSE THAN MONKEYS BY MAKING US FAST ON WRONG MEANINGLESS DATES ..<br /><br />BY 1947 JEW ROTHSCHILD CREATED HUNDREDS OF FAKE MUTTS IN INDIA. \u2026 HE MADE THE PONTIFFS OF THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS CRYPTO JEWS WITH PALE EYES --STOPPING THE 4000 YEAR OLD TRADITION OK KERALA NAMBOODIRIS HEADING THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS ..<br /><br />THE POST ABOVE IS THE REPEAT THE MOST IMPORTANT FOR 1.1 BILLION HINDUS ON THIS PLANET..<br /><br />SPRING TIDES ARE STRONGEST THREE DAYS-- REPEAT ---THREE DAYS AFTER FULL MOON AND NEW MOON..<br /><br />Tides are long-period waves that roll around the planet as the ocean is \"pulled\" back and forth by the gravitational pull of the moon and the sun as these bodies interact with the Earth in their monthly and yearly orbits\u2026<br /><br />During full or new moons\u2014which occur when the Earth, sun, and moon are nearly in alignment\u2014average tidal ranges are slightly larger. ..This occurs twice each month. ..<br /><br />The moon appears new (dark) when it is directly between the Earth and the sun. The moon appears full when the Earth is between the moon and the sun. In both cases, the gravitational pull of the sun is \"added\" to the gravitational pull of the moon on Earth, causing the oceans to bulge a bit more than usual. This means that high tides are a little higher and low tides are a little lower than average.<br /><br />Spring tides, has nothing to do with the season of spring. Rather, the term is derived from the concept of the tide \"springing forth.\" ..<br /><br />Spring tides occur twice each lunar month all year long, without regard to the season\u2026.<br /><br />http://tides.mobilegeographics.com/calendar/month/547.html<br /><br />IN THE LINK ABOVE YOU CAN SEE THAT FULL MOON IS ON 3RD DEC 2017..<br /><br />THREE DAYS LATER THE DATE IS 6TH DEC..<br /><br />THE HIGH TIDE ( SPRING ) IS 12.5 METRES --THE HIGHEST..<br /><br />JEW ROTHSCHILD TOOK AWAY INDIANS TO WORK AS INDENTURED LABOUR.. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE : Kathakali primarily developed as a\nHindu performance art in the Malayalam-speaking southwestern region of India\n(Kerala).[2][3][5]&nbsp; Kathakali's roots are\nunclear. The fully developed style of Kathakali originated around the 17th\ncentury. The vocal performance has traditionally been Sanskritised\nMalayalam.[6] In modern compositions, Indian Kathakali troupes have included\nwomen artists,[4] as well as adapted Western stories and plays such as those by\nShakespeare and from Christianity. The roots of Kathakali are unclear. Jones\nand Ryan state it is more than 500 years old. According to Phillip Zarrilli,\nKathakali emerged as a distinct genre of performance art during the 16th and\n17th centuries in a coastal population of south India that spoke Malayalam (now\nKerala).[19]QUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SORRY-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KATHAKALI IS NOT A RECENT DANCE FORM.&nbsp; &nbsp;IT IS &nbsp;DOZENS OF MILLINIUMS OLD PREDATING VISHNU FIRST\nHUMAN AVATAR OF VAMANA ( THE BLUE FACED BRAHMIN MIDGET )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A 34,000 YEAR OLD NARASIMHA IDOL WAS\nUNEARTHED AT LONE VALLEY ALPS GERMANY.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ten Vishnu Avatars are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1. Matsya (the fish) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">2. Koorma (the tortoise)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">3. Varaha (the boar)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">4. Narasimha (the human-lion)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">5. Vamana (the dwarf)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">6. Parasurama (the angry man, Rama with an\naxe)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">7. Lord Rama (the perfect man, king of\nAyodha)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">8. Lord Krishna (the divine statesman) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">9. Lord Ayyappa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">10. Kalki (the mighty warrior)--the FINAL\navatar<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE FIRST FOUR AVATARS OF VISHNU ARE COSMIC\nALLEGORIES .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">FROM VAMANA AVATAR ONWARDS VISHNU AVATARS\nWERE MORTALS , WHO ALLOWED THEMSELVES TO BE RULED BY LAWS OF KARMA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IN KERALA WE DO NOT CELEBRATE DIWALI THOUGH\nTHE WHOLE OF INDIA CELEBRATES IT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">REASON ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IN INDIA WE ARE KNOWN BY OUR FESTIVALS WHICH\nHAVE CARRIED ON FOR THOUSANDS OF YEARS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">WE IN KERALA DO NOT CELEBRATE HOLI TOO. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BECAUSE WE WERE AT THE RECEIVING END OF THIS\nHIRANYAKASHIPU SERIES ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SHUKRACARYA WAS THE MENTOR OF KERALA DANAVA KING\nMAHABALI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">SHUKRACHARYA CREATED THE KATHAKALI DANCE FORM\nTO EDUCATE &nbsp;KERALA CITIZENS OF THE DANAVA\nLINEAGE OF THEIR BELOVED KING MAHABALI \u2013&nbsp;\n<span style=\"color: red;\">HIRANYAKASHIPU</span> &nbsp;( <span style=\"color: red;\">Vishnu's Vaikunta gatekeeper Vijaya reborn</span> )\u2014 PRAHALADA\u2014 &nbsp;VIROCHANA \u2013 &nbsp;MAHABALI.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">My revelations now jump to </span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>35.5 %</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below:- Vishnu's beloved gatekeepers at the gates of Vaikunta -- JAYA and VIJAYA -- cursed </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">by the 4 Sanat kumaras &nbsp;(&nbsp;</span></b></span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: #134f5c;\">Sanaka, Sanandana, Sanatana and Sanatkumara</span> )&nbsp;</span><b>who were denied entry while Vishnu was sleeping . This episode is a cosmic allegory..&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/lord-shiva-as-first-guru-dakshinamurthy.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/lord-shiva-as-first-guru-dakshinamurthy.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>JAYA would be reborn as HIRANYAKSHA ( killed by Vishnu avatar Varaha ) , RAVANA ( killed by Vishnu avatar Rama ) , SISHUPALA ( killed by Vishnu avatar Krishna ). &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>VIJAYA would be reborn as <span style=\"color: red;\">HIRANYAKASHIPU </span>( killed by Vishnu avatar Narasimha ) . KUMBHAKARNA ( killed by Rama ) , &nbsp;DANTAVAKRA ( killed by Krishna )&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Krishna's main unwritten mission was to eliminate 100 test tube babies ( Kauravas )&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; I surrender to Lord Nrsimha, the origin of all things and the\nsupreme refuge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">tava kara-kamala-vare\nnakham adbhuta-\u015b\u1e5b\u0144ga\u1e3f<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">dalita-hira\u1e47yaka\u015bipu-tanu-bh\u1e5b\u0144gam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">ke\u015bava dh\u1e5bta-narahari-r\u016bpa\njaya jagad\u012b\u015ba hare.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">O Kesava! O Lord of the\nuniverse! O Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of half-man, half-lionl All\nglories to You! lust as one can easily crush a wasp between one's fingernails,\nso in the same way the body of the wasp like demon Hiranyakasipu has been\nripped apart by the wonderful pointed nails on Your beautiful lotus hands.</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cIM69ePi2VM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cIM69ePi2VM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali was all about the fights between\ngood and bad forces\u2014 DEVAS AND DANAVAS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">I &nbsp;AM A\nDANAVA FROM KERALA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SIX CAN BECOME NINE , DEPENDING ON VIEWING PERSPECTIVE\n.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;AN INDIAN MUSLIM IS GOOD , A PAKISTANI MUSLIM\nIS BAD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA,\nKATHAKALI ONLY DID PURANA STORIES OF \u2013&nbsp;\nHIRANYAKASHIPU \u2014 PRAHALADA\u2014 VIROCHANA \u2013 MAHABALI.</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-d8hRNpnf7oo/WOBdccxAtMI/AAAAAAABR_c/Ykbdi01G0A46QsDSK0-3maPkd8xAc0dwgCLcB/s1600/dowwwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-d8hRNpnf7oo/WOBdccxAtMI/AAAAAAABR_c/Ykbdi01G0A46QsDSK0-3maPkd8xAc0dwgCLcB/s400/dowwwnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ASHWAMEDHA IS NOT A HORSE SACRIFICE LIKE WHAT\nWENDY DONIGER, &nbsp;SHELDON POLLOCK, JNU\nCOMMIE PROFESSORS , LITERARY FEST DESH DROHIS etc &nbsp;SAY. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IT IS A TRANSPARENT VOTE OF CONFIDENCE FOR A\nKING TO DECLARE HIMSELF EMPEROR ( KING OF KINGS )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SHUKRACHARYA FORCED KING MAHABALI TO DO THE\nASHWAMEDHA YAGA , &nbsp;AND DECLARE HIMSLEF\nEMPEROR \u2013WITH SEVERAL DEVA KINGS UNDER HIS RULE .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THIS UPSET THE DEVAS AND VISNNU TOOK THE\nVAMANA AVATAR TO BANISH MAHABALI TO PATALA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/ashwamedha-yagam-bloodless-sacrifice.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/ashwamedha-yagam-bloodless-sacrifice.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Bhagavat\nPurana, a Danava king named Hiranyakashipu had the intense desire to be\nimmortal.&nbsp; &nbsp;He was Vishnu\u2019s gatekeeper Vijaya , who was\nreborn later as Kumbhakarna ( Ravana\u2019s brother ) and Dantavakra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/shishupala-and-dantavakra-third-re.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/shishupala-and-dantavakra-third-re.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To fulfill this desire,\nhe performed severe Tapas ( penances ) .&nbsp;\nHe was granted a boon by Brahma. &nbsp;Since\nthe Gods rarely granted immortality, he used his guile and cunning to get a\nboon that he thought made him immortal.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The boon gave Hiranyakashyapu five\nspecial powers: he could be killed by neither a human being nor an animal,\nneither indoors nor outdoors, neither at day nor at night, neither by astra (\nscalar projectile weapons) nor by any shastra (handheld weapons), and neither\non land nor in water or air or by anything born from a living womb<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;As this wish was granted, Hiranyakashyapu felt\ninvincible, which made him arrogant with opposite camp bitter rivals\nDevas.&nbsp; &nbsp;His son Prahlad was unhappy with his father\u2019s\narrogance.&nbsp; He continued keeping good\nrelations with Devas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This made\nHiranyakashipu very angry , he considered his own son Prahalad as a traitor and\nmade various attempts to kill Prahlad. &nbsp;During\na particular attempt on Prahlad's life, King Hiranyakashyapu called upon his\nsister Holika for help. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Holika had a\nspecial cloak garment that prevented her from being harmed by fire.\nHiranyakashyapu asked her to sit on a bonfire with Prahlad, by tricking the boy\nto sit on her lap.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, as the fire roared, Prahalada chanted Narayana\nmantra --- the garment flew from Holika and covered Prahlad. Holika burnt to\ndeath, Prahlad came out unharmed. Holi festival is to celebrate Holika\u2019s death.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;Holika was not aware that the boon\nworked only when she entered the fire alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prahalada prayed to\nVishnu to kill his own father .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu appeared in the\nform of Narasimha - half human and half lion, at dusk (when it was neither day\nnor night), took Hiranyakashyapu at a doorstep (which was neither indoors nor\noutdoors), placed him on his lap (which was neither land, water nor air), and\nthen eviscerated and killed the king with his lion claws (which were neither a\nhandheld weapon nor a launched weapon).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this form, the boon of five special\npowers granted to Hiranyakashyapu were no longer useful.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prahlad was free of fear of\nHiranyakashyapu, showing the victory of good over evil ( sic )..</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the death of his\nfather, Prahlada took his father's kingdom and ruled peacefully and virtuously.\nHe was known for his generosity and kindness. He sowed similar seeds in his son\nVirochana and grandson Mahabali.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But Mahabali made bitter rivals Devas nervous\nwhen he did the Ashwamedha Yagna. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Shukracharya the mentor of Danavas was in fact getting even with his classmate and bitter rival Brihaspati, the mentor of Devas &nbsp;. &nbsp; Shukracharya was better than Brihaspati every which way at the Gurukul but the Guru Maharishi Angirasa &nbsp;( Brihaspati's father ) always supported his own son . &nbsp; Angirasa suggested the name of his own son when Devas wanted a mentor . To add to enmity Brihaspati's son Kacha did LOVE JIHAD of Shukrachary's beautiful daughter Devyani.</span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7Eyeo3-kOr4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7Eyeo3-kOr4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nwas a time when India ruled the whole planet &nbsp;half the planet worshipped Shukracharya and\nthe other half worshipped Brihaspati.&nbsp;\nVirochana and Mahabali ruled the whole planet \u2013based in Kerala. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This continued to 7000\nBC.&nbsp; After 7000 BC , India ruled from\nPalestine to Urals to Vietnam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Mahabali was the descendant of &nbsp;sage Kashyapa. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kerala Hindus,\nMuslims, Christians \u2013all celebrate Onam in memory of our beloved King Mahabali.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/onam-2012-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/onam-2012-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Mahabali was\nbanished to Patala at his prime \u2013 his old father Virochana ( son of Prahalada )\ncame back to the throne he vacated.&nbsp; He was\nalso killed by deceit by the devas.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nBlessed with a dazzling golden crown, a boon from the sun-god.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virochana had received the benediction that\nhe could not be killed as long as he wore the crown.&nbsp;&nbsp; Knowing this, the devas conspired against\nhim. Disguised as sages, they entreated him, and the generous Virochana vowed\nto grant their wish. They begged for his crown.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even though Virochana\nrecognized the demigods' plot, true to his word he parted with his crown and\nhis life as well. (Srimad-Bhagavatam 8.19.14 -5000 BC )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/maya-inca-aztec-civilizations-decoded.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/maya-inca-aztec-civilizations-decoded.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/thor-zeus-marduk-brihaspati-and-jupiter.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/thor-zeus-marduk-brihaspati-and-jupiter.html</a></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/shukracharya-is-ahura-mazda-god-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/shukracharya-is-ahura-mazda-god-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kathakali\nis a complex amalgam of culture , story, dance, theatre, poetry, vocals and\npercussion, each component governed by well-defined rules .&nbsp; It takes decades to be qualify as a Kathakali\ndancer, starting at a young age . <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QuIH1ZuA6tE/WN9kPeHk1GI/AAAAAAABR-0/JTf_Rg3N4vIxJEZgYYt0-bx0nT60eRJcwCLcB/s1600/bec85150988603d4400d3d3f399a9ec7a1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QuIH1ZuA6tE/WN9kPeHk1GI/AAAAAAABR-0/JTf_Rg3N4vIxJEZgYYt0-bx0nT60eRJcwCLcB/s640/bec85150988603d4400d3d3f399a9ec7a1.jpg\" width=\"452\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This\nis NOT some stupid tip-toe on toes , splaying your legs , &nbsp;showing your camel toe/ ass to the accompaniment of a\nhollering soprano male/ female&nbsp; quivering\ntheir deep throats . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOG_video_class\" contentid=\"bc9c1149c439c89\" height=\"266\" id=\"BLOG_video-bc9c1149c439c89\" width=\"320\"></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1SwFNm-rToQ/WN9j9LxjtxI/AAAAAAABR-w/_QjR2v-ktw8cEfsmZJh8n64TowoIYyubgCLcB/s1600/doSwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1SwFNm-rToQ/WN9j9LxjtxI/AAAAAAABR-w/_QjR2v-ktw8cEfsmZJh8n64TowoIYyubgCLcB/s400/doSwnload.jpg\" width=\"363\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">You\nmust do your homework before viewing a Kathakali performance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is imperative\nthat you know the story line and characters&nbsp;\nto appreciate what is going on with just eye / facial muscles rasa /\nfinger mudra /&nbsp; hand / leg movements and\ndrums.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With\nthis post I expect a surge of interest and grand revival of Kathakali.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Below: There are NO females in Kathakali&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1uIan6u3UrQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1uIan6u3UrQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: Chemancheri Kunhiraman Nair is from my father's village. &nbsp; This 100 year old Kathakali dancer was given the Padma award in 2017</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/vqPvo-H-1Xg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/vqPvo-H-1Xg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pdiWR6yvsFA/WN9jzZK7VRI/AAAAAAABR-s/EezxBNOhF0U_qdW17RuksZoq9dynBZzuwCLcB/s1600/MaEster.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"403\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pdiWR6yvsFA/WN9jzZK7VRI/AAAAAAABR-s/EezxBNOhF0U_qdW17RuksZoq9dynBZzuwCLcB/s640/MaEster.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7CXvXQkaa0g/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7CXvXQkaa0g?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali is a dance\ncombined with &nbsp;acting. It is THE most\ndifficult acts to execute on stage, with young artists preparing for their\nroles for decades &nbsp;before they get a\nchance to do it on stage.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actors speak a \"sign language\", where\nthe word part of the character's dialogue are expressed through \"hand\nsigns (mudras)\", while emotions and mood is expressed through \"facial\nand eye\" movements.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In parallel, vocalists in the background sing\nrhythmically the play, matching the beats of the orchestra playing, thus\nunifying the ensemble into a resonant oneness. If you understand the process,\nit is terrific<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">KATHAKALI IS MEANT FOR THE ELITE INTELLECTUALS --&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">--NOT CULTURELESS HALFWIT BUMPKINS</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">IF THE ENTIRE WESTERN DANCE AND DRAMA IS A ONE PAGE BOOK--&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">KATHAKALI IS A TEN THOUSAND PAGE BOOK -WITH NO SUPERFLUOUS&nbsp;WORDS&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THE WHITE MAN HAS KILLED KATHAKALI</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">DURING THE 800 YEAR RULE OF INVADERS KATHAKALI FELL INTO RUIN</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THE WHITE INVADER GAVE MONEY AND REDUCED PROUD KATHAKALI DANCERS TO PERFORMING SHAKESPEAREs PLAYS &nbsp;, &nbsp;JESUS AND MARY MAGDALENE , JEW ROTHSCHILDs FAKE CREATIONS LIKE &nbsp;NALA DAMAYANTI ROMANCE etc&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS WAS LIKE ASKING A RESPECTED GURU TO DANCE LIKE AN ASSHOLE ROTATING ON HIS HEAD , IN A DISCO&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS POST WILL REVIVE KATHAKALI TO ITS ANCIENT GLORY. &nbsp; YES, WATCH OUT FOR THE </span><span style=\"color: red;\">ART OF WRITING&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/01/the-art-of-writing-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/01/the-art-of-writing-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Natya Shastra&nbsp;\n( used for Kathakali by Shukracharya ) was transmitted orally for more\nthan 33 millenniums along with the Vedas was finally penned down in 5000 BC by\nBharata Muni ( sic ) consisting of&nbsp; 12,\n200 verses structured into 39 chapters.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">INDIA IS NAMED <b><span style=\"color: red;\">BHARAT</span></b>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">sorry- &nbsp;THE REAL NAME IS &nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">BHA</span></b>- <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">RA</span></b>- <b><span style=\"color: purple;\">TA</span></b> .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">( MY REVELATIONS NOW JUMP TO </span><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 200%;\"><b>36.0 % </b></span><span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">)</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Bharata is an acronym for the three\nsyllables: &nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">bha for bhaava </span></b>(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">emotion) , <span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>ra for raaga </b></span>&nbsp;( melody) , and\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">ta for taala &nbsp;</span></b>(rhythm).</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">Natya Shastra\nlike Vedas have NO author as it is a SRUTI .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">The white invader converted Bharata into a MUNI ( sage ).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">It is Natya\nShastra of Bharata ( India )</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">NOT written\nby a person named</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\">Bharata</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;The&nbsp; verses are in precise\nAnustubh meter (4x8, or exactly 32 syllables in every shloka)..</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term Kathakali is\nderived from Katha &nbsp;which means\n\"story, e\", and Kali which means \"performance\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Kathakali has roots in the aesthetics of\nNatyashastra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Traditionally, a\nKathakali performance is long, starting at dusk and continuing through dawn,\nwith interludes and breaks for the performers and audience. Some plays\ncontinued over several nights, alomost like a modern TV serial starting at dusk\neveryday..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The stage with seating typically in open grounds outside a temple,\nbut in some places special theatres called Kuttampalam built inside the temple\ncompounds have been in use<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The performance is in\nthe front of a huge Kalivilakku (kali meaning dance; vilakku meaning lamp) with\nits thick wick sunk in coconut oil, burning with a yellow light<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathakali\u2019s generic\nstructure may be viewed in terms of mudras (hand gestures), rhythm, body\nmovements (kinetics), body language (kinesics), performance methods, costumes\nand make-up (aharya).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rasa is prepared,\nstates Natya Shastra, through a creative synthesis and expression of vibhava\n(determinants), anubhava (consequents) and vyabhicharibhava (transitory\nstates).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the process of\nemotionally engaging the individual in the audience, the text outlines the use\nof eight sentiments \u2013 loving, comic, pathetic, terrible, furious, odious,\nheroic and marvelous..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Natyashastra defines drama as that which\naesthetically arouses joy in the spectator, through the medium of actor's art\nof communication, that helps connect and transport the individual into a super\nsensual inner state of being.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drama in this ancient\nSanskrit text, thus is an art to engage every aspect of life, in order to\nglorify and gift a state of joyful consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The text discusses the\nuniversal and inner principles of drama, that it asserts successfully affects\nand journeys the audience to a supersensual state of discovery and\nunderstanding. The stories and plots were provided by the Itihasas (epics), the\nPuranas and the Kathas genre of Hindu literature<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The function of drama\nand the art of theatre, as envisioned in Natyashastra&nbsp; is to restore the human potential, man's\njourney of \"delight at a higher level of consciousness\", and a life\nthat is enlightened.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just like the taste of\nfood, states Natyashastra, is determined by combination of vegetables, spices\nand other articles such as sugar and salt, the audience tastes dominant states\nof a drama through expression of words, gestures and temperaments.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These\ndominant states are love, mirth, sorrow, anger, energy, terror, disgust and\nastonishment.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 33\npsychological states which are transitory such as discouragement, weakness,\napprehension, intoxication, tiredness, anxiety, agitation, despair, impatience<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;There are eight temperamental states that a\ndrama can deploy to carry its message.[69] The text describes four means of\ncommunication between the actors and the audience \u2013 words, gestures, dresses\nand aharya (make ups, cosmetics), all of which should be harmonious with the\ntemperament envisioned in the drama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ideal poem produces\nbliss in the reader, or listener. It transports the audience into an\nimaginative world, transforms his inner state, and delivers him to a higher\nlevel of consciousness, suggests Natyashastra. Great songs do not instruct or\nlecture, they delight and liberate from within to a state of godlike ecstasy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The text defines the\nbasic dance unit to be a karana, which is a specific combination of the hands\nand feet integrated with specific body posture and gait (sthana and chari\nrespectively).&nbsp; There are 108 karanas as\nthe building blocks to the art of dance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The text states the\nvarious movements of major and minor limbs with facial states as means of\narticulating ideas and expressing emotions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse 28.21 of Natya\nShastra introduced the musical scale as follows,( &nbsp;stolen and patented by the white man -- Do,\nRe, Mi, Fa, So, La, Ti--)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0924\u094d\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0930\u093e\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0937\u0921\u094d\u091c\u0936\u094d\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090b\u0937\u092d\u0936\u094d\u091a\u0948\u0935</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0927\u093e\u0930\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u0927\u094d\u092f\u092e\u0938\u094d\u0924\u0925\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u091e\u094d\u091a\u092e\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u0948\u0935\u0924\u0936\u094d\u091a\u0948\u0935</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u092a\u094d\u0924\u092e\u094b\u093d\u0925</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0968\u0967\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009Natya Shastra, 28.21-&nbsp; 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
