Shells can come in different shapes and sizes, and the\njurisdiction in which they reside can help further the concealment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In June 2012, Global\nWitness, an international anti-corruption organization, published a report,\n\"Grave Secrecy,\" which documented the shell companies and\ninternational criminal networks in and around Russia and Kyrgyzstan that were\ninvolved in money laundering, corruption and fraud.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In one case, the\nidentity of a dead man from Russia was used as the front for a UK company.\nWhile this person had died three years before the company was set up, he was\nlisted as the company's owner and he even \u2018attended' a company meeting in\nLondon,\" stated the report.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Global Witnesses'\ninvestigation identified more than 20 companies that at first glance didn't\nappear connected to one another. But a detailed review of the directors,\nconnections, and business addresses yielded a very large interconnected network\nthat spanned several countries. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By visiting the site,\nit can be determined what physical structure is located at the known address\nand whether the address is consistent with the entity structure. Private detectives\noften will perform the procedure for a nominal charge, so the use of one may be\nuseful for verifying entities that are not located in your geographic area.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shell\u2019s bank\naccount was created under the same false identification used to set up the\nshell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Six suspects in USA\nwere arrested for creating multiple shell companies to hide workers and\npayroll. Ringleaders provided fake business cards to work crews. They were told\nto present the cards to state investigators who showed up onsite to inspect for\nproper workers-compensation coverage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Millions of dollars in\nwages can be quickly funneled through a shell company. No year-end\nworkers-compensation premium audit will be conducted because the shell company\nowner will be un-traceable. Nor does the shell pay any payroll taxes. The\nfacilitator also routinely burns the shell and forms a new one once or twice a\nyear to throw off investigators. The shell may be burned sooner if an employee\nhas a catastrophic injury.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Workers-compensation\ninsurers collectively lose billions of dollars in premiums annually.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Insurer searches of the\nInsurance Services Office claims database now are locating duplicate injury\nclaims for the same date of loss.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The related impact: Injured workers involved\nin shell schemes are suing insurers under commercial general liability policies\nthat aren\u2019t intended for what should be workers-compensation claims \u2014 hence,\nduplicate claims . The losses incurred by these schemes are tangentially\nimposing a cost burden on general liability insurers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because such large\namounts of cash are involved, premium scams attract organized crime syndicates\nthat use the same shells to launder other criminal proceeds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corrupt contractors\nwith lower labor costs also can illicitly take over entire markets by\nlowballing competitors for contracts. Honest contractors may go out of\nbusiness, lay off employees, or start cheating just to survive.7<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That indignity is\nmagnified when workers-compensation insurers pass fraud losses onto business\nclients in higher premiums. The upshot is a steady erosion of law-abiding\ncontractors who pay true premiums.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sue for workers-comp\nbenefits--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Significant tax revenue\nalso is denied to municipalities, states, the federal government, Social\nSecurity, Medicare and unemployment insurers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Injured workers also\nget inadequate medical care. They must sue for workers-compensation benefits,\nand are trapped in litigation to get bills paid by workers-comp or\ngeneral-liability policies. The unpaid bills and shattered lives are passed\nalong to everyone in higher medical costs, and increased burdens on safety nets\nsuch as Social Security disability. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;State laws must keep pace with shell\nconspirators so crooked facilitators and contractors are held accountable; and&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Insurers and agents must look tighten their\napplication, underwriting and auditing to spot the signals of shell cons.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corrupt construction\ncompanies know the limitations and practices of law enforcement and the\ninsurance industrySwindlers exploit those weaknesses for large profits and\nhundreds of millions in premium-fraud losses to insurers.\u201d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insurance fraud is any\nact committed with the intent to obtain a fraudulent outcome from an insurance\nprocess. This may occur when a claimant attempts to obtain some benefit or\nadvantage to which they are not otherwise entitled, or when an insurer\nknowingly denies some benefit that is due.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the United States\nFederal Bureau of Investigation the most common schemes include: Premium\nDiversion, Fee Churning, Asset Diversion, and Workers Compensation Fraud. The\nperpetrators in these schemes can be both insurance company employees and\nclaimants. False insurance claims are insurance claims filed with the intent to\ndefraud an insurance provider.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another reason for\nfraud is over-insurance, when the amount insured is greater than the actual\nvalue of the property insured. This condition can be very difficult to avoid,\nespecially since an insurance provider might sometimes encourage it in order to\nobtain greater profits.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;This allows fraudsters to make profits by destroying\ntheir property because the payment they receive from their insurers is of\ngreater value than the property they destroy. The most common form of insurance\nfraud is inflating the value of the loss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insurance companies are\nalso susceptible to fraud because it's possible for fraudsters to file claims\nfor damages that never occurred.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-cdca/pr/los-angeles-man-convicted-tax-fraud-scheme-sought-over-800000-refunds-employees-bogus\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.justice.gov/usao-cdca/pr/los-angeles-man-convicted-tax-fraud-scheme-sought-over-800000-refunds-employees-bogus</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5% of the health care\nindustry\u2019s expenditures in the United States are due to fraudulent activities,\namounting to a cost of about 65 billion USD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 15% of the\ntotal healthcare spending in the United States to fraud\u2014about $ 140 billion\nannually.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All types of fraud\ncommitted in the United States insurance institutions (property-and-casualty,\nbusiness liability, healthcare, social security, etc. )put the true cost at\nmore than 42%&nbsp; of the total cash flow\nthrough the system. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insurance fraud can be\nclassified as either hard fraud or soft fraud<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hard fraud occurs when\nsomeone deliberately plans or invents a loss, such as a collision, auto theft,\nor fire that is covered by their insurance policy in order to receive payment\nfor damages. Criminal rings are sometimes involved in hard fraud schemes that\ncan steal millions of dollars<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soft fraud, which is\nfar more common than hard fraud, is sometimes also referred to as opportunistic\nfraud.&nbsp;&nbsp; This type of fraud consists of\npolicyholders exaggerating otherwise-legitimate claims. For example, when involved\nin an automotive collision an insured person might claim more damage than\nactually occurred.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soft fraud can also occur when, while obtaining a new health\ninsurance policy, an individual misreports previous or existing conditions in\norder to obtain a lower premium on his or her insurance policy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Life insurance fraud\nmay involve faking death to claim life insurance. Fraudsters may sometimes turn\nup a few years after disappearing, claiming a loss of memory.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An example is former\nBritish Government minister John Stonehouse who went missing in 1974 from a\nbeach in Miami. He was discovered living under an assumed name in Australia,\nextradited to Britain and jailed for seven years for fraud, theft and forgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Health insurance fraud\nis described as an intentional act of deceiving, concealing, or misrepresenting\ninformation that results in health care benefits being paid to an individual or\ngroup.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud can be committed\neither by an insured person or by a provider. Member fraud consists of claims\non behalf of ineligible members and/or dependents, alterations on enrollment\nforms, concealing pre-existing conditions, failure to report other coverage,\nprescription drug fraud, and failure to disclose claims that were a result of a\nwork-related injury.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Provider fraud consists\nof claims submitted by bogus physicians, billing for services not rendered,\nbilling for higher level of services, diagnosis or treatments that are outside\nthe scope of practice, alterations on claims submissions, and providing\nservices while medical licenses are either suspended or revoked. Independent\nmedical examinations debunk false insurance claims and allow the insurance\ncompany or claimant to seek a non-partial medical view for injury-related\ncases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Health insurance fraud\ndepletes taxpayer-funded programs like Medicare, and may victimize patients in\nthe hands of certain doctors.&nbsp; Some scams\ninvolve double-billing by doctors who charge insurers for treatments that never\noccurred, and surgeons who perform unnecessary surgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the main reasons\nthat medical fraud is such a prevalent practice is that nearly all of the\nparties involved find it favorable in some way. Many physicians see it as\nnecessary to provide quality care for their patients. Many patients, although\ndisapproving of the idea of fraud, are sometimes more willing to accept it when\nit affects their own medical care. Program administrators are often lenient on\nthe issue of insurance fraud, as they want to maximize the services of their\nproviders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common\nperpetrators of healthcare insurance fraud are health care providers.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are fraudulent\npractices such as billing insurers for treatments that are not covered by the\npatient\u2019s insurance policy. To do this, physicians often bill for a different\nservice, which is covered by the policy, rather than that which they rendered.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Public healthcare programs such as Medicare\nand Medicaid are especially conducive to fraudulent activities, as they are\noften run on a fee-for-service structure&nbsp;\n. Physicians use several fraudulent techniques to achieve this end.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These can include \u201cup-coding\u201d or \u201cupgrading,\u201d which involve billing for more\nexpensive treatments than those actually provided; providing, and subsequently\nbilling for, treatments that are not medically necessary; scheduling extra\nvisits for patients; referring patients to other physicians when no further\ntreatment is actually necessary; \"phantom billing,\" or billing for\nservices not rendered; and \u201cganging,\u201d or billing for services to family members\nor other individuals who are accompanying the patient but who did not\npersonally receive any services.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perhaps the greatest\ntotal dollar amount of fraud is committed by the health insurance companies\nthemselves.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are numerous studies and articles detailing examples of\ninsurance companies intentionally not paying claims and deleting them from\ntheir systems, denying and cancelling coverage, and the blatant underpayment to\nhospitals and physicians beneath what are normal fees for care they provide.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although difficult to obtain the information, this fraud by insurance companies\ncan be estimated by comparing revenues from premium payments and expenditures\non health claims.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In response to the\nincreased amount of health care fraud in the United States, Congress, through\nthe Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act&nbsp; (HIPAA), has specifically established health\ncare fraud as a federal criminal offense with punishment of up to ten years of\nprison in addition to significant financial penalties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud rings or groups\nmay fake traffic deaths or stage collisions to make false insurance or\nexaggerated claims and collect insurance money. The ring may involve insurance\nclaims adjusters and other people who create phony police reports to process\nclaims.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One tactic fraudsters\nuse is to drive to a busy junction or roundabout and brake sharply causing a\nmotorist to drive into the back of them. They claim the other motorist was at\nfault because they were driving too fast or too close behind them, and make a\nfalse and inflated claim to the motorist's insurer for whiplash and damage\nwhich can give the fraudsters huge money<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In staged collision\nfraud, fraudsters use a motor vehicle to stage an accident with the innocent\nparty. Typically, the fraudsters' vehicle carries four or five passengers. Its\ndriver makes an unexpected manoeuvre, forcing an innocent party to collide with\nthe fraudster's vehicle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of the fraudsters then files claims for injuries\nsustained in the vehicle. A \u201crecruited\u201d doctor diagnoses whiplash or other\nsoft-tissue injuries which are hard to dispute later.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Two-way insurance coverage is very expensive and\nalmost completely unavailable for OLD vehicles --the drivers can only obtain\nbasic liability. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A real accident may\noccur, but the dishonest owner may take the opportunity to incorporate a whole\nrange of previous minor damage to the vehicle into the garage bill associated\nwith the real accident. Personal injuries may also be exaggerated, particularly\nwhiplash spine injuries<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Insurance fraud cases of exaggerated claims\ncan also include claiming damage to the car that never occurred as a result of\nan accident that damaged a different part of the vehicle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Examples of soft\nauto-insurance fraud can include filing more than one claim for a single\ninjury, filing claims for injuries not related to an automobile accident,\nmisreporting wage losses due to injuries, or reporting higher costs for car\nrepairs than those that were actually paid.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hard auto-insurance fraud can\ninclude activities such as staging automobile collisions, filing claims when\nthe claimant was not actually involved in the accident, submitting claims for\nmedical treatments that were not received, or inventing injuries. Hard fraud\ncan also occur when claimants falsely report their vehicle as stolen. Soft\nfraud accounts for the majority of fraudulent auto-insurance claims.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another example is that\na person may illegally register their car to a location that would net them\ncheaper insurance rates than where they actually live, sometimes called\n\"rate evasion\". Another form of automobile insurance fraud, known as\n\"fronting,\" involves registering someone other than the real primary\ndriver of a car as the primary driver of the car. For example, parents might\nlist themselves as the primary driver of their children's vehicles to avoid\nyoung driver premiums.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Crash for\ncash\" scams may involve random unaware strangers, set to appear as the\nperpetrators of the orchestrated crashes.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSuch techniques are the classic rear-end shunt (the driver in front\nsuddenly slams on the brakes, possibly with brake lights disabled), the decoy\nrear-end shunt (when following one car, another one pulls in front of it,\ncausing it to brake sharply, then the first car drives off) or the helpful wave\nshunt (the driver is waved into a line of queuing traffic by the scammer who\npromptly crashes, then denies waving).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, there is an increasing\nincidence of false whiplash claims to car insurance companies from motorists\ninvolved in minor car accidents&nbsp; .\nBecause the mechanism of injury is not fully understood, A&amp;E doctors have\nto rely on a patient's external symptoms (which are easy to fake). Resultingly,\n\"no win no fee\" personal injury solicitors exploit this\n\"loophole\" for easy compensation money Property insurance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Possible motivations\nfor this can include obtaining payment that is worth more than the value of the\nproperty destroyed, or to destroy and subsequently receive payment for goods\nthat could not otherwise be sold., the majority of property insurance crimes\ninvolve arson. One reason for this is that any evidence that a fire was\nstarted by arson is often destroyed by the fire itself. Council compensation\nclaims <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fraud involving\nclaims from the councils' insurers suppose staging damages blamable on the\nlocal authorities (mostly falls and trips on council owned land) or inflating\nthe value of existing damages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Detecting insurance fraud--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The detection of\ninsurance fraud generally occurs in two steps. The first step is to identify\nsuspicious claims that have a higher possibility of being fraudulent. This can\nbe done by computerized statistical analysis or by referrals from claims adjusters\nor insurance agents.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Additionally, the public can provide tips to insurance\ncompanies, law enforcement and other organizations regarding suspected,\nobserved, or admitted insurance fraud perpetrated by other individuals.\nRegardless of the source, the next step is to refer these claims to\ninvestigators for further analysis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Due to the sheer number\nof claims submitted each day, it would be far too expensive for insurance\ncompanies to have employees check each claim for symptoms of fraud.&nbsp;&nbsp; Instead, many companies use computers and\nstatistical analysis to identify suspicious claims for further\ninvestigation.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two main types\nof statistical analysis tools used: supervised and unsupervised.&nbsp;&nbsp; In both cases, suspicious claims are\nidentified by comparing data about the claim to expected values. The main\ndifference between the two methods is how the expected values are derived. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a supervised method,\nexpected values are obtained by analyzing records of both fraudulent and\nnon-fraudulent claims<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unsupervised methods of\nstatistical detection, involve detecting claims that are abnormal.&nbsp; Both claims adjusters and computers can also\nbe trained to identify \u201cred flags,\u201d or symptoms that in the past have often\nbeen associated with fraudulent claims. Statistical detection does not prove\nthat claims are fraudulent; it merely identifies suspicious claims that need to\nbe investigated further.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Investigators say it\nworked like this: Zuniga paid a North Lauderdale man to create and insure a\nfake or \"shell\" company, Behar Services Incorporated, that\n\"rented\" out insurance certificates \u2014 required by the state for\nconstruction workers \u2014 to uninsured subcontractors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subcontractors were\nthen hired for construction jobs across South Florida. When the jobs were finished,\npayments to the uninsured subcontractors were made through checks to the fake\ncompany, which were then cashed at check cashing stores.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mortgage Fraud is\ndefined as a material misstatement, misrepresentation, or omission of\ninformation relied upon by an underwriter or lender to fund, purchase, or\ninsure a loan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.lifelock.com/education/feds-bust-massive-mortgage-fraud-scheme/\">https://www.lifelock.com/education/feds-bust-massive-mortgage-fraud-scheme/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-nj/pr/co-owner-company-originated-millions-fraudulent-mortgages-sentenced-21-months-prison\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.justice.gov/usao-nj/pr/co-owner-company-originated-millions-fraudulent-mortgages-sentenced-21-months-prison</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mortgage fraud can be\nclassified into two general categories: fraud for housing and fraud for profit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Market participants are\nperpetrating mortgage fraud by modifying old schemes, such as property flip,\nbuilder-bailout, and short sale fraud, as well as employing newer schemes, such\nas buy and bail, reverse mortgage fraud, loan modification and refinance fraud,\nand mortgage servicing fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fraudulent property\nflip is a scheme in which individuals, businesses, and/or straw borrowers, buy and\nsell properties among themselves to artificially inflate the value of the\nproperty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reverse Mortgage Fraud\ninvolves a scheme using a reverse mortgage loan to defraud a financial<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">institution by\nstripping legitimate or fictitious equity from the collateral property.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Securities fraud, also\nknown as stock fraud and investment fraud, is a deceptive practice in the stock\nor commodities markets that induces investors to make purchase or sale\ndecisions on the basis of false information, frequently resulting in losses, in\nviolation of securities laws. Offers of risky investment opportunities to\nunsophisticated investors who are unable to evaluate risk adequately and cannot\nafford loss of capital is a central problem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Securities fraud can\nalso include outright theft from investors (embezzlement by stockbrokers),\nstock manipulation, misstatements on a public company's financial reports, and\nlying to corporate auditors. The term encompasses a wide range of other\nactions, including insider trading, front running and other illegal acts on the\ntrading floor of a stock or commodity exchange.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdfl/pr/two-stock-promoters-charged-securities-fraud-connection-scheme-fraudulently-register\">https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdfl/pr/two-stock-promoters-charged-securities-fraud-connection-scheme-fraudulently-register</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.breakingbelizenews.com/2017/02/13/securities-fraudster-belizean-shell-companies-12-years/\">https://www.breakingbelizenews.com/2017/02/13/securities-fraudster-belizean-shell-companies-12-years/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.heraldtribune.com/news/20170327/sarasota-men-going-to-prison-for-securities-fraud\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.heraldtribune.com/news/20170327/sarasota-men-going-to-prison-for-securities-fraud</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dummy corporations may\nbe created by fraudsters to create the illusion of being an existing\ncorporation with a similar name. Fraudsters then sell securities in the dummy\ncorporation by misleading the investor into thinking that they are buying\nshares in the real corporation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to\nenforcement officials of the Securities and Exchange Commission, criminals\nengage in pump-and-dump schemes, in which false and/or fraudulent information\nis disseminated in chat rooms, forums, internet boards and via email\n(spamming), with the purpose of causing a dramatic price increase in thinly\ntraded stocks or stocks of shell companies (the \"pump\").<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the price reaches\na certain level, criminals immediately sell off their holdings of those stocks\n(the \"dump\"), realizing substantial profits before the stock price\nfalls back to its usual low level. Any buyers of the stock who are unaware of\nthe fraud become victims once the price falls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phishing is the attempt\nto obtain sensitive information such as usernames, passwords, and credit card\ndetails (and, indirectly, money), often for malicious reasons, by disguising as\na trustworthy entity in an electronic communication.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.technewsworld.com/story/84402.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.technewsworld.com/story/84402.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In illegal insider\ntrading, an insider or a related party trades based on material non-public\ninformation obtained during the performance of the insider's duties at the\ncorporation, or otherwise misappropriated&nbsp;\n.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abusive short selling, including certain types of naked short selling,\nare also considered securities fraud because they can drive down stock prices.\nIn abusive naked short selling, stock is sold without being borrowed and\nwithout any intent to borrow.&nbsp; The\npractice of spreading false information about stocks, to drive down their\nprices, is called \"short and distort.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The trading volume in\nthe securities and commodities markets, having grown dramatically and has led\nto an increase in fraud and misconduct by investors, executives, shareholders,\nand other market participants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White collar criminals\nare expanding the scope of their fraud and are looking for new markets, new\ninvestors, and banking secrecy havens to hide unjust enrichment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Same financial markets\nprovide the opportunity for wealth to be obtained and the opportunity for white\ncollar criminals to take advantage of unwary investors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recovery of assets from\nthe proceeds of securities fraud is a resource intensive and expensive\nundertaking because of the cleverness of fraudsters in concealment of assets\nand money laundering, as well as the tendency of many criminals to be\nprofligate spenders. A victim of securities fraud is usually fortunate to\nrecover any money from the defrauder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes the losses\ncaused by securities fraud are difficult to quantify. For example, insider\ntrading is believed to raise the cost of capital for securities issuers, thus\ndecreasing overall economic growth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potential perpetrators\nof securities fraud within a publicly traded firm include any dishonest\nofficial within the company who has access to the payroll or financial reports\nthat can be manipulated to:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">overstate assets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">overstate revenues<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">understate costs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">understate liabilities<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">understate pennystock<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enron Corporation&nbsp; exemplifies all four tendencies, and its\nfailure demonstrates the extreme dangers of a culture of corruption within a\npublicly traded corporation.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even if the effect of\nsecurities fraud is not enough to cause bankruptcy, a lesser level can wipe out\nholders of common stock because of the leverage of value of shares upon the\ndifference between assets and liabilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/dVsx4I8gkKk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/dVsx4I8gkKk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"color: red; font-size: xx-large;\">DELHI CM ARVIND KEJRIWALs GOVT MUST BE DISMISSED&nbsp;</b></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">\n<b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"></b></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><b>HE HAS BROKEN HIS OATH AS CM</b></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n</b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THIS DANGEROUS MAN KEJRIWAL HAS USED A \"FEEDBACK UNIT \"-- A CLANDESTINE UNIT .</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">IS THIS FOR BLACKMAIL ?</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">PUT THIS COMMENT IN PM MODIs , LAW MINISTERS AND RAJNATH SINGHs WEBSITES&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">TILL NOW MODI GOVT HAS BEEN UNABLE TO FIND OUT THE SHELL COMPANIES OPERATED BY </b><b style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">MANNARGUDI MAFIA</span></b><b style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html?showComment=1492466083264#c5568077108585179985\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 18, 2017 at 3:24 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_35MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/ed-notice-to-chidambarams-son-over-rs-23cr-deal/articleshow/58231480.cms<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">FINALLY BIG FISH<br /><br />THIS IS JUST THE TIP OF THE ICEBERG !</span></b></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8630538123286064505\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_37M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html?showComment=1492467530127#c8630538123286064505\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 18, 2017 at 3:48 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_37MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://zeenews.india.com/blog/cheat-fund-the-inside-story-of-sudipto-sen-and-saradha-group_6281.html<br />\n<br />\nSUDIPTO SEN'S REAL NAME WAS SANKARADITYA SEN -- A NAXALITE .<br />\n<br />\nHE GENERATED FUNDS FOR NAXALITES AND WAS A LAND GRABBER<br />\n<br />\nHE OPERATED HUNDREDS OF SHELL COMPANIES TO RUN HIS CRIMINAL PONZI EMPIRE<br />\n<br />\nNone of Saradha group entities were registered as 'chit funds'... Saradha was found to be paying returns to older investors from money collected from newer subscribers to its 'bonds and policies'.<br />\n<br />\nLike all Ponzi schemes, Saradha Group promised astronomical returns in fanciful but credible investments.<br />\n<br />\nIts funds were sold on commission by agents recruited from local rural communities. Between 35 and 40% of the deposit was returned to these agents as commissions and lucrative gifts to quickly build up a wide agent pyramid.<br />\n<br />\nhe group used a nexus of companies to launder money and evade regulators- some of whom were in cahoots.<br />\n<br />\nWhen under the radar-- Saradha Group reacted by changing its methods of raising capital. In West Bengal, Jharkhand, Assam and Chhattisgarh, it began operating variations of collective investment schemes (CIS) involving tourism packages, forward travel and hotel booking timeshare credit transfer, real estate, infrastructure finance etc<br />\n<br />\nPaperwork was created to show the funds collected as having been put together for sale / transfer of land / flats / apartments or tour packages, whereas the intention was always to refund the collected amount with interest on maturity only to some of the depositors and never to refund to the vast majority in the absence of any credible mode of generating a surplus - the characteristics of a pyramid scheme.<br />\n<br />\nWith enormous funds at its disposal, Saradha invested in high visibility sectors, such as the Bengali film industry, where it recruited actress and Trinamool Congress (TMC) Member of Parliament (MP) Satabdi Roy as its brand ambassador. Bollywood actor and TMC MP Mithun Chakraborty was brought in as the brand ambassador of Saradha Group's media platform.<br />\n<br />\nSaradha Group also enlisted Kunal Ghosh, another TMC MP, as the CEO of the media group. Under Kunal Ghosh, the group acquired and established local television channels and newspapers, investing around US$150 million in the media group.<br />\n<br />\nBy 2013, it employed over 1,500 journalists and owned eight newspapers printed in five languages: Seven Sisters Post and Bengal Post (English dailies), Sakalbela and Kalom (Bengali dailies), Prabhat Varta (Hindi daily), Ajir Dainik Baturi (Assamese daily), Azad Hind[61] (Urdu daily) and Parama (Bengali weekly magazine).<br />\n<br />\nIt also owned Bengali news channels Tara Newz and Channel 10, Bengali general entertainment channels Tara Muzic and Tara Bangla, Punjabi general entertainment channel Tara Punjabi, an international channel aimed at the Indian diaspora, TV South East Asia and one FM radio station.<br />\n<br />\nAuthor Aparna Sen was made the editor of Parama.<br />\n<br />\nIn 2011, Saradha Group bought Global Automobiles, a heavily indebted motorcycle company as a front for the latest version of its Ponzi scheme. Global Automobiles immediately stopped most production but kept 150 workers on its payroll who \"pretended to work whenever truckloads and busloads of prospective depositors of Saradha Realty visited the plant for a first-hand check before investing<br />\n<br />\nAs part of its corporate social responsibility program, Saradha Group donated motorcycles to the Kolkata Police.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUE TO 2</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_37BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; The Indian government signed a contract requiring it to pay Enron about $1.3 billion per year, or about $26 billion over the life of the 20-year contract. It was, THE of the largest civilian or military contracts ever signed, anywhere on the globe --in a jiffy<br />\n<br />\nOver the life of the contract, India would pay Enron and its partners nearly nine times what Dabhol had cost.<br />\n<br />\nFurthermore, India was required to pay for any cost increases caused by price hikes associated with the plant's fuel, electricity transmission lines or plant maintenance.<br />\n<br />\nThe final insult of the contract was a stipulation that required India to pay Enron in American dollars, even though the Indian rupee was undergoing regular depreciation.<br />\n<br />\nSOME DESH BHAKT INDIANS OBJECTED .<br />\n<br />\nOn August 26, 1993, Rebecca baby faxed a signed letter to CM of Maharashtra Sharad Pawar, complaining about an Indian named MISTER BEG and demanding that contract be signed<br />\nShe was twice named as one of the 50 most powerful businesswomen in America by Fortune magazine \u2013using PUSSY power<br />\n<br />\nShe used her femininity and no-nonsense manner first to disarm the men she dealt with, then bulldoze through any resistance that remained. She was a devastating success.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nRebecca baby using PUSSY power had negotiated a WIN -LOSE contract.<br />\n<br />\nBetween 1996 and 1998, in just two years her total compensation was more than 28 million USD -more than any other Enron employee during that time-- a huge amount of money those days<br />\n<br />\nBy 1998, she was named vice chairman of the Enron board and held voting power on more stock than anyone else on the board except for Robert Belfer, Lay and Skilling.<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE SEEN SUCH WOMEN- I KNOW HOW THEY OPERATE USING SHARON STONE TACTICS<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_93MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_93BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; I got a call from my Chief Officer from the CCR, and he said that a woman at the gangway wants to meet me\u2014and he stressed that I would surely like to meet her.<br />\n<br />\nSo I peeped out of my porthole and saw a woman standing on the quay. She was allowed up and pretty soon she was in my cabin.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nTo be frank, she looked absolutely drop dead gorgeous, young, in perfect shape , blue eyes, blonde, in skin tight blue leotards ( with her camel toe , the cynosure of every male eye ). Look into Wikipedia if you want to see what a camel toe is.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nShe turned out to be an AVON sales woman. Though I offered her a seat, she wanted to kneel by my side and display the goodies in her bag. Pretty soon I caught on , she was giving me a free show . Her pink nipples were standing out like bullets . So I rang up my Chief Engineer and told him to come to my cabin el pronto.<br />\n<br />\nMy Chief Engineer came , had a look at her and sort of melted away. Then he called me up, on the telephone and said \u201c Captain saab come to my cabin \u201c I could feel the excitement in his voice. So I gave a Coke to the Avon lady and went to the Chief Engineer\u2019s cabin.<br />\n<br />\nHe was rewinding a video cassette. Pretty soon he started the movie and I saw the same Avon woman . As per the title of the video she was \u201cthe queen of anal porn\u201d \u2013 and there she was getting serviced by 3 men.<br />\n<br />\nSo I came back to my cabin and told her, that she has permission to go to the crew\u2019s lounge. She sold her entire bag of goodies full of perfumes and cosmetics within half an hour, and she left. Get an idea of salesmanship nay sales-womanship?<br />\n<br />\nAt least this woman was doing something to earn a living. For she could have milked 100 times more money in the porn business.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/amway-merchants-of-pipe-dreams-capt.html</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6961002462212513392\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_7M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt.
