font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SPREAD ON SOCIAL MEDIA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span kind=\"d\"></span>\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-g6OzvSiQT5g/WN4vOOKKK7I/AAAAAAABR98/VhObxomT-XcHSSA5DV96z2B9RVrF9ExcwCLcB/s1600/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadakayil%2B2.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-g6OzvSiQT5g/WN4vOOKKK7I/AAAAAAABR98/VhObxomT-XcHSSA5DV96z2B9RVrF9ExcwCLcB/s400/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadakayil%2B2.JPG\" width=\"250\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "198", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/4616946813359064519/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "2837617974450230442", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-30T16:38:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-31T13:03:26+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwOTQ1NjA2NjkwCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_30.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2837617974450230442", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 32 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 31, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_33.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_33.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FATF standards on\nmoney laundering and terrorism financing category as \u201cpreventive\nmeasures\u201d.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These preventive measures\nrequire financial institutions to identify their clients, create client\nprofiles, weed out those who from the start look like they may be bad guys or\ncontrolled by bad guys, and then monitor the account activity of accepted\nclients to see if that activity varies from what is expected or reflects the kind\nof activity that known bad guys have undertaken in the past.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Financial institutions are then supposed to\nlook further into the questionable client activity and report to the government\nwhen they suspect the client may be a criminal, including a terrorist.&nbsp; Key to the process of successful activity\nmonitoring is an understanding of what known bad guys have done in the past.\nStudies of these past actions are known as typologies, which can include\nspecial \u201cred flag\u201d indicators for particular types of nefarious activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The problem with adding terrorism financing to\nthe list of activities that financial institutions were required to look for,\nand requiring them to report to the government when they suspected they saw it,\nwas that the FATF didn\u2019t actually know how bad guys financed terrorism.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was\none thing for governments to use their considerable investigative resources to\nidentify terrorists or terrorist organizations and then pass those names along\nto financial institutions so that those institutions could verify whether they\nhad any such clients, but yet another to ask financial institutions to identify\nterrorists based on their clients\u2019 transactions alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Until recently, the\nFATF\u2019s and member governments\u2019 attempts to develop terrorism financing typologies\nand red flags had been fitful, incomplete, and based largely on a small number\nof cases that were often not even relevant.&nbsp;\nThe United Nations Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force (CTITF)&nbsp; undertake a comprehensive study of terrorism\nfinancing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Counter-Terrorism\nCommittee is a subsidiary body of the United Nations Security Council. the\nUnited Nations Security Council unanimously adopted resolution 1373, which,\namong its provisions, obliges all States to criminalize assistance for\nterrorist activities, deny financial support and safe haven to terrorists and\nshare information about groups planning terrorist attacks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 15-member\nCounter-Terrorism Committee was established to monitor implementation of the\nresolution. While the ultimate aim of the Committee is to increase the ability\nof States to fight terrorism, it is not a sanctions body nor does it maintain a\nlist of terrorist groups or individuals..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the Counter-Terrorism Committee\nis not a direct capacity provider it does act as a broker between those states\nor groups that have the relevant capacities and those in the need of assistance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2012, HSBC, one of\nthe world\u2019s largest banks, settled with the U.S. Government, avoiding criminal\nprosecution of its executives, for helping to launder money for Mexican drug\ncartels as well as Al Qaeda. HSBC provided a \u201cgateway for terrorists to gain\naccess to U.S. dollars and the U.S. financial system.\u201d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HSBC agreed to forfeit\n1.256 billion dollars, the largest forfeiture amount ever by a financial institution\nfor a compliance failure. They don\u2019t care as long as there is NO jail term. The\nlost money can be made up in days .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.sott.net/article/344358-People-punish-megabank-HSBC-Profits-plummet-82\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.sott.net/article/344358-People-punish-megabank-HSBC-Profits-plummet-82</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because they were let\noff with zero criminal charges, the bank was allowed to go back to crooked\nbusiness as usual.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Organized Crime and\nCorruption Reporting Project published a comprehensive narrative that details\nhow billions of dollars were moved from Russian sources to bogus shell\ncompanies before traveling further into various banks, and ultimately numerous\ncompanies that inadvertently accepted corrupt funds.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money entered the\nLaundromat via a set of shell companies in Russia that exist only on paper and\nwhose ownership cannot be traced. Some of the funds may have been diverted from\nthe Russian treasury through fraud, rigging of state contracts, or customs and\ntax evasion.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Money that might have helped repair the country\u2019s deteriorating\nroads and ports, modernize the health care system, or ease the poverty of\nsenior citizens \u2013 was instead deposited in a Moldovan bank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HSBC, which is\nheadquartered in London, processed US$545.3m in Laundromat cash, mostly routed\nthrough its Hong Kong branch<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A great number of banks\naccepted these funds easily, and the scheme touched upon at least 96 countries\nreceiving the tainted money including the United States, with money ending up\nat Citibank and Bank of America. The OCCRP reported that \u201cthe 21 shell\ncompanies fired out 26,746 payments from their various Trasta Komercbanka and\nMoldindconbank accounts\u201d between 2011 and 2014.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Earlier estimates\nof&nbsp; laundered money were wrong,&nbsp; recent projections have increased that number\nto as much as $80 billion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The suspected\n\u201carchitect\u201d behind this massive undertaking is Moldovan businessman Vyacheslav\nPlaton. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">US &nbsp;Congress could close\nthis loophole by passing a simple, two-page law requiring the beneficial owner\nof a company to be identified whenever a U.S. company is formed. Treasury\nsubmitted a legislative proposal to Congress that provides a framework for\nclosing this loophole once and for all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Delaware is well-known\nfor its incorporation businesses, but it\u2019s no worse than any other state in\nthis regard. With about $100 and 20 minutes, you can go to a U.S. state\u2019s\nwebsite and form a company without disclosing the name of the person who will\nown or control it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Professional incorporation agents set up hundreds or even\nthousands of these companies and then sell them, in some cases to those looking\nto move money surreptitiously.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Criminals have learned that American companies\nhave an easier time obtaining bank accounts, and so they incorporate here in\nlarge numbers. Financial investigators often come across U.S. shell companies\nin their money hunts \u2014 and that may be where the trail ends.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">WE ASK DONALD TRUMP TO\nSTOP THIS NONSENSE !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">U.S. shell companies\nhave the dubious distinction of being the only money laundering method where\nsecrecy is provided by a government entity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stopping terrorist\nfinancing and money laundering are bipartisan issues, and Congress\u2019s support\nfor the work of my office is broad and deep on outside \u2013but shallow and fickle\ninside .&nbsp; Whenever&nbsp; legislators have tried over the years to pass\nlaws similar to the one recently proposed by Treasury, interested stakeholders\nhave defeated the bills every time.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is simply unacceptable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To mitigate the threat,\nthe Treasury Department issued a rule that will require U.S. banks opening\naccounts for a company to obtain and verify the identity of the company\u2019s\nbeneficial owner. That will help with companies that choose to bank here, but\nit won\u2019t stop criminals who use U.S. front and shell companies to open bank\naccounts abroad.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And the burden for disclosing the true owners of companies\nshould fall primarily on those incorporating the companies in the first place.\nTo set this right will take an act of Congress\u2014but as long as US congressmen\nare in Jew Rothschild\u2019s&nbsp; payroll this\nwont happen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After all Rothschild\u2019s world financial empire is held together by\nshell companies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c576088335889284670\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; font-size: large;\">QUOTE: The government had yesterday faced a major embarrassment in the Rajya Sabha as five amendments moved by the Congress and the CPI(M) to the Finance Bill were adopted and approved by the House.UNQUOTE</span></div>\n<br />\nTHIS IS LIKE FLEA RIDDEN CATS DOING MEEOW MEEOW AT PORT ROYALE --WHEN THE PIRATES ARE COUNTING THE TREASURE<br />\n<br />\nWHO CARES?<br />\n<br />\n5 AMENDMENTS WILL BE FLUSHED DOWN THE TOILET<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">RAJYA SABHA HAS NO POWERS OVER FINANCE&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">QUOTE: After Finance Minister Arun Jaitley moved the amended Finance Bill for consideration by the Lok Sabha, Deepender Hooda (Cong) said this was a \"historic\" occasion as never in the past had the Rajya Sabha amended the Finance Bill. &nbsp;: UNQUOTE</span><br />\nAIYOOOOOOO<br />\n<br />\nPAAVAM<br />\n<br />\nDONT KNOW ASSHOLE FROM ELBOW<br />\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_94MN\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_94BR\" style=\"font-size: 16px; text-decoration: none;\">March 30, 2017 at 4:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_95MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nYes Sir, flushed down the toilet.<br />\n<br />\nAll amendments recommended by the Rajya Sabha were rejected by the Lower House<br />\nhttps://www.thequint.com/india/2017/03/30/finance-bill-2017-lok-sabha-rajya-amendments-arun-jaitley</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_95MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-183019290\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_95BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_95B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_96B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c95879746525995379\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_96M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_33.html?showComment=1490872374532#c95879746525995379\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 30, 2017 at 4:42 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_96MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nWE ASK THE MODI GOVT<br />\n<br />\nENSURE SOME EMINENT ECONOMISTS ARE MEMBERS OF THE RAJYA SABHA ( NOT ROTHSCHILDs ECONOMISTS )<br />\n<br />\nNOT JOKERS LIKE SACHIN TENDULKAR AND REKHA</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_97b+seedGeuLD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_97b+seedGeuLD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n.<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chun Doo-hwan was the the\nfifth President of South Korea from 1980 to 1988. President Chun was convicted\nin Korea in 1997 of receiving more than $200 million in bribes from Korean\nbusinesses and companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">President\nChun and his relatives laundered some of these corruption proceeds through a\nweb of nominees and shell companies in both Korea and the United States.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/chi-south-korean-dictator-settlement-20150304-story.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/chi-south-korean-dictator-settlement-20150304-story.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The former president\nand chief executive officer of BizJet International Sales and Support Inc., a\nU.S.-based subsidiary of Lufthansa Technik AG with headquarters in Tulsa,\nOklahoma, that provides aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul services, &nbsp;was caught in a scheme to pay bribes to\nforeign government officials.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bernd Kowalewski, 57,\nthe former President and CEO of BizJet, pleaded guilty &nbsp;in US federal court in, to conspiracy to\nviolate the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and a substantive violation of\nthe FCPA in connection with a scheme to pay bribes to officials in Mexico and\nPanama in exchange for those officials\u2019 assistance in securing contracts for\nBizJet to perform aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul services. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kowalewski and his co-conspirators paid bribes\ndirectly to foreign officials to secure aircraft maintenance repair and\noverhaul contracts, and in some instances, the defendants funneled bribes to\nforeign officials through a shell companies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">WELL, HUNDREDS OF SUCH\nCRIMES ARE HAPPENING IN INDIA.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">WE NOT\nKNOW HOW TO CATCH THESE CRIMINALS.</span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">UNCLE OTTAVIO QUATTROCCHIs\nWIFE MARIA BABY ONCE KICKED &nbsp;AN UNIFORMED\nJAWAN WITH HER POINTY ITALIAN PUCCI ( OR WAS IT GUCCI ) &nbsp;SHOES , &nbsp;JUST BECAUSE HE DARED TO RUN A METAL\nDETECTOR ON HER.<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Om8WEzs0HV4/WNz89gYhNpI/AAAAAAABR9E/HnfseMWi6PsbWDjagqs8iEoX92oxu3ucACLcB/s1600/quat88trocchi-wife.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Om8WEzs0HV4/WNz89gYhNpI/AAAAAAABR9E/HnfseMWi6PsbWDjagqs8iEoX92oxu3ucACLcB/s640/quat88trocchi-wife.jpg\" width=\"464\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>AIYOOOOO</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>I WILL BECOME McWOLF AT THIS RATE&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MsACHAdv0Wc/WN0CseBpYnI/AAAAAAABR9U/ovJnvBxZTocUP06xU6-UAjXQfzfKkAL9ACLcB/s1600/generalisFFed-benfords-distribution.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"178\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MsACHAdv0Wc/WN0CseBpYnI/AAAAAAABR9U/ovJnvBxZTocUP06xU6-UAjXQfzfKkAL9ACLcB/s640/generalisFFed-benfords-distribution.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Most naturally occurring data sets follow a\nstrange rule called Benford's Law.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This rule allows you to predict how often\neach number 1 through 9 will appear as the first non-zero digit in the data\nset.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Benford's Law can be used to analyze\nfinancial data and identify red flags. &nbsp; If the data doesn't look anything like\nthe distribution predicted by Benford's Law it may mean the numbers have been\nmanipulated.</span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/vIsDjbhbADY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/vIsDjbhbADY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Benford's law, also\ncalled the first-digit law, is an observation about the frequency distribution\nof leading digits in many real-life sets of numerical data. &nbsp;The law states that in many naturally\noccurring collections of numbers, the leading significant digit is likely to be\nsmall<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, in sets\nwhich obey the law, the number 1 appears as the most significant digit about\n30% of the time, while 9 appears as the most significant digit less than 5% of\nthe time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By contrast, if the\ndigits were distributed uniformly, they would each occur about 11.1% of the\ntime. Benford's law also makes (different) predictions about the distribution\nof second digits, third digits, digit combinations, and so on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has been shown that\nthis result applies to a wide variety of data sets, including electricity\nbills, street addresses, stock prices, house prices, population numbers, death\nrates, lengths of rivers, physical and mathematical constants, and processes\ndescribed by power laws (which are very common in nature). It tends to be most\naccurate when values are distributed across multiple orders of magnitude.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The law could be used\nto detect possible fraud in lists of socio-economic data submitted in support\nof public planning decisions. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZTMQQE8zOlg/WN0EgD56AxI/AAAAAAABR9o/XLaJ0GPxJYglsGfsgO_WPhQLx-7wFEFLwCLcB/s1600/na-cd776_nuNNmber_16u_20141205130308.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"578\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZTMQQE8zOlg/WN0EgD56AxI/AAAAAAABR9o/XLaJ0GPxJYglsGfsgO_WPhQLx-7wFEFLwCLcB/s640/na-cd776_nuNNmber_16u_20141205130308.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Based on the plausible\nassumption that people who make up figures tend to distribute their digits fairly\nuniformly, a simple comparison of first-digit frequency distribution from the\ndata with the expected distribution according to Benford's Law ought to show up\nany anomalous results.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Following this idea,\nMark Nigrini showed that Benford's Law could be used in forensic accounting and\nauditing as an indicator of accounting and expenses fraud. In practice,\napplications of Benford's Law for fraud detection routinely use more than the\nfirst digit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N3I6zaCg6Ns/WN0D5FphvLI/AAAAAAABR9g/K94JxHWhkgsh2Efl1EIp2E5nULOkonNUwCLcB/s1600/benfordhjs-law-5-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N3I6zaCg6Ns/WN0D5FphvLI/AAAAAAABR9g/K94JxHWhkgsh2Efl1EIp2E5nULOkonNUwCLcB/s640/benfordhjs-law-5-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Benford\u2019s Law gives the\nexpected patterns of the digits in tabulated data and it has been used by\nauditors and scientists to detect anomalies in tabulated data<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Az3kXCPZpYs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Az3kXCPZpYs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If somebody tries to\nfalsify, say, their tax return then invariably they will have to invent some\ndata. When trying to do this, the tendency is for people to use too many\nnumbers starting with digits in the mid range, 5,6,7 and not enough numbers\nstarting with 1.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This violation of Benford's Law sets the alarm bells ringing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">TIME FOR A KHAINI BREAK !</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/a8xbtrLvFHc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/a8xbtrLvFHc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>ALL THIS IS COPIED FROM ANCIENT KERALA MATH<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>THE VEDIC GOLDEN MEAN 1.618 ( SRI YANTRA ) ,&nbsp; THE FIBONACCI SERIES&nbsp; ( VEDIC SERIES ) AND BENFORDs LAW ,&nbsp; &nbsp;ARE\nALL INTERRELATED.</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Fibonacci numbers are<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, ... (add the last\ntwo to get the next)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The golden section numbers are<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">0\u00b761803 39887... = phi = \u03c6 and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1\u00b761803 39887... = Phi = \u03a6<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In numbers that appear in tables of physical\nand chemical constants.&nbsp; and similar\ntabulations, the digit 1 appears as first digit almost three times more often,\nas one would expect<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fibonacci and Lucas numbers tend to obey\nBenford's law<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Benford offered a general \"law of anomalous\nnumbers. The probability that a random decimal begins with digit p is<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">log (p + 1) - log p <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">The first digits of Fibonacci and Lucas\nnumbers tend to obey very closely the formula of probability offered by\nBenford.</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Lucas numbers or Lucas series are an\ninteger sequence named after the mathematician Fran\u00e7ois \u00c9douard Anatole Lucas (\nstolen from Kerala Math ) who studied both that sequence and the closely\nrelated Fibonacci numbers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Lucas numbers and Fibonacci numbers form\ncomplementary instances of Lucas sequences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Similar to the Fibonacci numbers, each Lucas\nnumber is defined to be the sum of its two immediate previous terms, thereby\nforming a Fibonacci integer sequence.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The first two Lucas numbers are L0 = 2\nand L1 = 1 as opposed to the first two Fibonacci numbers F0 = 0 and F1 = 1.\nThough closely related in definition, Lucas and Fibonacci numbers exhibit\ndistinct properties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All Fibonacci-like integer sequences appear\nin shifted form as a row of the Wythoff array; the Fibonacci sequence itself is\nthe first row and the Lucas sequence is the second row.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Wythoff array ( stolen from Kerala Math )\nis an infinite matrix of integers derived from the Fibonacci sequence .. it can\nalso be defined using Fibonacci numbers &nbsp;or directly from the golden ratio and the\nrecurrence relation defining the Fibonacci numbers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Like all Fibonacci-like integer sequences,\nthe ratio between two consecutive Lucas numbers converges to the golden ratio.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>THE RATIO OF SUCCESSIVE TERMS IN A FIBONACCI\nSEQUENCE&nbsp; TEND TOWARDS THE GOLDEN MEAN.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>THE DIGITS OF ALL NUMBER MAKING UP THE FIBONACCI SERIES TEND TO CONFORM TO\nBENFORDs LAW<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>THE FIRST DIGITS OF THE FIRST 100 FIBONACCI\nAND THE FIRST 100 &nbsp;LUCAS NUMBERS APPROXIMATED\nTHE EXPECTED FREQUENCES OF BENFORDs LAW &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">( IT FITS BETTER IF WE INCREASE THE NUMBER\nFROM 100 TO 1000 AND THEN FURTHER TO 2000 ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">My revelations now jump to </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>35.0% </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/perfect-six-pack-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/perfect-six-pack-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ALL THOSE WHO THINK HINDUS ARE HEATHEN PAGAN\nSAVAGES , PLEASE RAISE YOU FUCKIN\u2019 HAND . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ALL RIGHT SHOVE IT RIGHT BACK INTO YOUR\nASSHOLES <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">Below: The Sri Yantra which contains TOE, is drawn with the Vedic Golden Mean as the base ( 1.618 )-- &nbsp; it was drawn in ancient days , when the white man was was doing GRUNT GRUNT for language and living in caves, clubbing down animals and eating them raw..</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/9nHcGHmUrK4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9nHcGHmUrK4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE WORLD MUST KNOW THIS TRUTH<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">EVERY VESTIGE OF MATH KNOWLEDGE CAME FROM\nINDIA, TILL THE WHITE INVADER LANDED IN INDIA</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/fractal-mind-of-srinivasa-ramanujan.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/fractal-mind-of-srinivasa-ramanujan.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fraud audit is a\nproven way to identify fraud. Locating and recognizing shell companies in your\naccounts payable file is a critical task for today\u2019s fraud auditor. The process\nstarts with effective data mining designed to locate favored vendors, false\nbilling, and pass-through fraud schemes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fraud audit procedures will focus\non proven techniques to determine if the vendor is a shell corporation using\nthe physical existence, legal existence, and the business capacity audit\nprogram<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wherever there is huge\nfinancial fraud-- shell companies are associated &nbsp;&nbsp;. While shell companies are frequently linked\nto multiple forms of scams, law officials are unable to prosecute all cases\nbecause state agencies do not collect enough ownership information on company\nformation documents.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, they leave no paper trail for the government to\ntrace back to a particular individual or individuals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All inherent schemes\nhave two aspects: the entity structure and the fraudulent action. The first\nstep is building the fraud scenarios within the audit scope. The second is\nbuilding the audit response to the identified fraud scenarios.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Entity Structure---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud scenarios\ninvolving vendors, customers, and employees tend to use a false entity\nstructure to commit the fraudulent activity. Within each category, there will\nbe permutations that will affect the fraud auditing testing procedures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nmost common false entities are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The entity was\ncreated by the perpetrator, vendors, or customers. Vendors and customers are\neither legally created or exist in name only. When the entity exists in name\nonly, the entity verification procedures will detect the false entity. For\nlegally created entities, the fraud auditing testing procedure should link the\nincorporation date to first business date. As a guide, when the entity\nincorporation date is within 90 days of first business transaction date, that\nis a red flag of a false entity or a favored entity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The perpetrator\nassumes the identity of a real entity such as a vendor, customer, or\nemployee.&nbsp; Therefore, the address or\ntelephone number within the company master file for the entity should not match\nthe address or telephone number of the entity verification procedures. A caveat\nexists in the passthrough fraud scheme where one of the perpetrators is\nemployed at the real source of the goods or services, so it is possible to\nobtain a match of records. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the entity is\ndetermined to be a real entity, there are generally three possible\noutcomes:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Favorite entity\nstatus indicates the entity is real, but there might be a real or perceived\nconflict. If there is a conflict, the fraud scenario would be dependent on the\nnature of the account, or else there is no fraud scenario occurring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The fraud scenario\nlinks to a real entity, whereby a decision tree would aid in the determination\nof the type of scenarios occurring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 No fraud scenario is\noccurring. When the entity is established as a real entity, a decision tree can\ndirect the auditor to the inherent scheme structure for the applicable core\nbusiness system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the red flag to be\nan effective audit tool, the event must be observable and must be incorporated\ninto the fraud audit program. Red flags by their nature cause an increased\nsensitivity to the likelihood of a fraud scenario occurring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not all red flags have\nthe same weight with regard to fraud susceptibility. The weight of a fraud red\nflag correlates to the predictability of a fraud occurrence. Therefore, the\nauditor needs to interpret the importance of the red flag to the fraud scenario\nand be able to arrive at a conclusion regarding the occurrence of the fraud\nscenario.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are four\ncategories of red flags: data, documents, internal controls, and behavior. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The categories are\nintended to aid the auditor in identifying the red flags in an orderly fashion,\nwhereb, the auditor should not view the process as a right or wrong exercise,\nbut instead know that certain items can occur in multiple categories.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\nexample, a vendor invoice number can be a data category red flag observed\nthrough the use of data mining or a document&nbsp;\ncategory red flag observed through the application of audit testing\nprocedures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to the four\ncategories of red flags already mentioned, there are also two other types of\nred flags:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trigger red flags and\nawareness red flags. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the trigger red\nflag, the event is sufficient enough to require the auditor to perform fraud\naudit procedures to determine if creditable evidence exists to suggest that the\nfraud scenario is occurring.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a guideline, there should be no more than five\ntrigger red flags per category, and preferably only three trigger red flags per\ncategory. To the contrary, with awareness red flags, the event is not\nsufficient to require the auditor to perform fraud audit procedures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However,\nthe totality of all the awareness red flags will require an auditor\u2019s judgment\non the need to perform fraud audit procedures. While both might lead to the\nperformance of fraud audit procedures, the underlying reasons differ.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;As a\nguideline for internal control audits, a red flag that links to a fraud\nscenario via a key control is denoted as a trigger red flag, whereas, a red\nflag that links to a fraud scenario via non-key controls is denoted as an\nawareness red flag.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A trigger red flag is similar to the traditional audit use\nof red flags, whereby when an internal control is not working, it \u201ctriggers\u201d a\nred flag.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The use of trigger and awareness red flags will change in fraud\naudits or specific point analysis, whereas the link is directly associated with\nconcealment strategy and the elements of the fraud scenario.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boards of directors,\nstockholders, management teams, and professional standards all expect internal\nauditors to respond to the risk of fraud in core business systems. Within a\ncompany's accounts payable file, shell companies are being used to steal\nmillions of dollars from companies or to conceal bribery payments which violate\nanti-bribery and corruption laws. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red flags are used by\nmanagement to build fraud detection controls and by the auditor as the basis\nfor questioning the legitimacy of the business transaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the red flag to be\nan effective audit tool, the event must be observable and must be incorporated\ninto the fraud audit program. Red flags by their nature cause an increased\nsensitivity to the likelihood of a fraud scenario occurring. Not all red flags\nhave the same weight with regard to fraud susceptibility.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The weight of a fraud\nred flag correlates to the predictability of a fraud occurrence. Therefore, the\nauditor needs to interpret the importance of the red flag to the fraud scenario\nand be able to arrive at a conclusion regarding the occurrence of the fraud\nscenario.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are four\ncategories of red flags: data, documents, internal controls, and behavior. The\ncategories are intended to aid the auditor in identifying the red flags in an\norderly fashion, whereby, the auditor should not view the process as a right or\nwrong exercise, but instead know that certain items can occur in multiple\ncategories.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, a vendor invoice number can be a data red flag observed\nthrough the use of fraud data analytics or a document red flag observed through\nthe examination of the vendor invoice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red flags are similar\nto the concept of circumstantial evidence in a legal proceeding. The red flag\nis an inference test. It is not the observance of a red flag but the totality\nof the weight of all red flags observed through the data collection process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The process of\ndetecting shell corporations is a two-step process. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first step is to\nconduct fraud data analytics interrogation routines, which are designed to\nlocate vendors that are consistent with the data profile of a shell corporation\nor transactions that are indicative of a shell corporation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second step is\nto perform audit procedures which are designed to pierce the concealment\nstrategy or reveal the truth. The data mining strategy is a two-fold process.\nThe first step is to build the data profile for the fraud scenario. The second\nstep is to understand how the sophistication of the concealment strategy\nimpacts the fraud data analytics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Government\nregistration: All entities have a legal registration. Employees have birth\nrecords and corporations have registration requirements with an applicable\ngovernment office. The first step is to establish whether the entity is legally\ncreated, then gather identifying information that can eventually be linked to\nother pertinent information. Names of registrars; officers' addresses; and\ndates related to entity creation, dissolutions, or changes tend to be the\ncritical information. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Real companies tend to\nhave insurance. The fraud testing procedure would consist of a request of the\ncertificate of insurance. Fortunately, such a request is a normal control\nprocedure in many companies, but for fraud audit purposes, the need is to examine\nthe certificate to take note the date of coverage and types of coverage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although the\nmethodology for conducting a fraud audit is different from traditional\nauditing, the internal auditor employs many of the same skills and tools as is\nused in a traditional audit. Fraud audits are a blend of new methodologies and\ntraditional audit tools<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud investigation\nconsists of a multitude of steps necessary to resolve allegations of fraud:\ninterviewing witnesses, assembling evidence, writing reports, and dealing with\nprosecutors and the courts.
