text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_30.html?showComment=1490945443290#c3786138557999374624\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 31, 2017 at 1:00 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_64MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nWE KNOW WHY JEW ROTHSCHILDs RATING AGENCY S&amp;P HAVE EROS INTERNATIONAL ( FILM DISTRIBUTORS LULLA FAMILY ) WITH A B+ RATING<br /><br />High-yield DOLLAR bonds, have been opened for subscription for raising hundreds of millions -- five-year maturity, with fixed rate,<br /><br />This is the first overseas debt-fund raising by any film entertainment company from India--Eros is based in Secaucus, New Jersey, USA<br /><br />Knight Assets &amp; Co., a London-based investment firm and Glaucus Research Group California LLC ( Soren Aandahl ) said that Eros may be fabricating revenue, ( a claim that Eros has denied ), and that Eros equity is worth \u201czero.\u201d<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Wells Fargo\u2019s Eric Katz has questioned why Eros reports that an increasing proportion of its sales come from the UAE, rather than India. Eros says Indian buyers of content obtain rights through UAE subsidiaries to avoid tax ..</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />Indian companies have chosen to buy its content through offshore tax-haven shell companies. Eros itself has a UAE-based subsidiary, which owns all the international rights to its library. Eros wouldn\u2019t disclose the counterparties driving the UAE sales, citing contract confidentiality.<br /><br />In 2006, Eros International Plc, the holding company of the Eros Group, became the first Indian media company to list on the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) of the London Stock Exchange.<br /><br />In 2010, Eros listed its Indian subsidiary Eros International Media Limited on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE) in India. Eros International runs a Netflix-style subscription service.<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">https://seekingalpha.com/article/4000488-globus-eross-elephant-room</span><br /></div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">TO BE CONTINUED-</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2ozzWWUwqxA/WNzmnnbvpBI/AAAAAAABR80/JkmGeYpPpiAb9lXChhQBFg__FZsNDHbSQCLcB/s1600/downlouuooad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2ozzWWUwqxA/WNzmnnbvpBI/AAAAAAABR80/JkmGeYpPpiAb9lXChhQBFg__FZsNDHbSQCLcB/s400/downlouuooad.jpg\" width=\"240\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "149", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2837617974450230442/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8369750173559330246", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-29T19:15:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-30T16:39:30+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwODcyMTcwMjQzCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_33.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8369750173559330246", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 31 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 30 , BELOW---</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_29.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_29.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In February 2016,\ninstructions to steal US$951 million from Bangladesh Bank, the central bank of\nBangladesh, were issued via the SWIFT network. Five transactions issued by\nhackers, worth $101 million and withdrawn from a Bangladesh Bank account at the\nFederal Reserve Bank of New York, succeeded, with $20 million traced to Sri\nLanka (since recovered) and $81 million to the Philippines (about $18 million\nrecovered).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Federal Reserve Bank of NY blocked the remaining thirty transactions,\namounting to $850 million, at the request of Bangladesh Bank. &nbsp;It was identified later that Dridex malware\nwas used for the attack. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dridex also known as\nBugat and Cridex is a form of malware that specializes in stealing bank\ncredentials via a system that utilizes macros from Microsoft Word.The targets\nof this malware are Windows users who open an email attachment in Word or\nExcel, causing macros to activate and download Dridex, infecting the computer\nand opening the victim to banking theft.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The primary objective of this software\nis to steal banking information from users of infected machines to immediately\nlaunch fraudulent transactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hackers managed to\ngain access to the network because the Bank was using second-hand $10 network\nswitches without a Firewall to run its network.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The network computers that were\nlinked through the second-hand routers were connected to the SWIFT global\npayment network, allowing hackers to gain access to the credentials required to\nmake high-value transfers straight into their own accounts. Firewall are meant\nto help keep out malicious hackers and malware from doing nasty things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A firewall is a network\nsecurity device that monitors traffic to or from your network. It allows or\nblocks traffic based on a defined set of security rules.. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A firewall monitors and controls the incoming\nand outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules. A firewall\ntypically establishes a barrier between a trusted, secure internal network and\nanother outside network, such as the Internet, that is assumed not to be secure\nor trusted.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Firewalls are often\ncategorized as either network firewalls or host-based firewalls. Network\nfirewalls filter traffic between two or more networks; they are either software\nappliances running on general purpose hardware, or hardware-based firewall\ncomputer appliances.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Host-based firewalls provide a layer of software on one\nhost that controls network traffic in and out of that single machine. &nbsp;Firewall appliances may also offer other\nfunctionality to the internal network they protect, such as acting as a DHCP or\nVPNserver for that network.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this cyber heist,\nthieves tried to illegally transfer US$951 million to several fictitious bank\naccounts around the world.. The perpetrators managed to compromise Bangladesh\nBank's computer network, observe how transfers are done, and gain access to the\nbank's credentials for payment transfers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They used these credentials to\nauthorise about three dozen requests to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York to\ntransfer funds from the account Bangladesh Bank held there to accounts in Sri\nLanka and the Philippines.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thirty transactions worth $851 million were flagged\nby the banking system for staff review, but five requests were granted; $20\nmillion to Sri Lanka (later recovered)-- and $81 million lost to the\nPhilippines, entering the Southeast Asian country's banking system on February\n5, 2016. This money was laundered through casinos and some later transferred to\nHong Kong.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The $20 million transfer\nto Sri Lanka was intended by hackers to be sent to the Shalika Foundation, a\nSri Lanka-based private limited company.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The hackers misspelled\n\"Foundation\" in their request to transfer the funds, spelling the\nword as \"<span style=\"color: blue;\">Fundation</span>\". ( a typical BONG typo--they say <span style=\"color: red;\">UNNDD</span> instead of <span style=\"color: red;\">WOUND</span> &nbsp;)&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This spelling error gained suspicion from\nDeutsche Bank, a routing bank which put a halt to the transaction in question\nafter seeking clarifications from Bangladesh Bank<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The incident shows the\nrisks that banks connected to the SWIFT system are exposed to as a result of\nthe security vulnerabilities of other member banks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By breaching the Bangladesh\nCentral Bank's security firewalls, hackers were able to hack the system and\ntransfer the funds through the established global banking networks almost\nundetected.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The failure of the Bangladeshi government to build adequate\nsafeguards for its financial system became the starting point for a global,\nmulti-million money laundering scheme whose effect was felt beyond the\ncountry's borders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The case &nbsp;highlights\nthe threat of cyber attacks to both government and private institutions by\ncyber criminals using real bank codes to make orders look genuine. SWIFT has\nadvised banks using the SWIFT Alliance Access system to strengthen their cyber\nsecurity posture and ensure they are following SWIFT security guidelines<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">I PREDICT JEW\nROTHSCHILDs KOSHER AGENCIES WILL TRY TO FORCE A REGIME CHANGE IN NORTH KOREA BY\nPUTTING THE BLAME ON KIM JONG UN</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BASTARDS !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px;
