line-height: 150%;\">Australia's cash\ncontrols require travelers to report to AUSTRAC when they carry $10,000 or more\n(or equivalent in a foreign currency) of cash (or equivalent) into or out of\nAustralia, which can be done on forms available from the Border Force at\nairports and sea ports.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Border Force attempts to detect evasion of this\nrequirement. Airlines are not liable for what their passengers carry.\nCross-border movement of bearer negotiable instruments of any amount must also\nbe reported if requested by a Border Force or police officer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It's an offence under\nthe Act for anyone to split a transaction into two or more parts with a\ndominant purpose of avoiding the reporting rules and thresholds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certain classes of\ntransactions are exempt, or may be exempted on application. For example,\nestablished customers transacting amounts typical of their lawful business,\nsuch as for payroll, or retail or vending machine takings, etc.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Motor vehicle\ntraders are specifically not eligible for exemption, as are boats, farm\nmachinery and aircraft traders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under the Freedom of\nInformation Act 1982, any person can access records held by AUSTRAC, subject to\ncertain exemptions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Entities which are\nrequired to report transactions to AUSTRAC are called \"reporting\nentities\", which are specified in the AML/CTF Act.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These entities deal in\ncash, bullion and financial transactions, and include:-----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">banks and similar\nfinancial institutions, such as building societies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">corporations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">insurance companies and\nintermediaries<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">securities dealers,\nsuch as stock brokers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">unit trust managers and\ntrustees (but cash management trusts transacting only by cheque or similar are\nexempt)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">travelers cheque or\nmoney order issuers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">cash carriers and\npayroll preparation businesses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">casinos<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bookmakers, including\ntotalisator agencies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bullion dealers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">solicitors, acting on\ntheir own behalf (e.g., their trust fund, or originated mortgages)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reporting entities must\nidentify their customers using the 100 point check system. Accounts may only be\nopened, but can only be operated (i.e., withdrawals made) by an identified\ncustomer; an unidentified customer is blocked from making withdrawals.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally identification can be transferred from one account to another, so\nthat for instance a person once identified does not need to produce documents\nagain when opening a second account at the same institution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For banks and similar\nreporting entities, identification requirements are determined by a risk-based\napproach, which may differ for each reporting entity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It's an offence to open\nor operate an account with a reporting entity under a false name, punishable by\na fine or up to 2 years imprisonment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 100 point check is\na personal identification system adopted by the Australian Government to combat\nfinancial transaction fraud by individuals and companies, enacted by the\nFinancial Transactions Reports Act (1988) (FTR Act), which gave rise to the\nAustralian Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre (AUSTRAC).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 100 point system applies\nto individuals opening new financial accounts in Australia, including bank\naccounts or betting accounts. Points are allocated to the types of documentary\nproof of identity that the person can produce, and they must have at least 100\npoints of identification to be able to operate an account. The system now also\napplies to the establishment of a number of official identity documents, such\nas an Australian passport and driving licence..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Reporting entities\"\nare required to identify their customers using the 100 point check system.\nAccounts may be opened, but can only be operated (i.e. withdrawals made) by an\nidentified customer; and an unidentified customer is blocked from making\nwithdrawals. Generally, identification can be transferred from one account to\nanother, so that for instance a person once identified does not need to produce\ndocuments again when opening a second account at the same institution.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An issue for many\nAustralian organisations is the capture of credit card primary account numbers\n(PANs), referred to below under the 25 Points section as Credit Card or EFTPOS\nCard. This practice is not compliant with the Payment Card Industry Data\nSecurity Standard and must be removed from all 100 point check forms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; When you are a bishop and cannot interpret the Bible, you\nshould resign and give it to those who can. We will not compromise our\ntradition and tolerate homosexuality.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zimbabwe's President\nRobert Mugabe has rejected calls from the UN to implement gay rights in his\ncountry. Speaking at the United Nations General Assembly meeting, he said that\nupholding human rights is the obligation of all member states, but vehemently\nrejected the imposition of what he called \"new rights\" for gay\nmarriage that have been advocated elsewhere in the world.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"We equally reject\nattempts to prescribe new rights that are contrary to our norms, values,\ntraditions and beliefs. We are not gays. Cooperation and respect for each other\nwill advance the cause of human rights worldwide. Confrontation, vilification\nand double standards will not,\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Peter Roebuck needed a\ngood BUTT humping .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><a href=\"http://www.smh.com.au/good-weekend/peter-roebuck-biography-hes-gone-out-the-window-20150924-gju1hs.html\">http://www.smh.com.au/good-weekend/peter-roebuck-biography-hes-gone-out-the-window-20150924-gju1hs.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"He took his pants\noff and pinned me down from behind. He held me down with his left hand and\nholding his penis with his right hand, he put his whole body weight on top of\nme. He forcibly tried to kiss me, instead he was biting me on my right cheek. I\ntried to push him over to stop. I was in shock. While pushing off he grabbed my\ngenital parts, that's when I realised he ejaculated all over my stomach.\u201d</span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was a hardcore\nhomosexual ( anal receiving ) &nbsp;who would\nthrow the MANNEQUIN CHALLENGE ( Syrian white helmets fame ) whenever he got caught.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EHwLkAEXnXI/WNuG0pMstiI/AAAAAAABR7Y/bT1E8Mi9CkYkqXYpwAbdQBjXQHPABWxEwCLcB/s1600/144441dd6560141.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"358\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EHwLkAEXnXI/WNuG0pMstiI/AAAAAAABR7Y/bT1E8Mi9CkYkqXYpwAbdQBjXQHPABWxEwCLcB/s640/144441dd6560141.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wiki-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; In 1999, while working as a commentator in\nSouth Africa, Roebuck met three cricketers, all aged 19, and offered to coach\nthem, inviting them to live at his home in England. He warned them beforehand\nthat he would use corporal punishment if they failed to obey his \"house\nrules\". He caned all three men on their (clothed) buttocks at different\ntimes for misbehaviour and in 2001 was given a suspended jail sentence after\npleading guilty to three charges of common assault.[20] He told the court,\n\"Obviously I misjudged the mood and that was my mistake and my\nresponsibility and I accept that.\"[24] Henk Lindeque, one of Roebuck\u2019s\nvictims, said, \"The problem was not so much that he caned us but wanted to\nexamine the marks. That\u2019s when I decided to get out of his house.\" Roebuck\narrived in Cape Town, South Africa, on 7 November 2011 to report on a Test\nMatch between South Africa and Australia for The Sydney Morning Herald and the\nAustralian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC).[26] He was staying at the Southern\nSun Hotel in Newlands, Cape Town, on 12 November, when the South African Police\nService entered the hotel, claiming to desire to speak to him about an alleged\nsexual assault on a 26-year-old Zimbabwean man.[27][28] The man had alleged\nthat Roebuck had \"groomed\" him through Facebook, asking him to\n\"bring [a] stick in case I need to beat you\" once they had arranged\nto meet. At their claimed meeting Roebuck allegedly pinned the man to a hotel\nbed and sexually assaulted him, leaving him feeling suicidal.[28]After\nrequesting that he be allowed to go to his room to change his clothes, Roebuck\ncalled the ABC's Jim Maxwell in his hotel room and asked him to find him a\nlawyer and to then come to his hotel room.[29]At 9.15pm, Roebuck died after\njumping from the sixth floor of the Southern Sun Hotel.[30] UNQUOTE </span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.smh.com.au/sport/cricket/the-roebuck-tragedy-a-tale-of-love-beatings-and-blackmail-20111231-1pgmk.html\">http://www.smh.com.au/sport/cricket/the-roebuck-tragedy-a-tale-of-love-beatings-and-blackmail-20111231-1pgmk.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: times new roman, serif;\"><b>THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 31 , BELOW--</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: times new roman, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_33.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_33.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-xI9Pnl2kAMs/WNq1k5cJjHI/AAAAAAABR64/_yJIUYw0p7ELy86DgpdzagFfd9cRosDOACLcB/s1600/photo%2B%252810%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-xI9Pnl2kAMs/WNq1k5cJjHI/AAAAAAABR64/_yJIUYw0p7ELy86DgpdzagFfd9cRosDOACLcB/s640/photo%2B%252810%2529.jpg\" width=\"346\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "115", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2042174496748794790/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "300098356946229245", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-28T02:02:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-29T00:48:19+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwNzI4Njk5NDk0Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_28.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/300098356946229245", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 29 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 28, BELOW----</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_27.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_27.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strawbuyer/Fictitious\nBidder--- The debtor sells assets to a court-approved buyer and the assets are\nsecretly resold at a profit pursuant to a previous agreement with a third\nparty.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where fictitious bidding is suspected, creditors should require a\nstatement to the effect that the buyer is bidding for himself or have him state\nthe purpose of the purchase. False statement prosecutions have been brought\nwhere this statement is false.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Examples Of Straw\nBuyer/Fictitious Bidder---- Kickbacks: An insider agrees to sell assets to a\npurchaser who agrees to pay the insider a kickback. The purchase price\ndisclosed in the motion to sell is less than the price agreed upon by the\ninsider and the purchaser. When the sale is completed, the debtor receives the difference\nbetween the court-approved price and the undisclosed sale price.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Straw Sales:--- Insider\nwants to conceal his purchase of estate assets because he wants to orchestrate\nthe sale to allow him to buy the assets for a depressed price. A fictitious purchaser\nor nominee is used to acquire the assets. Once the sale is consummated, the assets\nare transferred to the insider for a fee. Insider and purchaser do not disclose\nthe relationship to the court. Oftentimes, both parties will make affirmative\nstatements claiming there are no connections or agreements between them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red Flags/Common\nCharacteristics:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Pre-existing,\nundisclosed relationship between the debtor and the straw buyer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Sale terms are\nstructured to prefer one bidder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Inadequate or no\neffort to locate other purchasers. Advertising not placed in appropriate newspapers\nor journals to reach potential purchasers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Unusually high bid-protection\nor break-up fees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 High price offered,\nbut broad terms allow the purchasers substantial setoff rights.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Purchaser is\nrepresented by counsel with close ties to debtor\u2019s counsel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Debtor interferes\nwith potential purchasers\u2019 due diligence efforts.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Short notice request\non sale because of \u201cemergency\u201d situation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serial Filers---- The\ndebtor, typically an individual, files numerous cases to take advantage of the\nautomatic stay to prevent eviction, foreclosure and collection on other debts.\nThe petitions usually contain false social security numbers, variations of the\ndebtor's name or fictitious names.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dEpgNgHxUlU/WNl9PkVTe1I/AAAAAAABR5g/PeE9PgQ4nZ4dRA35L7c5sfO0Fxj68fGNQCLcB/s1600/imasages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"346\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dEpgNgHxUlU/WNl9PkVTe1I/AAAAAAABR5g/PeE9PgQ4nZ4dRA35L7c5sfO0Fxj68fGNQCLcB/s400/imasages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapter 7 and Chapter\n13 cases are filed interchangeable in USA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most bankruptcies filed\nin the Unites States are either Chapter 7 or Chapter 13 cases.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whether a\nChapter 7 or Chapter 13 bankruptcy is the right choice for you depends on your\nincome, assets, debts, and your financial goals.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapter 7 is a\nliquidation bankruptcy designed to wipe out your general unsecured debts such\nas credit cards and medical bills. To qualify for Chapter 7 bankruptcy, you\nmust have little or no disposable income. If you make too much money, you may\nbe required to file a Chapter 13 bankruptcy (discussed below).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you file for\nChapter 7 bankruptcy, a trustee is appointed to administer your case. In\naddition to reviewing your bankruptcy papers and supporting documents, the\nChapter 7 trustee\u2019s job is to sell your nonexempt property to pay back your\ncreditors.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you don\u2019t have any nonexempt assets, your creditors receive\nnothing. As a result, Chapter 7 bankruptcy is typically for low-income debtors\nwith little or no assets who want to get rid of their unsecured debts.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapter\n13 is a reorganization bankruptcy designed for debtors with regular income who\ncan pay back at least a portion of their debts through a repayment plan. If you\nmake too much money to qualify for Chapter 7 bankruptcy, you may have no choice\nbut to file a Chapter 13 case. However, many debtors choose to file for&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapter\n13 bankruptcy because it offers many benefits that Chapter 7 bankruptcy does\nnot (such as the ability to catch up on missed mortgage payments or strip\nwholly unsecured junior liens from your house).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Chapter 13\nbankruptcy, you get to keep all of your property (including nonexempt assets).\nIn exchange, you pay back all or a portion of your debts through a repayment\nplan (the amount you must pay back depends on your income, expenses, and types\nof debt). For this reason, Chapter 13 is commonly referred to as a\nreorganization bankruptcy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Typically, Chapter 13 bankruptcy is for debtors who\ncan afford to make monthly payments to get caught up on missed mortgage or car\npayments or pay off nondischargeable debts such as alimony or child support\narrears.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red Flags/Common\nCharacteristics:-----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Debtor has filed a\nhigh number of cases in a short period of time<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Debtor does not\ndisclose prior bankruptcy cases<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Debtor uses different\ncounsel to file each case<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Chapter 13 cases\nnever completed because of failure to fund-plan</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7 Debtor had been\nprohibited from filing a case<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again---Bankruptcy\nFraud Warning Signs:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Concealment of\nassets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Serial bankruptcy\ncases<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Failure to keep\nusual business records<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Incomplete or\nmissing books and records<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Conduct well outside\nordinary business or industry standards and &nbsp;practices<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Unusual depletion of\nassets shortly before the bankruptcy filing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Recent departure of\ndebtor's officers, directors or general &nbsp;partners<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8. Unanswered questions\nor incomplete information on debtor\u2019s &nbsp;schedules and statement of financial affairs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9. Frequent amendments\nto schedules, statements of financial &nbsp;affairs and monthly operating reports<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10. Inconsistencies\namong recent financial statements, tax returns &nbsp;and debtor's schedules and statements of\nfinancial affairs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11. Absence of\nknowledgeable officers to testify at the meeting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12. Inability to\ncontact principals of debtor at debtor\u2019s stated location<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">14. Frequent dealings\nin cash rather than recorded transactions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">15. Sudden depletion of\ninventory post-petition without plausible &nbsp;explanation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">16. Inflated salaries,\npayments of bonuses or cash withdrawals by officers, directors, shareholders or\nother insiders<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">17. Transfer of property\nto insiders, shareholders and relatives shortly before bankruptcy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18. Payoff of loans to\ndirectors, officers, shareholders, relatives or other insiders shortly before\nfiling.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19. Transactions with\nnon-debtor subsidiaries, parent companies or affiliated corporations owned by\nthe same or related persons or entity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">20. A history of prior\nlitigation or post-petition litigation involving breech of contracts, fraud misrepresentations,\netc<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">21. Complicated\ncorporate structures and relationships.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22. Creditor confusion\nconcerning corporate structure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">23. Fire, theft or loss\nprior to or after filing. ( this always happens in India )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">24. Failure to pay\nwithholding and sales tax.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">25. Startup of a\nsimilar business near the time of bankruptcy filing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_20M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_28.html?showComment=1490667531476#c6095698135201365827\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 28, 2017 at 7:48 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_20MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/michael-ferreira-gets-bail-after-sc-stays-qnet-multilevel-marketing-cases/articleshow/57864143.cms</span><br />\n<br />\nSUBRATA ROY , INDIAs LARGEST EMPLOYER AFTER RAILWAYS HAS BEEN JAILED AND HIS BAIL SET TO THOUSANDS OF CRORES ..<br />\n<br />\nYET THIS CRIMINAL FELLOW MICHAEL FERREIRA IS FREE ?<br />\n<br />\nDID HE NOT KNOW THAT HE WAS DUPING PEOPLE ?<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/amway-merchants-of-pipe-dreams-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nIt is a FRAUD when your income is based mainly on the number of people you recruit, and the money those new recruits pay to join the company \u2014 not on the sales of products to consumers<br />\n<br />\nYou\u2019re required to buy lots of inventory<br />\n<br />\nYou\u2019re forced to buy other things you don\u2019t want or need just to stay in good standing with the company<br />\n<br />\nTHEY HOLD SEMINARS TO PICK ON THE GREED OF PEOPLE --BY SHOWING RAGS TO RICHES STORIES.. THE PEOPLE ARE BRAINWASHED TO GET STARS IN THEIR EYES<br />\n<br />\nMONEY IS SQUEEZED OUT OF NEW INVESTORS TO PAY OFF OLD ONES<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nA Pyramid Scheme ( Ponzi ) is a multi-level marketing (MLM) program that cannot support itself because earning money, and/or advancing within the system depends on recruiting other people into the operation, rather than selling a product or providing a service.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe words \u201cPonzi\u201d and \u201cPyramid\u201d are often used interchangeably but, as evidenced by the examples provided, they are different \u2013 the principal difference being that a Ponzi scheme has only one \u201cofficial\u201d promoter.<br />\n<br />\nOtherwise, they have much in common. Both are fraudulent \u201cinvestment schemes\u201d promising unrealistic returns on investment capital, both typically encourage investors to reinvest their profits, both depend upon new investors to satisfy their obligations to prior investors, both are continually insolvent and both are against the law.<br />\n<br />\nThe victims of a Ponzi Scheme are innocent victims, but the victims of Pyramid Schemes victimize others in that they directly promote the criminal enterprise<br />\n<br />\nAvoid any program they must pay to join where they are promised a commission based upon their success in recruiting investors or a \u201cdownline.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nAvoid plans requiring the purchase of expensive products and marketing materials (often called tools).<br />\n<br />\nBeware of shills - \"decoy\" references paid by a plan's promoter to lie about their earnings through the plan. You can see them at seminars .<br />\n<br />\nRemember the old adage that if something seems too good to be true, then it probably is. People that promise instant riches are often scammers just looking to make a quick buck.<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />http://www.mid-day.com/articles/michael-ferreira-qnet-scam-first-person-account-billiards-champion-mumbai/17659167</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Five years ago Triple Sri Ravishankar fooled\nthe students of IIT&nbsp; Kanpur with some\nbullshit oil drops.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qd2N9pIl9P8/WNnJkylzEYI/AAAAAAABR5w/D-3OxhFFbLQXEdrSuE6pqRUb2zIzRaPJQCLcB/s1600/BefHWTDore-300x253.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"539\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qd2N9pIl9P8/WNnJkylzEYI/AAAAAAABR5w/D-3OxhFFbLQXEdrSuE6pqRUb2zIzRaPJQCLcB/s640/BefHWTDore-300x253.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Triple Sri called for a volunteer to come up\non stage for a \u201cpatented\u201d magic oil surprise demonstration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">One of the students from the back rows of the\nauditorium was chosen to share the dais. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The chosen volunteer, a male student wearing\na black t-shirt with horizontal white stripes, was asked to extend his arm\nparallel to the floor, clinch his fist and resist the pulling down of his\narm.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Triple Sri &nbsp;gripping the volunteer\u2019s arm near the wrist,\nwas able to pull down his arm easily over and over again, much to the\namusement&nbsp; of the na\u00efve audience.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">He then produced from his pocket a small vial\ncontaining some oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EqduVhYtmmM/WNnLS_G7eqI/AAAAAAABR6E/XA1yIhIlPBknJxCfa5cDDhdhGnYkeMynACLcB/s1600/big1.197dd3221.3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EqduVhYtmmM/WNnLS_G7eqI/AAAAAAABR6E/XA1yIhIlPBknJxCfa5cDDhdhGnYkeMynACLcB/s400/big1.197dd3221.3.jpg\" width=\"265\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The volunteer was then asked to rub and\nspread this oil over his arm. After the volunteer took a step back and a deep\nbreath to relax, the whole exercise was repeated again \u2013 except this time\nTriple Sri with his gargantuan paunch struggled quite hard to pull down the\nvolunteer\u2019s arm, amazing the vast audience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The volunteer, visibly impressed and\nbelieving that he had in fact become stronger in a matter of seconds after the\napplication of the oil, went onto fall at the feet (cultural practice of\nsurrender) of the extraordinary messiah Triple Sri.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Following the thundering applause from his\ngullible audience, Mr. Ravishankar went on to urge stronger volunteers to come\nforth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The next male volunteer also went on to fall\nat the feet of Mr. Ravishankar after his new found strength.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The frenzy in the arena attracted a male\n\"skeptic\" from the audience to volunteer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">He was visibly unimpressed by the arm pull\ndown test and the claim of instantaneous improvement of strength and vigor following\nthe application of a few drops of oil.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The skeptic boldly asked for permission to\nperform the same test on his own test subject on the dais.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KKyXqyfXTwo/WNnK2nUtygI/AAAAAAABR6A/4APILtCl0ekXN7HnaShwlvn3N14iFASWACLcB/s1600/wwdownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"452\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KKyXqyfXTwo/WNnK2nUtygI/AAAAAAABR6A/4APILtCl0ekXN7HnaShwlvn3N14iFASWACLcB/s640/wwdownload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While the skeptic readied his subjects,\nTriple Sri changed his track and launched into a astounding theory for his\nprecious oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">He spAke&nbsp; &nbsp; </span><b style=\"background-color: white;\">\u201cone drop of poison can destroy the body. &nbsp;Can it not destroy? &nbsp;One drop\nof poison can destroy the immune system. &nbsp;No? &nbsp; HOOO ? &nbsp;No ? &nbsp;The reverse can also\nhappen \u2013 one drop of nectar can also strengthen your body.\u201d</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The \u201ctest subjects\u201d chosen by the\n\u201cskeptic\u201d gave testimonies to the audience that they felt \u201csomething\ndifferent,\u201d and the skeptic had to agree, on the microphone, that he was convinced\nof the power of the messiah and his great oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Montserrat, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, Avenir, sans-serif; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.75em; margin-bottom: 15px; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation;\">\nHomosexuality-not a crime in any Smriti. Everyone has male &amp; female elements. According to their dominance,tendencies show up &amp; may change.</div>\n<div style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Montserrat, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, Avenir, sans-serif; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.75em; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation;\">\n\u2014 Sri Sri Ravi Shankar (@SriSriSpeaks)&nbsp;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/SriSriSpeaks/statuses/410812289499942912\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; background-color: transparent; box-sizing: border-box; color: #1da1f2; cursor: pointer; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-decoration: none; touch-action: manipulation;\" target=\"_blank\">December 11, 2013</a></div>\n</blockquote>\n<div style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.75em; margin-bottom: 15px; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation;\">\n<br /></div>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" lang=\"en\" style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-image: initial; background-origin: initial; background-position: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-size: initial; border-radius: 6px; border: 1px solid rgb(223, 223, 223); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.34902) 0px 1px 3px -1px; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 12px; margin: 20px auto; max-width: 600px; padding: 10px 20px 10px 55px; position: relative;\">\n<div style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Montserrat, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, Avenir, sans-serif; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.75em; margin-bottom: 15px; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation;\">\nNobody should face discrimination because of their sexual preferences. To be branded a criminal for this is absurd.</div>\n<div style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Montserrat, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, Avenir, sans-serif; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.75em; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation;\">\n\u2014 Sri Sri Ravi Shankar (@SriSriSpeaks)&nbsp;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/SriSriSpeaks/statuses/410818615433117697\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; background-color: transparent; box-sizing: border-box; color: #1da1f2; cursor: pointer; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-decoration: none; touch-action: manipulation;\" target=\"_blank\">December 11, 2013</a></div>\n</blockquote>\n<br style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;\" />\n<div class=\"content-wap-ros ad text-center\" style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; height: auto; margin: 0px auto; padding: 0px; position: relative; text-align: center; touch-action: manipulation; z-index: 1;\">\n<div id=\"FIRSTPOST_WAP/FIRSTPOST_WAP_ROS/FP_WAP_ROS_300x250_2\" style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; box-sizing: border-box; height: auto; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation; transition: all 1s ease;\">\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased; background-color: white; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &quot;Frank Ruhl Libre&quot;, Georgia, serif; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.75em; margin-bottom: 15px; padding: 0px; touch-action: manipulation;\">\nPublished Date: Dec 12, 2013 03:19 pm | Updated Date: Dec 12, 2013 03:19 pm</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While Finance Minister\nArun Jaitley's Budget speech in February suggested that steps will be taken to\nmake donations to political parties more transparent, there is a provision in\nthe Bill that will do just the opposite.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bill introduces electoral bonds,\nwhich make it more convenient to donate without being noticed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.realityviews.in/2017/03/legally-now-companies-can-pay-unlimited.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.realityviews.in/2017/03/legally-now-companies-can-pay-unlimited.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here is an excerpt from\nJaitley addressing the media, explaining in his own words this debatable\nconcept and revealing how easy it would be to give money anonymously:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"The system\ninvolves the following steps. The donor and the donee will get tax exemptions\nprovided the returns are filed by the political party. Donations of four kinds\nare encouraged: Donate by cheque, digital mode, cash donation limited to Rs\n2,000 per person, and lastly there is a provision of electoral bonds which\nrequires an amendment to the RBI Act. A notified bank will be issuing those\nbonds. Any donor can buy those bonds using cheque or digital money. These bonds\ncan be given to the political party. Every recognised political party will have\nto notify one bank account in advance to the Election Commission and these can\nbe redeemed in only that account in a very short time. These bonds will be\nbearer in character to keep the donor anonymous.\"</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The RBI and I-T Act\nwill be amended so that no parties have to keep records of the donor in the\ncase of electoral bonds. There will no longer be a cap on the amount of\ndonations an individual can give as long as it is given by cheque or digitally.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaitley also rejected a\nsuggestion for making PAN and Aadhaar mandatory for cash donations to make it\nmore transparent, saying it was not feasible, particularly in rural areas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bringing down the cash\ndonation limit to Rs 2,000 from Rs 20,000 will not change much as people will\njust get ten times the receipts they used to get earlier.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cash donations be\ncompletely stopped.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">US government stopped\nselling bearer bonds in 1982 in a bid to increase transparency.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They allow\nlarge sums of money to be moved around easily, with full anonymity. A bearer\nbond is a bond or debt security issued by a business entity such as a\ncorporation, or a government. As a bearer instrument, it differs from the more\ncommon types of investment securities in that it is unregistered \u2013 no records\nare kept of the owner, or the transactions involving ownership.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whoever\nphysically holds the paper on which the bond is issued owns the instrument.\nThis is useful for investors who wish to retain anonymity. Recovery of the\nvalue of a bearer bond in the event of its loss, theft, or destruction is\nusually impossible.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bearer bonds have historically been the financial\ninstrument of choice for money laundering, tax evasion, and concealed business\ntransactions in general. In the United States all the bearer bonds issued by\nthe U.S. Treasury have matured. They no longer pay interest to the holders<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before the bond market\ndeveloped, India had a number of bearer bonds, usually called debentures when\nissued by a company. But the last major one launched by the government was in\n1981, ( BY Indira Gandhi ) as an income disclosure scheme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The face value of the\nbond was Rs10,000 and maturity was for 10 years. Anyone could buy the bonds\nwithout inviting any scrutiny from the government.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The income tax department\nwas prohibited from harassing buyers and the bond could be even bought with\nanonymity. \u201cNo person who has subscribed to or has otherwise acquired Special\nBearer Bonds shall be required to disclose, for any purpose whatsoever, the\nnature and source of acquisition of such Bonds,\u201d the Special Bearer Bonds\n(Immunities And Exemptions) Act, 1981, read.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Add to it, \u201cno inquiry or\ninvestigation shall be commenced against any person under any such law on the\nground that such person has subscribed to or has otherwise acquired Special\nBearer Bonds.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In an income tax raid,\nother assets could be seized but not the special bonds, which could be bought\nthrough foreign currencies also. At the time of maturity, buyers would get\nRs12,000 as face value. If one had purchased these bonds in 1981 for Rs10,000,\nhe could redeem it in 1991 for Rs12,000.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was a clean amnesty\nscheme and was lapped up by investors. A substantial amount of these could have\nbeen converted to legal money through the special bond scheme. The rider was\nthat the money could be considered as \u201cwhite\u201d only after the bonds matured in\n1991.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Compared to this scheme, the income disclosure schemes announced by the\npresent government, where black money could be converted into white by paying\n50 per cent taxes, looked tame.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another famous bearer\nbond, issued in 1987 through post offices, was the Indira Vikas Patra. The bond\nwas eventually scrapped.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally, in the\nIndian context, you find the word debenture and bonds being used\ninterchangeably.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A debenture is a debt\ninstrument which is not backed by any specific security; instead the credit of\nthe company issuing the same is the underlying security. Corporate treasury use\nthis as a tool to raise medium- to long-term funds. The funds raised become\npart of the capital structure but not share capital of the company.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bonds, however, in\nIndia are typically issued by financial institutions, government undertakings\nand large companies. The interest rate is assured and is paid at a fixed\ninterval, i.e. on an annual or semi-annual basis. On maturity, the principal is\nrepaid.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bond is a form of loan. The holder of the bond is the lender and the\nissuer of the bond is the borrower.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3493538827851943400\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_55M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_28.html?showComment=1490701208035#c3493538827851943400\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 28, 2017 at 5:10 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_55MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nDONALD TRUMP--<br />\n<br />\nBE ON THE SAME PAGE WITH PUTIN AND MODI ( ABOLISH CARBON TAX ) BEFORE G20 AT HAMBURG IN THE FIRST WEEK OF JULY 2017...<br />\n<br />\nSIFT THE FOCUS FROM CARBON DI OXIDE TO METHANE AND NITROUS OXIDE..<br />\n<br />\nMETHANE WILL KILL THIS PLANET.. IT IS A TIME BOMB CURRENTLY TICKING AWAY....<br />\n<br />\nCut through the bullshit--<br />\n<br />\nCarbon tax is a price instrument.. while Cap-and-trade is a quantity instrument<br />\n<br />\nONLY JEWS MAKE MONEY OUT OF THIN AIR BY SITTING ON THEIR ASSES..<br />\n<br />\nA carbon tax imposes a tax on each unit of greenhouse gas emissions and gives firms .<br />\n<br />\nThe tax is set by assessing the cost or damage associated with each unit of pollution and the costs associated with controlling that pollution. Getting the tax level right is key: too low and firms and households are likely to opt for paying the tax and continuing to pollute, over and above what is optimal for society. Too high and the costs will rise higher than necessary to reduce emissions, impacting on profits, jobs and end consumers.<br />\n<br />\nBy contrast, a cap-and-trade system sets a maximum level of pollution, a cap, and distributes emissions permits among firms that produce emissions. Companies must have a permit to cover each unit of pollution they produce, and they can obtain these permits either through an initial allocation or auction, or through trading with other firms.<br />\n<br />\nSince some firms inevitably find it easier or cheaper to reduce pollution than others, trading takes place. Whilst the maximum pollution quantity is set in advance, the trading price of permits fluctuates, becoming more expensive when demand is high relative to supply (for example when the economy is growing) and cheaper when demand is lower (for example in a recession). A price on pollution is therefore created as a result of setting a ceiling on the overall quantity of emissions.<br />\n<br />\nIn certain idealized circumstances, carbon taxes and cap-and-trade have exactly the same outcomes, since they are both ways to price carbon.<br />\n<br />\nHowever, in reality they differ in many ways.<br />\n<br />\nWith cap-and-trade, it has often been the case that permits are given out for free initially (known as \"grandfathering\"). This means cheaper compliance for industry in the early stages of the scheme, because they only pay for any extra permits bought from other firms \u2013 not for the initial tranche of permits given to them to cover most of their emissions under 'business as usual'.<br />\n<br />\nThis approach is obviously popular with industry and explains why grandfathering has been used, since it helps get firms to accept controls on emissions in the first place. By contrast, with a tax there is an immediate cost for businesses to pay on every unit of greenhouse gas produced, so there is a bigger initial hit to the balance sheet.
